Private Instance: Test

<u>Ost Dunhoth</u> \qFrom behind the walls of Ost Dunhoth, a terrible foe sends his malice out into Middle-earth. Gortheron, greatest of the Gaunt-lords, must be defeated before his plans can come to fruition….\q

<u>Barad Gúlaran</u> \qHaving obtained all the tools they need to contain a terrible spell, the sorcerers of Angmar retreat to Barad Gúlaran to fulfil the commands of their mistress Amarthiel, while the Rangers of the North seek to hinder them....\q
<u>The Daring Strike, Dawn</u> \qDawn came swiftly on the twenty-fifth of February, as my Prince prepared to conduct his daring strike.\q
The waters of the Bruinen prevented the Black Riders from entering Rivendell, but nothing has been heard of them since. Their fate remains yet to be seen.

Very little information has gleaned about the Black Riders' locations, so your party looks to the Great Eagles for possible answers. However, the dangers that stalk Eregion might affect your endeavors….
As your party climbs the slopes of the Redhorn, the twins grow silent and conversation comes to a standstill. Only the howling wind fills the air now.
The uneventful trip through the Dimrill Dale does not seem to shake the twins' apprehension, nor does the sight of the river Nimrodel.
Though your party made haste towards northern Lórien, the sight that greets you at Talan Revail is anything but encouraging.
<u>The Smell of Revolt</u> \qLotho's plans to change the Bounds in Yondershire must be stopped. Luckily, Fredegar Bolger has a plan of his own.\q

<u>Instance: Delving of Glimmerdeep</u> \qThe Orkish claimants to Glimmerdeep have been thrown into disarray. Those who would seek to return the mines to order must first join the chaos and lay claim to the rich resources found there.\q

<u>Instance: Reclamation of the Steel Keep</u> \qThe daring may choose to enter the Steel Keep in search of its ancient secrets. Yet they would do well to be wary. Although Karazgar has been driven from those halls, they remain far from safe to trespass.\q
<u>Battle For Maurûsh</u> \qThe time has come to fight with Galâmka and the refugees to reclaim the stronghold of Maurûsh from the Orcs.\q

<u>Stoneheight</u> \qStoneheight was once a place of refuge from the Orc-tribes in the North Downs, but now their walls have been breached. Yet even as the houses burn and crumble to the ground, you notice that it was not Orcs alone that did this.\q
<u>A Waxing Moon</u> \qFor what reason did the servants of the Enemy seal this hall? It is untouched by evil and disturbed only by dust.\q
<u>The Matron and the Master</u> \qTwo terrible beasts, Bangrath and Murragrath, threaten the safety of the Trév Gallorg, the Hillmen of Aughaire. Their reign of terror must be put to an end.\q

<u>Mysteries To Unravel</u> \qFor reasons unknown, Aighrig of the Trév Dúvardain has ventured alone into the Angmarim encampment of Dûn Traikh. With the Angmarim bent upon hunting her down, the situation has grown dire.\q

<u>First of the Heirs</u> \qAfter rallying the Ruthless Dead in Blackroot Vale, Azruthor returned to Tarlang's Crown. There, he now leads a great army that awaits his command to raze the lands of Anfalas to the west.\q
<u>The Great Hall of Durin</u> \qYou have met a dwarf passing through Zelem-melek in the Great Hall of Durin, but it would seem that not all is well in his travels.\q
<u>A Trail of Vengeance</u> \qYou and Cyneberg have come upon a trail of slaughtered Orcs, with no idea who may have killed them.\q
Dourhands have found the Glimmerdeep and seek to mine what they can from its depths….
Dourhands have found the Glimmerdeep and seek to mine what they can from its depths….
Dourhands have found the Glimmerdeep and seek to mine what they can from its depths….
<u>Flight of the TBD</u> \qNone seem to know what befell Hármelak or Khôltekh during the uprising. We may never know.\q
<u>A Mending</u> \qWe walked toward the setting sun, but our progress was slow.\q
<u>Down Payment</u> \qYou find the house that was purchased is not very well kept, and seems to have unwanted occupants....\q

<u>The Caravan to Snowbourn</u> \qFearing for the safety of my people, I have decreed that my son, Gísling, is to escort the crofters of Garsfeld to safety within the walls of Snowbourn. However, the road south is fraught with danger as foes approach from all directions....\q
Brigands are attacking Iridír! The village must be defended.

<u>Salves for a Ravaged Land, Part 5</u> \qNow we return to Vartúlin, buoyed by our triumph. But something seems amiss, the wind tastes bitter. Thórvilon is gathered with others near Milingor's Veroth. What has happened?\q
<u>Weapons of the Enemy</u> \qPlagued by terrible dreams in the House of Elrond, Laerdan reveals in his sleep that Amarthiel's ring, Narchuil, is being held in the fastness of Barad Dúrgul.\q

<u>Depths of Mâkhda Khorbo</u> \qAfter the confrontation in the Citadel of Winds, the ship bearing Azagath, Belondor, and Nakási, Reaper of the Waves sails north-west into the shadow cast by the Mâkhda Khorbo. Pursuing the trio, you enter the depths of a long-hidden cavern leading through dank, twisting passages ending at an iron-wrought gate. The smells of the sea, iron, and ash assail you as you press deeper beneath the land and closer to the remnants of the temple ruins.\q

<u>Father of our Lament</u> \qThe oath of Fernvael, father of Cadelhin, binds the shades of the Lich Bluffs to their earthly tombs. The only hope remaining for these poor spirits is the defeat of their dark ruler….\q
<u>The Infiltrators' Surprise</u> \qAn unsavoury band of the Big Folk have assembled and are planning a frightening surprise for Bree! I hope my new friend can stop them!\q

<u>Instance: A Troubling Report</u> \qScout Molkha has a troubling report to share: The Frost-bound Hobgoblins, the Angmarim, and the Drakes of the Frost-horde are negotiating alliances, and using fallen dwarves as bargaining chips.\q
<u>Instance: The Tipping Point</u> \qScout Klúso has an interesting report to share: Relations between the Orcs and hobgoblins may have finally reached a tipping point....\q

<u>Instance: The Giant's Den</u> \qHórin believes the best course of action is to enter Thyrstáth on a diplomatic mission. Your aim is to prevent the ice-giants from also falling under the sway of Hrímil and her Frost-horde.\q

<u>Instance: A Clandestine Meeting</u> \qScout Kyrstig has an important report to share: a secret meeting between Loknashra and the leader of the Cult of Drugoth hints at their true motives in the region....\q

<u>Instance: The Secret Ritual</u> \qUgarad the Harbinger intends to perform a secret ritual to impart the strength of the Gauntlord Drugoth into Loknashra of the Frost-bound. You and Hórin must stop this ritual before it is too late!\q

<u>Instance: The Warlord's Gambit</u> \qYou have reached the end of the Father's Path, and Warlord Dushtalbúk must be ahead. His reason for marching to the mountain's peak is about to be revealed....\q
<u>Mekeb-faham</u> \qThe Dwarves of Moria had a rich history. Their scholars worked diligently transcribing plans, tactics, and epic stories to parchment so that they might remember the past.\q
Deep under the Three Peaks of Gundabad, nameless things have constructed a shrine to Throkhâr The Hunger, their lord….
<u>The King and the Steward</u> \qThe gates of the city lie before us. It is time at last.\q
<u>Judgements of the King</u> \qMany are the matters set before the throne on this day. May I rule justly, for the good of Gondor!\q
<u>The Wizard and the King</u> \qNight blankets the city, but we have climbed in darkness high above Minas Tirith. I know not Mithrandir's purpose.\q
<u>A True Friend of Gondor</u> \qA new White Tree will grow in the Court of the Fountain. May Gondor prosper!\q
<u>Glade of the Three Merry-makers</u> \qRhûd-pulo-Drât, a wise Drúadan, leads you to a sacred grove of Púkel-men statues in order to ward away the mysterious beasts that invade the Drúadan Forest.\q
<u>Lost Shadows</u> \qTracking down the Dheghûn has led you to an old mining chasm in Nardol Quarry. You should search the caverns for the source of these mysterious beasts.\q

<u>Man and Monster</u> \qThe Ent, Mossbeard, wishes to tell you more of what he has learned from the trees of Balewood. Núrzum's might stems not from within, but from the vile stone upon his back granted to him by a powerful benefactor.\q
<u>The Moon Over Ambarûl</u> \qMy mother will be impressed by our successes when we arrive back at Iridír!\q
<u>Beyond Living Memory</u> \qRest well. If you should dream, rue it not! The dreamless sleep holds no wisdom.\q
<u>Among Enemies</u> \qAzagath slew my captors in Jirush, but I felt no gratitude to him. I fled from him, seeking somewhere to hide.\q
<u>A Journey Into Danger</u> \qWe must speak only quietly, or we shall be discovered.\q
<u>Heirloom of the Tribes</u> \qYour efforts to cleanse the evils from the corrupted needle have led you to the oldest woman in Lhanuch, and the story she has to tell....\q
<u>Running Towards Nothing</u> \qGreat and terrible things lurk in the dark of the forest. If any of the refugees from Byre Tor yet survive, they will need aid.\q

<u>A Well-Ordered Mind</u> \qDorset Oakes, the son of a Lore-master now dead, seeks the knowledge contained in his father's old library and is prepared to hunt for the pages to the catalogue his father had written; however, goblins have been digging in the caves near the library and may soon break through....\q
<u>Two Hobbits</u> \qThose footprints are hobbit-sized! What became of our mutual friends on that dangerous day?\q
<u>Trouble in Tuckborough</u> \qBrigands and goblins are laying siege to the Great Smials. Food supplies are low, and time is running short....\q

<u>Unfinished Business</u> \qUnder the cover of night, you and Mekhnet have stealthily crept past the threshold of Atrad-zarakh. Thraunákh tinkers away at his sapper-bombs somewhere deeper in, oblivious to the death that awaits him.\q
<u>The Ghost Returns</u> \qThis land is new to me, but it will be good to see an old friend. Will she be pleased to see us, I wonder?\q
<u>Othrongroth</u> \qOthrongroth, the Great Barrow, the oldest and largest of the Edain mounds within the Barrow-downs... and home to some of the most terrifying servants of the Witch-king.\q
<u>Vóin's Tale</u> \qWhat secrets did Vóin hide within these Halls of Memory? Let us now discover them, my friend.\q
<u>The Wanderer's Confession</u> \qThis is my tale. Hear it, and know from whence I came.\q
<u>His Father's Son</u> \qNever before had I known such despair.\q
<u>The Disaster</u> \qThe second attack was more fierce than the first had been. Isildur's defeat seemed certain.\q
<u>Freed of the Burden</u> \qWhat secrets did she add to the Halls of Memory? I wonder…\q
<u>Closing the Book</u> \qI leave the final disposition of the Black Book up to you, my friend.\q

<u>The Fall of Moria</u> \qToo deep and too greedily the dwarves delved. Little did they know what darkness truly lay in the deep places of the Misty Mountains, but Durin would not be dissuaded. Alas, what sorrow and shadows would come to Moria....\q

<u>Instance: Stangraf</u> \qThe mines of Stangraf have been overrun by the forces of Isengard. Stangraf contains a wealth of resources that must not fall into Saruman's hands. Remove the invaders, and recover as many resources as you can.\q
<u>An Audience with the Storm</u> \qMembers of the Kindred of the Coins take petitions from nobles throughout Umbar. Rothog has summoned you to his chambers to hear one specific complaint.\q

<u>The Tribunal of Shadows</u> \qAt last, we have tracked Gwyllion, whom the Dunlendings call the Old Woman of the Mountain, here to the Gravenwood. Whatever foul plot she has put in motion must be stopped at the Slade of Shadows....\q

<u>Dahâl Huliz, The Arena</u> \qThe gladiator pits of Umbar Baharbêl are an instrumental aspect of the Umbaran culture. The battles in the arena of Umbar serve many purposes to the city. Foremost, the arena battles entertain the masses. Second, the arena battles serve to mete out justice against the city's greatest offenders. Since taking control of Umbar, the Kindred of the Coins altered the arena's rules. Capital punishment and wanton death are a thing of the cruel past. Combat is now a sport for the masses to engage with and enjoy. Anyone can enter the pit to enhance their glory. The gladiators bound to the arena serve their sentences by entering battle and fighting to the end....\q
<u>Núrzum</u> \qWhile I remain behind, my friends journey to Byre Tor to see what they can learn of Núrzum. Perhaps I worry unnecessarily, but what will I do if they are unable to return?\q
<u>The Bloom</u> \qCorudan says they have planted the seed of Núrzum's defeat, and we need only wait for it to bloom. Is he right? Can we trust this Ent?\q
<u>The King Rides West</u> \qThéoden King has mustered a force of more than a thousand spears and prepares to ride for Isengard. Will he return to Edoras in this life?\q

The hobbits in Hoarhallow are ever a thorn in the side of the forces at Gramsfoot. Foolish little creatures that serve as a good source of food, but their pointy weapons do more damage that the trouble they are usually worth. An easy way to destroy the village might be to destroy their food stores since they seem to eat... a lot.
<u>Pit of the Falcon</u> \qMeanwhile, in Tâl Methedras, the thirst for vengeance drives Golodir of the Dúnedain to seek out Lheu Brenin, the treacherous leader of the Falcon Clan.\q

<u>Last Stand</u> \qWildermore has suffered enough loss and heartbreak to last its people many lifetimes. With the return of Thrymm, the hero of the land, it is time for Núrzum's reign of terror to come to an end.\q
<u>The Gift of Greenleaves</u> \qMy story begins not long ago, at the Elven ruins of Rhosgobel.\q
Sírlond, the encampment outside of the ruins of Caranost, is under siege. Enter the fray and bolster the free peoples' forces.

<u>Skûmfil</u> \qSince the overthrow of Moria, the Orcs have disposed of their dead in the great chasm they call Skûmfil. Over the ages, the rotting pile of carcasses and filth that has accumulated there has also attracted many foul and disgusting creatures, from the vile Gredbyg to the scavenging Kergrim....\q
<u>Scatha's Legacy</u> \qFróthi, a Lore-master familiar with both Scatha and The Weeping Warrior, looks to examine what remains of the dragon necklace.\q
Brigand apothecaries are converting poison from usan-kûni. You need to destroy their workstations and defeat the apothecaries and their leader.
<u>Heeding the Call</u> \qWe can not allow Rhosgobel to fall into the claws of the Ungoledain!\q
<u>Blackwolds Broken</u> \qAmdir's defeat shattered the back of the Blackwolds, but pieces of the mystery remain unsolved....\q
<u>Heirloom of the Snowmen</u> \qYour efforts to cleanse the evils from the corrupted brooch have led you to the settlement of Sûri-kylä, where something is wrong....\q
<u>A Disturbance At the Gate</u> \qGárwig, the Reeve of Wildermore, has been summoned by a disturbance at the western gate of Forlaw.\q

<u>Skûmfil</u> \qSince the overthrow of Moria, the Orcs have disposed of their dead in the great chasm they call Skûmfil. Over the ages, the rotting pile of carcasses and filth that has accumulated there has also attracted many foul and disgusting creatures, from the vile Gredbyg to the scavenging Kergrim....\q
<u>A Game of Brigand-bashing</u> \qThe fearless children of Langhold have invited you to join them in a game of Brigand-bashing, in which they re-enact the deeds of their fathers and foes.\q
<u>Aldburg Convenes</u> \qThane Arcil and Éothain have gathered in the Mead Hall of Aldburg to state their cases and weigh the options that will afford the most benefit to Aldburg.\q
<u>The Battle for Dol Amroth</u> \qCorsairs from the south have taken the fortress city of Dol Amroth. Together with the swan-knights, you must aid in recapturing it.\q
<u>Hatred of Bear and Man</u> \qOfolmóth has brought this fate upon himself, but it does not make our duty of bringing him to justice any easier.\q
<u>The Speech of Animals</u> \qOoooh, I do not like this creepy forest, but I will show you where I saw that great beast of a bear!\q

<u>The Halls of Night</u> \qThe Hillmen of Angmar have discovered an ancient barrow hidden away for centuries. The leaders of Aughaire have called for adventurers willing to brave the tomb rumoured to be filled with wealth and riches. Markings surrounding its entrance bear an ominous warning; twisted creatures and slumbering warriors at the foot of a powerful sorcerer….\q

<u>Fangs of the Wulf</u> \qOf all the Ox-clan, I am the most canny, for I know best how to create my own opportunities... a broken sword here, a shattered shield there, and a crippled arm to wield them. Men, arms, and armour do not come cheaply.\q
The All-seeing are assaulting Kûr Anzar! Destroy their makeshift fortifications and repel the invading Barkhûshim forces.

<u>Mekeb-farak</u> \qWhen Moria fell, so too did its lore and legends. Within the halls of Mekeb-farak, the stories told by the Dwarves of Moria rest silent and dust covered, waiting for someone to find them.\q
Rumours tell of a mighty beast unlike any other. Deep in the Shield Isles it lies, who preying on Corsairs and freebooters alike. Venture forth and try to find and tame the mighty beast.
<u>The Storm Abated</u> \qArmed with proof of Shaidal's innocence, you approach Rothog the Storm with your findings.\q

As the War of Three Peaks drew near its end, the Dwarves of the Gabil'akkâ suffered a sudden, terrible setback. Before the final effort is made to breach the gates of Gundabad, the dwarves must resist falling to despair and overcome their doubts.

By the breath of Hrímil Frost-heart, the gates of Gundabad were sealed shut. If the Dwarves of the Gabil'akkâ intend to enter the sacred mountain, they shall first have to overcome the towering wall of ice that separates them from their prize.

<u>The Rift of Nûrz Ghâshu</u> \qWithin the Rift of Nûrz Ghâshu, Angmar mines for the ore they need to arm their legions. In their search for iron, they have uncovered the home of the Eldgang, as well as a hidden evil, ancient beyond knowledge....\q
The fortress of Skarháld is under attack! The Frost-horde has launched an assault from parts unknown in Ered Mithrin in hopes to drive the dwarves away….
A raiding party from Gundabad has been spotted approaching the fortress of Skarháld, in Ered Mithrin. No different than all other Gundabad raiding parties, this one seeks to slay all in their path….
Commander Rangvald trains dwarves for battle at the fortress of Skarháld, in Ered Mithrin….
A remnant of the lost Dwarf-kingdom of Grárik, Skarháld has long-endured both the harsh climes of Ered Mithrin and the wrath of dragon-kind. However, the Frost-horde knows well its weaknesses….

A remnant of the lost Dwarf-kingdom of Grárik, Skarháld has long-endured both the harsh climes of Ered Mithrin and the wrath of dragon-kind. Beneath the Keep of Tharrazhâr lie tunnels of most beautiful crystal, but that is not all that lurks within….

<u>The Defence of Arnach</u> Haradrim invaders encircle Arnach, preparing to attack. Can Baranor and his two trusted captains muster their guards, green and untested by war, to hold strong against the brutal onslaught of the foe?
<u>The Tale of Tolwin</u> \qThe slain body of a Sûhalar Easterling has led you to a brave warrior holding out in Talath Anor that may be in need of your aid.\q

<u>The Shadow Hunter</u> \qThe time has come to enter the dwarf ruin, Shathur-munzu. The Woodmen warned us of 'monsters' and 'The Shadow Hunter', but I remain unconvinced. Whatever lies inside, we are capable of defeating it.\q

<u>Dawn's Arrival</u> \qDespite all our efforts, evil still lingers in the world. It has crawled into the dark corners and deep places to hide from the light. I will not allow it to threaten one of our own. It will not hide from me anymore.\q
Avorthal had been moved from the Dourhand encampment to a ship preparing to depart for an unknown port in the north. His rescue is paramount to maintaining peace in Ered Luin....

<u>The Water Wheels: Nalâ-dûm</u> \qDeep in the abysses of Moria, the dwarves had once crafted a great waterway to bring water in from the mountains. Something now blocks the great wheels from turning, causing the Iron Garrison concern.\q

<u>The Twisted Heart</u> \qLongbough the Ent has been roused to anger. The Wood-trolls of the Eavespire are acting in league with a Black Huorn which was once under the Ent's guidance, and Longbough is determined to put an end to their mischief....\q
<u>Warg-pens of Dol Guldur</u> \qThe Warg-pens of Dol Guldur are where the hounds of the Dark Lord are bred, trained, and kept. Here, goblin-keepers care for the matron of the pack....\q
<u>Survival: Barrow-downs</u> \qThose who have long haunted the Barrow-downs at the command of the Witch-king are angered by your intrusion. Surviving is the least of your newfound concerns....\q
<u>Treating With Scoundrels</u> \qDeliver the ransom and bring home my sons. Yet tread cautiously and keep your wits about you. We know not if these Variag men have any honour at all.\q
<u>The Fiddle and the Drum</u> \qLong at odds with the glory-seeking Éowyn, Ellen Fremedon of Underharrow finds herself overwhelmed by the task of sheltering the helpless of Rohan.\q
<u>Forth the Toringas</u> \qThane Tordag of Torsbury, determined to reclaim his town from the Dunlending invaders, has joined with Dudsig of Oserley to march upon his ruined village....\q
<u>Something Foul</u> \qA great number of Dievlig were seen entering the great cairn in Plas-maru. Perhaps it is here we might discover what causes the Dead to stir in the Bonevales.\q
<u>Siege Escalated</u> \qThe White Hand is pressing its assault upon Brockbridge, and the few defending it will be hard-pressed to survive.\q

<u>The Madness of Vanyalos</u> After days secluded in her chambers, Lady Vanyalos has left them in a troubled state, seemingly heedless of her path. Down from her hill, down out of Imloth Melui, down to the high banks of the River Anduin where fair flowers nod in the breeze and danger lurks all around.
<u>The Inner Circle</u> \qScout-master Ausma has taken the lead on a mission to infiltrate Shakhajât, the seat of power of Warlord Dushtalbúk and his Frost-bound hobgoblins.\q
<u>The Apprentices Attack</u> \qScout-master Ausma has charged you and her three apprentices with dismantling the Angmarim forces in the Pit of Stonejaws in one fell swoop.\q

<u>To Ausma's Aid</u> \qThe scouts Kyrstig, Molkha, and Klúso have stormed the hobgoblin fortress Shakhajât to rescue their master, Ausma. But it is not clear if they are too late, or if their help was needed at all.\q
Some travellers have gone missing after venturing near the crypts of Esh-kimâkhi. You are tasked with investigating the area around the crypts for signs of these travellers.
The fool mayor of Hoarhallow is going to pay for enlisting the aid of the Free folk. Your objective is clear. Find the mayor and end him.

<u>Searching for Hope</u> \qThe Ordâkhai prisoner, Khûldim Umûn, claims that Dubarâkh, a hidden library Girhâzi and I have been searching for, is located inside this abandoned salt mine. Not trusting that the former overseer isn't leading you into a trap, Girhâzi has brought him along.\q
<u>The Hornburg</u> \qThe Hornburg is all that stands between Saruman's army and the fall of Rohan. Aragorn stands defiant upon the ramparts of the gate-house. Dawn will come soon.\q
Within the ruins of Stormwall, cold-worms have begun nesting in the vacant lair of Etterfang….
Within the ruins of Stormwall, the vacant lair of Etterfang remains vastly unexplored….
Within the ruins of Stormwall, cold-worms have begun building icy walls within the vacant lair of Etterfang….
Within the ruins of Stormwall, the vacant lair of Etterfang remains vastly unexplored….

<u>The Mirror-halls of Lumul-nar</u> \qTo bring life back to the gardens of Moria, the Iron Garrison has crafted great mirrors and placed them upon the pinnacle of Zirakzigil. The light has failed, however, and the dwarves seek to learn why their mirrors do not reflect it as they once did.\q
Dol Ernil, an ancient bastion of Men, now falls under control of the Dead. Cleanse their menace from within the ruins.

<u>Frodo's Burden</u> \qI am concerned for Frodo, for he bears a great burden. It is my hope that those whom I have sent to watch over the hobbit will determine if his mind remains strong enough for the task for which he has been chosen....\q
<u>Halros's Watch</u> \qMeanwhile, in the Shire, Halros of the Dúnedain helps watch the borders of that land and hopes his brethren in the south are faring well on their journey.\q
<u>Missing Persons</u> \qMany have recently been taken captive by the Dievlig. I fear a grisly fate will befall our allies if they are not found and rescued quickly.\q
<u>The Lone Dwarf</u> \qI have given those two long enough. If they failed, that is on them. The time has come to deal with the Jangovar menace. The axes of dwarves shall be upon them!\q

<u>Helegrod</u> \qHelegrod... once a dwarf-hold in the Misty Mountains, until the coming of a great dragon. Though the dragon has long since perished, and the ice of many long winters has engulfed the ruins, rumours out of the North speak of a terrible shadow returning to the frozen halls....\q
The Ordâkhai torturer Dokhára is holding several Ambarûli people prisoner in Eshadûr. The prisoners must be saved from a horrible fate.
<u>Epic Battles: Basic Training</u> \qThe armies of Saruman approach. Will we be ready to face them?\q
<u>Blood for Blood</u> \qStriving to avenge Dolgimil, the Corsair and Haradrim invaders of Dor-en-Ernil make ready to siege Linhir once more and slay its people as retribution.\q

<u>Gnats in Her Net</u> \qAs the webs of Shelob's children rise over Cirith Ungol, tremors beneath the Ephel Dúath grow more terrible with each passing moment. What horrors now stir within the depths of the Tower?\q
<u>A Dream of Cold and Silence</u> \qWhat do you think is going on in there? Do you think Merry can recover?\q
<u>Passage of the Marshes</u> \qThe foetid swamplands stretch in all directions. Did Frodo come this way...?\q

<u>The Snatcher</u> \qÚbil the Snatcher.... My father, Beorn, told me of that creature in my youth. He thought it a gangrel-beast that crawled from some dark cleft in the night. For many years, it crept unseen into the villages of the Woodmen and stole away their children to sate its hunger, but when it could hide no longer the creature fled the Vales of Anduin... never to return.\q

<u>The Truth of the Matter</u> \qWhile the mystery of the thief has been solved, the Orc's offer of information has complicated matters. He may be the key to understanding the situation in Deepscrave, but his trustworthiness is another question entirely.\q

<u>Meeting the Quartermaster</u> \qWith Shúkurz's help, you have made it into Vatug-ronk without a scratch. The mission is far from over, however. There is no telling whether your guise of being a prisoner will fail, or if you will even learn of Dhúrstrok's location at all....\q

<u>Shot in the Dark</u> \qThe Rohirrim are attempting to retake Brôntrig, the Dunlending village that overlooks the Gap of Rohan. If we are successful, we will control two vital outposts to defend against an imminent attack from Wulf's Cleft.\q
<u>The Ghost Returns</u> \qThis land is new to me, but it will be good to see an old friend. Will she be pleased to see us, I wonder?\q

<u>Gorthad Nûr, the Deep-barrow</u> \qShalgoth, the leader of the kergrim bone worshipers, hides far within Gorthad Nûr, the Deep-barrow. He and his followers seek to complete some dark ritual of necromancy, and must be stopped.\q

<u>Scion of Winter</u> \qVethúg Wintermind - that is a name long-hated by the dwarves. He, the vile cold-drake whose frost once choked the halls of Thikil-gundu in the Grey Mountains, now comes to Erebor in vengeance. We have been granted little respite from battle, but we must stand against him or all shall be lost.\q
<u>Battle For the Upper Reaches</u> \qGazathrug, the Orc Captain of the Upper Reaches, fears losing his hold on Máttugard, a fear that is finally coming to fruition.\q

<u>Corruption's Source</u> \qDown twisting tunnels, through crystal-lined caverns, lies the source of the corrupted sarrowstones. As ancient evil cracks apart and decays a new threat bubbles forth, whispering poisoned words to its maddened worshippers.\q
Reports reached the village that there are trees walking around the hillside. This cannot be so, and you have been drafted to investigate.
Just an ordinary night in a quiet hobbit township. What could possibly go wrong?
TBD…

<u>Attack at Dawn</u> \qIn the late evening hours, a small group of refugees sought refuge in the hidden Ranger-camp of Esteldín. These refugees were followed by a small group of goblin-scouts that quickly fled to Dol Dínen to bring word to their chief, Graug. Siniath the Ranger has asked you to seek out Graug and defeat him before he can spread word of Esteldín's location. As you arrive near Dol Dínen, the first rays of the false dawn can be seen overhead.\q
<u>Running Wild</u> \qFor the Beornings, there is a time to work, and there is a time to run wild.\q
<u>Scatha Awakens</u> \qAs Scatha scorched Fasthálla with his fiery breath, Frumgar and Fram took up arms against the dreaded long-worm.\q

<u>The Ill-fated Feast</u> \qFram's celebration of the death of Scatha caused great excitement through neighbouring lands. Lords and emissaries prepared themselves for the feasting and revels to come.\q

<u>Memories of Máttugard</u> \qFor but a brief moment during the Sixth War of the Dwarves and Orcs, the Haban'akkâ of Thráin gained entry to Mattugard. But beyond the noble gate of Mount Gundabad, Komog, son of Azog, laid in wait to slay all that sought to reclaim even the smallest foothold within his father's realm.\q

<u>Webs of the Scuttledells</u> \qThe Great Spiders of Mirkwood have begun to stir again, and the Elves of Thranduil, King of Mirkwood seek to learn the cause. What dire darkness has arisen within the wood to summon forth such evil?\q

<u>The Darkness Over Lebennin</u> \qNow fearing for the fate of the Corsairs, Daxamat, the brother of Jajax, recalls his dread in Dor-en-Ernil when he observed the meeting of the Scourge and a terrible man.\q
A routine scouting expedition to investigate a fire in the Wildwood becomes a harrowing mission to save a town.

Far to the north of Annâk-khurfu lies Rathad Caul, the Narrow Way, a treacherous passage into Câr Bronach. There, those still loyal to the Iron Crown guard the approach to the last bastions of Angmar.

<u>Sunken Labyrinth</u> \qYour search for Faramir leads you to the subterranean tunnels under Osgiliath, where he may have fled to escape an enraged fell beast. Shed light on the Ranger's disappearance by delving into the darkness.\q
Upon the peaks of Gundabad, the Angmarim breed bats for nefarious purposes….
<u>Too Far From the City</u> \qOsgiliath is lost, and its defenders flee across the plain. Can they reach the White City before the enemy overtakes them?\q
<u>What the Steward Saw</u> \qThere is much to do, and now I hear the Steward has summoned my friend for an audience? Time-wasting rubbish!\q

<u>The Rite of Clúcath</u> \qThe free Hillmen of the Trév Gallorg have long been in conflict with many of their sister tribes. Now they prepare to again face the Trév Duvardain in the Rite of Clúcath, a ceremonial rite of judgement...\q
<u>The Ride of the Rohirrim</u> \qSix thousand spears have come to Gondor at her darkest hour. It will become the hour of Théoden and of Rohan!\q
<u>Balakhôr the Scourge</u> \qBalakhôr has asked that I treat with him on the deck of his flagship, but can he be trusted?\q
<u>Even In Darkness</u> \qWe must storm the Night-jewel and put an end to Balakhôr and the threat of Umbar!\q
<u>Sons of Blackroot</u> \qMy brother and I have sworn a solemn vow to bring down the mighty Mûmakil that have come to Gondor!\q
<u>Gothmog Appears</u> \qOur enemies have brought a great ram to the city. We must damage or destroy it!\q
<u>No Other Way</u> \qUp, up, up the stairs, gollum. Gollum. And then... the tunnel, yes... this way, good hobbitses... yes....\q
<u>The Black Gate</u> \qWe have come to the very doorstep of Mordor to challenge the Dark Lord Sauron. There can be no turning back now.\q
<u>Mordor Triumphant</u> \qAnd so we come to it, at last. The battle surges all around us, and our last stand begins...\q
<u>The Eagles Are Coming!</u> \qGwaihir the Windlord and his noble subjects have come to the aid of the Host of the West!\q
<u>The Precious, At Last</u> \qGollum caught up to us on the slope of Mount Doom, and Sam stayed behind to deal with him while I entered the Mountain, eager to be rid of the Ring.\q
<u>Death Comes for All</u> \qThe Rohirrim have taken the field, and the armies of Mordor cannot stand against us!\q

<u>The Foe Resurgent</u> \qThe Witch-king of Angmar is slain, but the forces of the Enemy remain unbroken. Instead of fleeing at the sight of their Master's fate, their resolve is strengthened as countless new foes pour forth from Osgiliath. What other commander could lead such an army against Gondor?\q
<u>A Final Vengeance</u> \qWe have to find Golodir before it is too late!\q
<u>On a Field of Red</u> \qFight onward! The battle is not yet ended!\q
<u>The Council of the Captains</u> \qAragorn has called for a council to determine his next course of action. May wisdom guide his steps!\q
<u>The Ambush</u> \qOrcs and Easterlings have set a trap for the Host of the West, but now we seek to foil the ambush before it can be sprung.\q
<u>By Secret Steps</u> \qI will not lead the Host of the West into Dagorlad without knowing what awaits us. I have sent trustworthy friends to scout before us on the battle-plain.\q
<u>A Wedding at Midsummer</u> \qIt was on Midsummer's Day that folk from near lands and far came to the White City to witness the Great Wedding.\q
<u>The Wedding Banquet</u> \qLong into the night, the folk of the city made merry and celebrated the union of King Elessar and Queen Arwen.\q
<u>The Ruthless Dead</u> \qThe Dimholt road leads to the Dark Door and the paths beneath the Haunted Mountain, where the Dead walk. Few dare to go that way.\q

<u>Farewell to Evendim</u> \qThe Ranger Calenglad has long stood watch over the ancient city of Annúminas, in Evendim. If he is to join the Grey Company on its southern road, he will need to leave that city behind...\q

<u>Lothrandir of the Frozen Wastes</u> \qThe Ranger Lothrandir has knowledge of the southern lands through which the Grey Company must pass, but he will only take that road once he is certain the Lossoth of Forochel are free of danger...\q
<u>Mouth of Gondor</u> \qRemain on your guard, my friend. You speak with my voice, and should be free of harm, but this embassy will not be without danger....\q
<u>At the Stone of Erech</u> \qIn the Second Age of Middle-earth, Isildur called the Men of the Mountains to the hill of Erech to discuss their loyalties....\q
<u>Whispers from the Long Years</u> \qI do not know what lies beyond that room of deep shadow. Remain alert!\q
<u>Lhaid Ogo</u> \qCan the words of Ergothorn be trusted? If so, a messenger from Dunland must be somewhere in the depths of Lhaid Ogo, hurt and afraid...\q
<u>Attack on Zudrugund</u> \qOnce more we put our trust in Ergothorn and travel with utmost haste to Zudrugund. Will we find there a band of uruks, as he says, or a time-wasting detour?\q

<u>The House of Isildur</u> \qIn the year 1975 of the Third Age, a party of Dúnedain led by the brothers Laegened and Haerdor travelled north into Forochel to reclaim the relics left behind in the flight from the wreck of Fornost...\q
<u>An Echo in the Mountains</u> \qHe is there! But what is he doing?\q

<u>As Near As May Be</u> \qA skilled jewel-crafter has crossed our path, and Halbarad has devised a curious plan for him. He wants imitations made of the ring of Barahir borne by Aragorn for each Dúnadan in our company...\q
<u>A King Should See His Kingdom</u> \qKing Elessar desires to speak with you in the Tower of Ecthelion about an important matter.\q
<u>Kindred Spirits</u> \qYou there! You're the friend of whom Maethon spoke?\q
<u>The Cruel History of Durthang</u> \qMy tale begins more than a thousand years ago, when the watch on Mordor had already begun to fail....\q
<u>Night Falls On Sarn Ford</u> \qAn unnatural fog rolled in, changing the contours of the land, and we were seized by a feeling of dread unlike anything we had felt before.\q
<u>Grievances</u> \qI will hear this complaint, but not at my throne. I will go among the people.\q
<u>The Stone of Wyrgende</u> \qI have business in Snowbourn, but first I would see Wyrgende's Stone. Will I next fall to the crone's curse?\q
<u>The Hidden Chamber</u> \qForgive the mess, my friend! I had only been cleaning for a short time when I found… well, you will see!\q
<u>Night Falls on Meduseld</u> \qMy uncle Théoden will listen to me and put right the situation with Reeve Fastred. He is still King in Rohan.\q
<u>A Broken Mosaic</u> \qFortune smiles upon the Gabil'akkâ, I think! Is there not an artist in Gundabad who might repair this broken mosaic?\q
<u>Thane Mildrith</u> \qElthengels is under attack! Quickly, my friends! We must help with its defence!\q
<u>Nestinanessornë</u> \qAwaken, Nestinanessornë.\q
<u>The Giver of Gifts</u> \qI can still see this city as it was, during the height of its beauty. So much was lost.\q
<u>A Silent Presence</u> \qWe must learn if it is an Angmarim ritual within the Drearspire that causes these worrisome visions. If it is... we will stop it!\q
<u>The Divided Loyalties of Glúrkub the Goblin</u> \qI remember how it all began....\q
<u>The Warrior Found</u> \qThis is near the location where Vútro encountered the Weeping Warrior. Where then has he gone?\q
<u>The First Promise</u> \qSkarháld is under attack! Karazgar seeks the fulfillment of his promise!\q
<u>Fate of the Stonemaiden</u> \qSee... hear... know....\q
<u>The Song of Sweet Lara</u> \qThis is far enough for the night. We will continue to the city in the morning. Get a fire started!\q
<u>The Beast Below</u> \qThere is something worrisome on the air.\q
<u>Azagath Pursued</u> \qMy son Thorongil has been rescued, but the Kindred of the Coins will still be made to answer for his capture.\q
<u>The Dragon's Bones</u> \qFollow me, friend. Kólfith will not be long.\q
<u>The Will to Stand</u> \qWord reached us even in Enedwaith that the Falcon Clan stood against Saruman. But will a common enemy serve to unite us as friends?\q
<u>Wood, Mountain, Lake, and Stone</u> \qThis is Mazal Akrâz, the Chamber of Glory. My brother and my sons lie within. Let us go now to them.\q
<u>A Message in Mithril</u> \qThe Longbeards are under attack! We must come to their aid!\q
<u>The Adventures of Jajax and Daxamat</u> \qMy brother Dax and I returned at last to Umbar Baharbêl, the City of Sails.\q
<u>A Long Way From Gondor</u> \qIt was in the days of June that my father Denethor, the Steward of Gondor, called his sons to the White Tower...\q
<u>Assault on Clovengap</u> \qAh, this is the way to Akrakír, the Ladder Gardens of Gundabad! They were renowned for their beauty; let us hope they have not been despoiled.\q
<u>A Journey by Boat</u> \qThe river Anduin is as familiar to me as my own shadow, but it is still a journey of some days. We must stop here for the night.\q
<u>A Promise Kept</u> \qThis must be Karazgar's doing! We have to hurry!\q
<u>Troubled Dreams</u> \qYou should get what rest you can, my friend, and try not to dwell upon the horrors of the battle. Perhaps things will seem less grim by the light of day...\q
<u>Breaking Through</u> \qTogether, the Dwarves of the Gabil'akkâ will break through the ice that blocks our passage into Gundabad!\q
<u>Union of Evil</u> \qRemain alert. You go among our enemies, and will be in grave danger if you are discovered.\q

<u>Old Friends and New Tidings</u> \qThis Dunlending girl who travels with you cannot be allowed to see the secret ways into Lothlórien. I must bind her eyes if she is to come with you to see the Lady.\q
<u>High Seat of the Dwarves</u> \qThe Steepset has always been the high seat of the Lord of Gundabad. I would see it with my own eyes.\q
On the fringes of the South Downs, a tribe of goblins plans raids against the bastions of the Free People. Cull their number to keep the Free People safe.

<u>The Road to Dunharrow</u> \qUpon the plains of the Firienfeld at Dunharrow, the people of Kingstead have at last found shelter. Yet at the edge of the Dimholt, a sudden wave of dread flows over Éowyn and her people.\q
<u>Sammath Gûl</u> \qSammath Gul are the chambers once occupied by the Dark Lord Sauron in the guise of the Necromancer of Mirkwood. Stained by his presence, few now dare enter here...\q
You must intercept a caravan of waggons filled with supplies and weapons and turn it over to Mizâdi's forces.
Near the top of the ruins, a savage Orc commands the lesser forces. You must find your way to him and win the day.
<u>The Weeping Warrior</u> \qBryn, prince of Dale, has fled into the wilds. His mind still seeks out answers in these recent turbulent times that have befallen the Dale-lands.\q
<u>Homestead Defence</u> \qMy son awaits at my homestead to provide my messenger the ledger that contains all of my records. I must have this to prepare for the auction in the village.\q

<u>Laerdan's Escape</u> \qÉin, the questioner left behind at Barad Tironn, revealed that Laerdan had been moved from Annúminas and taken to Sammath Baul in Angmar. Time is running short for the Elf-lord.\q

<u>Haudh Valandil</u> \qThe Lords of Umbar, sorcerers trained by Sauron, the great Necromancer, seek to bring terror to Annúminas by raising the long-dead remains of Valandil, third King of Arnor, as a terrible wight. Only the most courageous of the Free Peoples will be able to put an end to their evil deeds....\q
<u>A Beorninghús Tradition</u> \qIt is a Beorning tradition to signal both ends and beginnings with a feast.\q
<u>Under the White Mountain</u> \qArvaethor accompanies you into a cavern underneath the White Mountains in an attempt to push back the Orkish forces from entering the Vale.\q

<u>Barad Tironn</u> \qLaerdan, succumbing to the whisperings of Mordrambor, foolishly seeks to confront Amarthiel at Barad Tironn, where she seeks to use the palantír to find Narchuil. The only hope for the Free Peoples is for the palantír to be recovered from her grasp....\q

<u>Flight to the Lonely Mountain</u> \qThe Ring has passed beyond my vision into the pass of Cirith Ungol. Dale has fallen in the North, and the survivors of the siege are retreating to the Lonely Mountain, with the Easterling forces not far behind them….\q
Pesky stone-claws have been seen recently, digging around the Hadhodiant….
An ambush could threathen the bridge builders, who work to repair to the Hadhodiant….

<u>The Seven Swords</u> \qWith the aid of the Heroes of the North, the Ranger-scholar Nethraw has reclaimed seven swords which were given to the Hillman-chieftains of old. Now Nethraw and his allies prepare to enter the ancient halls of Krúslë Lannan....\q
<u>The Gates of Isengard</u> \qAn emissary of the Rohirrim approaches the gates of Isengard, hoping to learn the true intentions of the wizard Saruman.\q
'I probably worry for nothing. When we find Bilbo we will laugh long and well... but not before!'
'Look for Canaddal and Ringhul on the high moor outside the valley. Perhaps they have seen something of our hobbit!'
'Arifael may have seen our missing hobbit. The trick may be getting him to tell us!'
'I understand that Bilbo once adventured with the dwarf Glóin, who now camps north of Imladris. Has he seen Bilbo lately?'
'Bilbo may have left tracks behind as he journeyed north... unless the recent snows have buried them!'
'Fight your way into Pinnath Fenui and clear it of goblins! Only then will it be safe to confront the goblin-leader about our missing hobbit!'
'We will need a distraction if you are to rescue Bilbo from Goblin-town. I will provide it!'
'Close the gates that lead further into Goblin-town, or you will be overrun before you can rescue Bilbo!'
'They must be holding him in the dungeons! Find Bilbo and free him!'
'Let us hope you can bring Bilbo safely through Goblin-town without incident!'
An enterprising hobbit is looking to make a meal delivery service. She asked to have someone help get things rolling and you accepted the task.

<u>Shield-maiden of Rohan</u> \qTo appease the grief of Reeve Fríthild's children, Thane Ordlac has chosen to hold a private -- and unsettlingly cheerful -- funeral for the late Reeve of the Broadacres....\q
<u>Breaking the Back of the Boar</u> \qPakon, the Chieftain of the Maldorr Orcs has long plotted revenge against Folca's line. If not stopped, he will have his long-sought vengeance.\q

<u>Mossward, The Border Village</u> \qSpeak, then, of how you came to this place of safety: Rivendell, the Last Homely House East of the Sea. But speak swiftly, before the shadows deepen. From where did your road lead?\q

<u>Caverns of Thrumfall</u> \qDeep within the recesses of the Stormwall lie ancient passages and twisted tunnels, concealing the whereabouts of Etterfang Foulmaw and her restless horde. Only the dwarf Drengur has seen the venomous beast and lived to tell the tale.\q
<u>Viznak Lives</u> \qViznak has escaped the Halls of Black Lore with his life, but the merrevail are closing in! We must hurry, before Faeron is overrun!\q
Atop the Drearspire, cold-drake emisarries have been sighted giving aid to the Angarmarim.

<u>A Scar of Battle</u> \qThe Zhélruka revealed that Vethúg Wintermind carved a great cleft through the Grey Mountains as he fell wounded from battle. Now Dori and Company seek to prove that the great cold-drake who slew King Dáin I has truly met his doom.\q

<u>Ost Elendil</u> \qThe Black Númenóreans in league with Amarthiel have come to Ost Elendil, seeking to establish a foothold in Annúminas, while the Rangers of the North assail the city of their fathers in a desperate attempt to drive them forth.\q
The Orkish commander of Tharbad still resides within that tower. You must make your way up to find his lair and defeat him.

<u>Thrór's Hammer</u> \qDwalin, lord of Thorin's Hall has tasked the Heroes of Eriador with recovering Thrór's hammer from the tomb of Skorgrím, where the Dourhands have enshrined it as a memorial of victory over Durin's Folk....\q

<u>The Gates of Carn Dûm</u> \qUsing the scroll of the Hillmen, a key to the gates of Carn Dûm has been forged. Now the Heroes of Eriador and Lorniel, daughter of Golodir, must pass the gates of the iron fortress and free the Ranger from the clutches of Mordirith, the Steward of Angmar....\q

<u>Pits of Isengard</u> \qAhhh, you have found the Pits. What lies beneath is but a small taste of what I shall unleash upon Middle-earth. Man cannot stand against my power, and you too will perish.\q

<u>The Tower of Orthanc</u> \qWelcome to the ring of Isengard, heroes. I have watched your progress with great interest. Prove yourselves worthy and I shall share with you the secrets of Middle-earth....\q
<u>A Just Burial</u> \qBrothers Erchar and Herion return to the site of a battle that drove them apart. You accompany them to pay respects before the returning journey to Linhir.\q
<u>To Avert a War</u> \qThe Ranger Langlas prepares to mount an effort to rescue the Elf-prince Avorthal from the clutches of the treacherous Dourhands....\q

<u>Queen of Queens</u> \qWhile dealing with the marsh insects of the Rushgore on behalf of the stranded Woodmen, you discovered the nest of their queen... a discovery that yields unpleasant results.\q
High on the walls of High Sundergót, strange tracks have been found, trailing around foul nests and even fouler creatures….
Dourhands have found High Sundergrót and seek what treasures they can find from the old dwarf ruins….
<u>Urugarth</u> \qLying on the outskirts of Carn Dûm is the fortress of Urugarth, home to countless Orcs, goblins, and other curs of Angmar... the breeding grounds of Angmar's horde.\q
A new chef has been entertaining all of Umbar with his delicious crab creations. Umbar is running low on crab. Aid the harvest on the bountiful Shield Isles.
A prominent Umbari noble has vanished during a routine trip to the Shedax Khîn in the Shield Isles, near an isle where it's rumoured the dead walk freely. Investigate and rescue any trapped sailors.
Temámir Dwarves have been excavating a cave on the Cape of Umbar looking for precious stones, but the cave proved too weak. Help the dwarves escape the cave-in!

<u>Rise of the Fallen Son</u> \qThe shades of a Dunlending clan stir restlessly amid the barrows of the Lich Bluffs. What broken oath binds these poor spirits to the confines of this world? Perhaps the shade of one of their heroes holds the answer….\q
<u>Those Who Are Dead</u> \qNo one living could hope to know what moves the Dead Men of Dunharrow. Only one of their kind could know what it means to remain forever cursed....\q
<u>The Cursed Vale</u> \qDisheartened by news of the Oath-breakers' influence on the vale and the growing threat in Tarlang's Crown, Malthellam has called you and Lady Rosfin to counsel.\q
Bree-land farmer Robb Thornley is recovering after being captured and tortured by marauding Orcs. Battered and beaten, Robb Thornley wants retribution.

<u>The Sixteenth Hall</u> \qThe dread malady that spreads among the servants of the Enemy in Moria is strong in the Sixteenth Hall. Whatever nameless thing dwells there has entrapped many an Orc to its service, poisoning their minds and controlling their actions.\q

<u>The Temple of Utug-bûr - Thûr Hin</u> \qAs you enter Thûr Hin, the Lair of the Children, the smell hits you. Dust and copper, like blood in your mouth. A dozen wars were born here, along with thousands of soldiers. In the distance, you can hear two Utûgi arguing amongst themselves, their voices echoing through the musty hall.\q

<u>The Temple of Utug-bûr Inner Sanctum</u> \qAs you step through the sanctum's threshold, the ground groans in disapproval, and an odorous, chilling wind rubs your bones. The wind carries mournful wails, whispers, and laughter from the dancing shadows at the edge of your vision. Within the heart of the sanctum a frenetic thrum begins, as if the shadow comes alive and echoes the rapid beating of your heart. Something in the darkness is aware of your presence.\q

<u>The Old Woman of the Mountain</u> \qGwyllion, the Old Woman of the Mountain, in service to Saruman the White has brought terror to the herdsmen of the Uch-lûth. Saeradan now seeks to bring her reign of terror to an end.\q
A massive wasp and her hive in the Gorge of Woe are altered by the corruption seeping across the land. They must be destroyed.
<u>The Ithil-Stone</u> \qUnder the command of Ingold, many in Gondor work to thwart the nefarious plans of Dulgabêth, the Black Word as he sifts through the ruins of Sauron's defeat.\q

<u>The Battle in the Tower</u> \qThe time has come for the last assault upon the fortress of Dol Guldur. The fighting begins even as a smaller force enters the citadel in secret, prepared to face their final foe...\q

<u>Dark Delvings</u> \qIn the deepest delvings of Moria dwell nameless things which shun the light and feed on the darkness. The Elves of Lórien strive to constrain the vile creatures, but led by the evil Gurvand, they may be too strong to hold back forever....\q
<u>A Blade of Flame and Fury, Part 2</u> \qYou must quickly ascend the tower of Kûr Anzar. Okhíso must not escape what justice demands.\q

<u>A Blade of Flame and Fury, Part 3</u> \qOkhíso, seeking to divert your attention, has set Kûr Anzar aflame. That was not enough to stay Mizâdi's blade but now the city needs to be saved. You must put out the fires and rescue trapped citizens in Kûr Anzar.\q

<u>A Reluctant Young Thane</u> \qAgelwyn, the young wife of Thane Gladsúnu of Marton, has a difficult task set before her in her husband's absence as she awaits his return. Their town has fallen, and the people of Marton need a leader now more than ever.\q

<u>The Rite Undone</u> \qIt was not long after the Iron Crown returned to Carn Dûm that the Trév Duvárdain and their chieftain, Claghórd, began to trouble us once again. In mere days, the Stone of Clúcath was seized, the challenge was called, and we of the Trév Gállorg had no choice but to answer it....\q

<u>Beneath the Drearspire</u> \qAfter the downfall of Mordirith, Angmar fell into disarray and the Iron Crown all but abandoned Carn Dûm. With our future now uncertain, tensions arose within the Trév Duvárdain, leading many to forsake their oaths, renounce their kin and tribesmen, and turn their blades upon the Iron Crown. In time, those of us who remained travelled into the east, into the shadow of Mount Gundabad, and into that accursed tower, Tûr Fúar, the Drearspire....\q

<u>Angmar Reborn</u> \qIn the aftermath of the siege of Carn Dûm and the destruction of the shard of Tauressar, Hill-men of the last great tribes of Angmar, the Trév Gállorg and the Trév Duvárdain, have gathered to parley at Fail-á-Khro. As the Iron Crown falls and the shadow of the Witch-king fades at last, a new day dawns across Angmar....\q

<u>A Champion's Courage</u> \qMosal-ruk, leader of the Orcs of Ost Cyrn, gathers his strength to crush the Eglain of the Lone-lands and press westward to Bree-land. Slade Ransford, a champion of the common good, stands ready with his allies to turn back the Orkish war-band....\q

<u>The Quays of the Harlond</u> \qIn secrecy, Aragorn has made his way up the Anduin with an army of men ready to fight for Gondor. Now is the time to help lead Aragorn's forces to Pelennor and turn the tides of battle!\q
<u>Shattered Roots</u> \qAfter conversing with the trees of Balewood, Mossbeard has learned horrifying truths of Núrzum's origins and the fate of the elder Huorn, Brúndoron.\q

<u>The Depths of Kidzul-Kalah</u> \qThe dwarves left deep scars in the earth, and in their absence terrible things have moved into the dark pits. The waters of the Gladden merely halted their spread. With your aid I might end this threat... for good.\q
<u>Halros's Watch</u> \qMeanwhile, in Dunland, Halros of the Dúnedain has been woken for his turn at the watch.\q
The Ordâkhai at Ghât Lor are building siege engines to war with Queen Mizâdi and Renewed Hamât. Destroy the siege engines and defeat any Ordâkhai who move against you.
<u>Carn Dûm</u> \qCarn Dûm, the capital of Angmar and the former stronghold of the Witch-king. Angmar's shadow has returned to this city in the form of the False King, Mordirith, Steward of Angmar.\q

<u>The Battle Before the Rammas Deluon</u> \qThe might of Angmar rallies to defeat the Trév Gallorg. Reinforcements from Urugarth and Carn Dûm march through the swamp of Malenhad towards Rammas Deluon. It falls to the Champions of Eriador to stop them....\q
<u>A New Post</u> \qRaphûz invited you to speak with him after you assisted him.\q
<u>Fate of the North</u> \qThe dwarves Rúzat, Agátur, and Náth take the pass from Misthallow to Ered Mithrin, unaware of what waits for them.\q

<u>The Meaning of Alliance</u> \qThe people of Galtrev have formed an alliance with the White Hand, for Isengard has vowed friendship in return for assistance in the war effort. But the people left behind in the presence of the servants of Saruman are little more than slaves in this new era....\q
<u>The Red Sky Darkens</u> \qMy story begins at the camp on the edge of Agarnaith. You know the one.\q
<u>To a Ranger's Aid</u> \qAmdir, quickly falling into the shadows of the wraith-world, has slain two of his brethren already and seeks the blood of a third....\q

<u>Woe of the Willow</u> \qIn the heart of the Old Forest, a fell sword calls forth evil spirits from the Barrow-downs. Only by destroying the sword can you stop the wood-trolls' blight from spreading and end the forest's misery.\q

<u>Whispers in the Pits</u> \qAfter being granted a troubling vision by the Green Lady, you have travelled to Dol Guldur in search of Karazgar. What will you find in the shattered halls of Gostador?\q

<u>Broken Alliance</u> \qAfter learning of a plot by Sharkey's Men to forge an alliance with the Orcs encroaching into the northern Bree-fields, the Ranger Saeradan sets into motion a plan to break the alliance before it can be established....\q

<u>In Need of Cheering-up</u> \qWhile the Lady Éowyn appears brave and cheerful, some who know her well grow concerned for her, for she does not eat or sleep, and a heavy gloom seems to have settled upon her since the departure of Théoden King.\q

<u>A House Forged Anew</u> \qAfter seventy-eight years in the dungeons of Barad-dûr, King Váskmun Greytooth of the Stout-axes has returned to lead his folk. However, if there is to remain any hope of forging a new Dwarf-kingdom within Mordor, the Stout-axes must break free of their servitude and challenge the Mistress of Lûghash, Zôreth.\q
Prince Ingór has declared that the Hall of Vérnozal needs to be cleaned up to suit the needs of the Zhélruka Clan….
Prince Ingór has declared that the newly forged Zhélruka swords must be properly tested before they can be gifted to the Longbeards….
A group of Longbeard explorers are in trouble and Prince Ingór wishes for the Zhélruka Clan to come to their aid….
Prince Ingór has declared that the Hall of Vérnozal needs to be further decorated to suit the needs of the Zhélruka Clan….
Zóva, Prince Ingór's advisor, has devised a plan to further disrupt the Orkish factions within Gundabad….
A group of visiting Dourhands has become very disruptive….
Prince Ingór wishes to hunt the great frost-drake, Svalnath, and to bring great honour to the Zhélruka clan….
<u>Acolyte of The Necromancer</u> \qOroniel, captain of guards of Felegoth, has unexpectingly encountered a threat from Dol Guldur, hidden within the old elven ruins of Caras Tilion.\q
<u>The Icy Crevasse</u> \qA powerful sorceror from Angmar seeks to drive the frozen winds of Forochel south into Evendim, freezing the lake and allowing a great army to march on Tinnudir....\q

<u>Sejer-tharâkh</u> \qA lumber store-house of repute, Sejer-tharâkh was also known to hold one of the greatest libraries of trade-records in all of Moria. The Iron Garrison seeks to reclaim the lost trade-records and use that information to aid them in re-establishing Khazad-dûm as a great merchant kingdom.\q
<u>Thievery and Mischief</u> \qWhile war raged in the South and the Rangers of the North were absent, brigands and ruffians took an opportunity to steal control of Bree....\q
<u>Defence of The Prancing Pony</u> \qThe inhabitants of Bree have spent the occupation holed up within The Prancing Pony. Angered at their uprising, the brigands have decided to burn them out....\q

<u>Dâr Narbugud</u> \qThe Elves of Lórien have uncovered Dâr Narbugud, the lair of the Mistress of Pestilence, the vile creature responsible for the plague spreading among the creatures of Moria. What heroes will overthrow the queen of the nameless? Who will put an end to her plague?\q
<u>The Hornburg</u> \qThe Hornburg must not fall! This is the last defence, my friend. We must stand for as long as we can. For Rohan.\q

<u>The Battle of the Twenty-first Hall</u> \qIn the aftermath of the raid upon Zabadgathol, Mazog sets his strength against Durin's Folk, assaulting many key encampments. If the Twenty-first Hall falls, then the advantage falls to Mazog's Orcs.\q
Orcs have set up camp near the Span of Nâmbadir. You are tasked with sabotaging their weapons and defeating any who get in your way.
A vicious group of wild hill-beasts have descended upon the path to the mine of Glimmerdeep, in Ered Mithrin….
Upon the entrance to the mine of Glimmerdeep, in Ered Mithrin, trolls from Gundabad have set up a blockade….
<u>Thievery and Mischief</u> \qWhile war raged in the South and the Rangers of the North were absent, brigands and ruffians took an opportunity to wrest control of Bree....\q
<u>Defence of The Prancing Pony</u> \qThe inhabitants of Bree have spent the occupation holed up within The Prancing Pony. Angered at their uprising, the brigands have decided to burn them out....\q
<u>Heirloom of the Earth-kin</u> \qYour efforts to cleanse the evils from the corrupted Earth-kin pouch have led you to an Ent, a shepherd of the trees, and the story he has to tell....\q

<u>Darkness Revealed</u> \qNot only the shades of Oathbreakers wander the barrows of the Lich Bluff. Some dark Power has raised a horde of wights in service to the enemy. Only by travelling into the darkest recesses of an ancient barrow can the source of this evil be uncovered….\q
<u>Muckle: Fangorn</u> \q Within the forest of Fangorn there is an ancient battle taking place.\q
<u>The Stones Returned</u> \qThe five stones beg to be returned to their rightful places. By your hand, he will be unleashed.\q

<u>A Captive Audience</u> \qKhûldim Umûn, the former overseer of Ambarûl under the Empire of Ordâkh, is believed to know the location of the Dubarâkh, a hidden library storing the knowledge of the lost history and culture of Ambarûl. Girhâzi has an idea to get her prisoner to reveal the location.\q
<u>Red-pass</u> \qThe Gaunt-lord Ivar spreads corruption through Agamaur, the Red Swamp, raising a host of evil to do the bidding of Angmar....\q
<u>Retake Weathertop</u> \qWeathertop... once a watch-tower of the Dúnedain, now a refuge for Orcs. Candaith the Ranger strives to break their foothold in the Weather Hills....\q

<u>The Secrets of Sundergrót</u> \qThe Dwarves, Rúzat, Agátur, and Náth have stumbled upon a secret meeting between Rákhrum, Goblin Overseer of Sundergrót, and Gúrbarash, The Gundabad Hill-troll Chief.\q
<u>The Battle of the Ford, Sunset</u> \qOur prince was trapped in the middle of the river Isen. We had to fight through the line of uruks to reach him!\q
<u>Heirloom of Khazad-dûm</u> \qThe words of Galadriel before her Mirror surface in your memory....\q

<u>The Battle of Rhunendin</u> \qThere is a chance to bring security to Aughaire, for at least a little while, but it will require courage of the greatest magnitude. The armies of Angmar must be met upon their own land... they must be defeated at Rhunendin....\q
The abandoned mines of Sundergrót still hold valuable ore and treasures, ripe for the taking. However, the goblin intruders stand in your way….
The abandoned mines of Sundergrót still hold valuable ore and treasures, ripe for the taking. However, the goblin intruders stand in your way….
The abandoned mines of Sundergrót still hold valuable ore and treasures, ripe for the taking. However, the goblin intruders stand in your way….
The abandoned mines of Sundergrót still hold valuable ore and treasures, ripe for the taking. However, the goblin intruders stand in your way….
High in the tower of Bekâr-zarakh, the Orcs of Gundabad prepare for war. In their keeping are weapons of dwarf-make, stolen long ago in the sack of Gundabad….
High in the tower of Bekâr-zarakh, the Orcs of Gundabad prepare for war. Stored there to feed the war effort, many Orkish provisions have been left poorly-guarded….
High in the tower of Bekâr-zarakh, the Orcs of Gundabad prepare for war. Among them, Ushgoth the Mighty makes ready to enact his plans on the battlefield….

<u>The Treasure of Rohan</u> \qThe true treasure of Rohan does not lie in silver or gold, but in the herds of the noble horses which roam the plains of the Riddermark. Descended from the Mearas, these great beasts are prized by all, including the Dark Lord....\q

<u>Munfaeril's Warning</u> \qMadin's grandfather was a good man, giving succour to the People of the Boar when the Draig-lûth nearly destroyed them. Madin and his son Nevid, however, have fallen to evil ways, and I cannot, as a servant of the Huntsman, allow this travesty to continue....\q

<u>The Howling Pit</u> \qDeep beneath Járnfast, in a place where the red stone once cracked, three doors were recently riven. Three doors and a seal of mithril, built to contain a rift of howling horrors, straining to get out.\q
Within the halls of Cútaig, the most vicious Wargs of Gundabad are bred. There, even the most skilled of hunters must tread with care lest they become the hunted….

<u>Filikul</u> \qHasta went forth to discover the meaning of the strange happenings which occurred but weeks before. He has not returned, and his companions are becoming worried that something may have happened to him...\q

<u>A Formal Complaint</u> \qAn attempt to lodge a formal complaint on behalf of the glassblower, Hob Hillbrow, led to a violent encounter with the Chief's Men. The time has come to put the ruffians in their place....\q

<u>Prisoner of the Free Peoples</u> \qThe pages of Sara Oakheart's journal uncovered the way into the ruins of Delossad, once called Sithad in brighter days. The search for Narchuil has led here, but to what end? What have these ragged stones seen...?\q

<u>Of Dreams and Desires</u> \qIn days long past, I knew her as Tárasánë, the Green Lady, but the wickedness of the Necromancer and the great spiders of Ungoliant tainted the Greenwood and she was lost. What has become of her? Has she departed these lands evermore? Even now, I cannot say.\q
<u>A Reunion Bittersweet</u> \qIn the hopes of securing peace for Lhan Garan, Eluna has arranged a meeting with Ardhun....\q
<u>Sword-hall of Dol Guldur</u> \qThe Sword-hall of Dol Guldur is the central training hall of the Enemy's minions, overseen by three terrible champions of the Dark Lord….\q

<u>Roots of Fangorn</u> \qA dread spider queen, long ago banished beneath the misty mountains, has returned to wreak her vengence upon the ents of the forest. Even now her brood poisons the roots of ancient Fangorn, in caverns far below.\q

The Ordâkhai are a fearful people. Many of them have heard a story since they were children of a blood-stained spectre who steals the life right from the Men of the south when they sleep. We believe you can be that spectre to them, to ignite their fears.
Deep within the halls of Gundabad, an ancient forge has long grown cold….

<u>The Journey to Helm's Deep</u> \qActing as Thane, Agelwyn must now venture out and lead her people to the safety of the Hornburg, where Théoden King plans to make his stand against the vast forces of Isengard.\q

<u>Tremors Beneath Barad-dûr</u> \qAwoken by tremors in the dungeons of Barad-dûr, you and the other restless Stout-axes of Mordor seize the opportunity to speak without fear of punishment by the Dark Lord's servants.\q

<u>Sister of the Gilrain</u> \qThe mysterious Roamingstar, Sister of the Gilrain, hopes to atone for her past mistakes by using her influence over the rivers of Gondor to banish the Ruthless Dead from her lands forever.\q

<u>The Glittering Caves</u> \qThe Glittering Caves of Aglarond are where the women, children, and supplies have been hidden. With the loss of the Wall and the Deeping-comb, Gimli, Gamling, and Eómer now rally any they can find to hold the line and protect all huddled within.\q
<u>In the Palace of the Swan</u> \qIt is good to see cheer restored to the Palace of the Swan. When last I was here, the mood was grim.\q

With little reason to celebrate, the masters at Gramsfoot have noticed morale slipping. To bolster the troops they are sending forth intrepid combatants to gather as many hobbits as can be gathered for a great feast.

You have been asked to help identify infiltrators in the town of Herne. You are to ask for details on joining Sharkey's ranks and determine how many in the town might be aligned with the enemy out of the south.
<u>One More Journey</u> \qMeanwhile, Saeradan of the Dúnedain travels north with the bodies of his fallen brethren, determined to lay them to rest.\q

<u>Honour and Treachery</u> \qYour journey to avenge Léofdag has led you to the Pelennor Fields, while Fastred, Reeve of the Sutcrofts, seeks the foe that once sought to deliver ruin upon his lands and family. With your paths now aligned, you must strike as one against the treachery of the Enemy. \q

<u>The Library at Tham Mírdain</u> \qThe Library at Tham Mírdain once held much of the knowledge of the early Ages and withstood the brunt of Sauron's attack against Eregion. Though much of the surviving lore was carried away by Elrond Halfelven, the forces of Angmar now seek the remnants....\q

<u>The School at Tham Mírdain</u> \qThe School at Tham Mírdain was once a pinnacle of learning during the age of the Noldor, but it has now fallen into disrepair and is overrun by the minions of Saruman, who seeks greater knowledge of the Rings of Power.\q

<u>They Mined Too Fast</u> \qMithril it is called by the Elves, and true-silver in the Common Tongue, but the dwarves do not share their own secret name. The hope of finding it has led many dwarves to their doom in Moria, for they seldom heed the dire warnings when their hearts yearn for mithril, cold and bright in the dark.\q

<u>The Defence of Trestlebridge</u> \qThe little town of Trestlebridge is all that stands between the Orcs of Angmar and Bree-land to the south. Halbarad, Ranger of the North, gathers heroes to help defend Trestlebridge from the approaching onslaught....\q

<u>A Guardian's Duty</u> \qThe town of Trestlebridge is under siege by Orcs out of Angmar. One of the guardians of Trestlebridge, Severin Wheeler, has assembled the townsfolk and their southern allies to defend the town against the marauding hordes....\q
<u>Glimmerdeep</u> \qAn Orkish faction now occupies much of Glimmerdeep, pillaging its wealth for who knows what master and standing in the path of the Zhélruka resettlement of their ancient lands.\q

<u>A Thirst for Blood</u> \qI of all my companions understand the thirst for blood. It burns in those who have seen tragedy... but Reeve Fastred must put aside his thirst, for a horde comes that knows no mercy, and only the blood of the Men of the Sutcrofts will be forfeit....\q

<u>The Mead Hall of Floodwend Besieged</u> \qThe Easterlings have regrouped and are poised to assault Floodwend. The attack comes as success is reported to Radwig, yet now the town finds itself in a struggle to keep the Mead Hall from falling to the enemy.\q
<u>Battle of the Ford, Afternoon</u> \qWe formed up between Théodred and our foes, fighting for our lives and his. There seemed to be no end to the uruks!\q

<u>A Song for the Company</u> \qHoping for some new material with which to compose a song, the minstrel Piper Prescott has recruited young blood to aid the hobbit Leland Underhill retrieve some goods stolen from him by the brigands encamped throughout Bree-land....\q
<u>Calenglad's Appeal</u> \qMeanwhile, Calenglad of the Dúnedain seeks for answers in the forest of the Mournshaws.\q

<u>Into the Abyss</u> \qWhat secrets lie in the depths of the Mordath? The little Dwarf-king and his people will soon know more than they dared imagine! Ah, but what is this? Another dwarf stands upon the threshold....\q

<u>A Flight of Drakes</u> \qPembar, the resting place of one of the famed forges of Eregion, has fallen beneath the shadow of the drake-matron Rimlug and her brood. The great Wing-mother and her spawn must be defeated if the forge is to be awakened once more....\q

<u>The Training Hall</u> \qMany armouries and forges of the dwarves lie dormant in Khazad-dûm, awaiting the hands of their masters. One such has been claimed by the Orcs of Moria for a training hall. If the forge is to see service again, the Orcs must be driven forth....\q

<u>The Ghost-forge</u> \qThe ancient tomb of a great dwarf-smith of Khazad-dûm is now the site of a terrible evil. A Cargûl in the service of the Nine has come to the forge, and with him many fell spirits, and has put the fires of the forge to evil use....\q

<u>Midnight Raid</u> \qThe servants of Saruman have laid claim to the ancient forges of Eregion. Savage Dunlendings have raised their encampment around one such forge. The men of Dunland must be routed if the crucibles of the forge are to burn once more....\q

<u>The Mithril Slaves</u> \qDwarves are not alone in their search for mithril. Orcs and goblins toil within the barren mines, seeking some small vein of Moria-silver to use against the Free Peoples, or at the least to keep it from them....\q

<u>The Morroval Outcasts</u> \qIn the deep places of Moria, an ancient and hidden dwarf-forge has been penetrated by an outcast band of merrevail, seeking the tools which lie there in disuse. To what ends such creatures might put them remains unknown....\q

<u>The Siege of Barad Morlas</u> \qThe kindred of Elrond Halfelven have driven forth the half-orcs from Barad Morlas, but the ancient ruin is not yet safe. Dunlendings march even now upon the encampment, while the Elves tend to their wounds....\q

<u>The Spider Nest</u> \qThe returning dwarves go heedlessly into the dark of Moria. Their scouts, seeking a lost forge, find instead a nest of deadly spiders. The spiders prefer the blood of the living, and so there is still hope for their rescue....\q

<u>The Library of Steel</u> \qThe Library of Steel contains many secrets of the smithy, protected by the wards of the dwarves, for which they are well-known. Now the Ghâsh-hai seek to summon lesser fire-spirits to break the wards and ravage the library and the forge within....\q

<u>The Court of Seregost</u> \qDeep in the heart of Seregost, Lhaereth the Stained prepares to unleash a second Great Plague upon the realms of Men. Any hope of thwarting her lies on the intrepid few, led by Rangers Rhadrog and Faeron, who have gained entry to her doorless keep.\q

<u>Storm on Methedras</u> \qWhile the Grey Company journeyed south to the aid of Aragorn, we came upon a Dunlending hag named Gwyllion, called the Old Woman of the Mountain. She sought to raise an army of ancient evil to aid the White Hand against Rohan... it was our duty, Amlan and mine, to keep her at bay....\q
<u>In Remembrance</u> \qNow that the family members are all gathered, we can begin the memorial in tribute of the crew of the Iskánta.\q

<u>Show No Fear</u> \qThe captain of the Easterling scouts in the Rushgore threatens the Woodmen stranded in the marsh, precipitating a confrontation, with the welfare of the merchants hanging in the balance.\q

<u>Realm of the Old Mother</u> \qThranduil Swiftstream, King of the Northern Wood, has finally found his old foe, the spider Iphantemel. Trapped within the rocky crevasse of Torech Emel, Thranduil hopes to keep sight on the spider until the Old Mother can be dealt with.\q

<u>Assault on Bardh-dorám</u> \qThane Ordlac of Oserley convinced Reeve Fríthild to put an end to the White Hand's invasion once and for all by leading an assault against their camp of Bardh-dorám....\q

<u>Vengeance of the Fallen</u> \qIn a desperate bid to rid the Wastes of two terrible foes, Faramir, son of Ondoher, has devised a ruse to set the Wainriders of old against the merciless Black Númenórean, Burudagath the Bloodletter.\q

<u>Sagroth, Lair of Vermin</u> \qYears under the corruptive influence of the Iron Crown have poisoned the land, leading to rumours of monstrosities lurking within Carn Dûm's sewers. A sorcerer named Gárvadach pursued these rumours for his own ambitious purposes. Little did he know, a group of Trév Duvárdain has tracked him down, determined to put an end to his twisted aspirations....\q
<u>Missing in the Marshes</u> \qArtamir has disappeared from his camp. Has he run afoul of some evil in the Dead Marshes...?\q
<u>Those Who Came Before</u> \qYou feel a strong sort of tug to investigate the Bridge of Khazad-dûm once more....\q
<u>The Horn of Gondor</u> \qSomeone cut a mighty swath through the Uruks in the East Wall, but was it enough to save our mutual friends from certain death?\q
<u>The Breaking of the Fellowship</u> \qSomething happened to our mutual friends: the signs of it are everywhere in the East Wall. But did the danger come from without their number... or within?\q

<u>Sâri-surma</u> \qAn evil presence has descended upon the Ice Bay of Forochel, inhabiting a large glacial iceberg. Having sent several hunters to defeat the evil, the Lossoth have asked you to help them destroy this evil once and for all....\q

<u>Plans of the Golden Host</u> \qThe Golden Host of Lothlórien has crossed the river Anduin, but now a second, smaller party must follow in its wake. These are the Elves of the Hidden Guard, chosen to bring the prisoner Mazog to the gates of Dol Guldur.\q

<u>Midnight in the Drownholt</u> \qThe first leg of the Hidden Guard's journey will take them through the treacherous fens of the Drownholt, a perilous road but a necessary one when secrecy is so highly prized.\q
<u>Mazog in the Web</u> \qNow the Hidden Guard must brave the dangerous woods and canyons of the Scuttledells, home to the Saewethil, a brood of venomous spiders that will brook no intrusion…\q
<u>Troubled Friendship</u> \qI know not why my friends Sperling and Brúnstan are fighting, but someone must stop them! I am afraid they are going to injure more than their friendship....\q
<u>Bee's Big Business</u> \qGrimbeorn has agreed to travel with his big bees to the flowering fields of Lossarnach and assist with the pollination efforts upon the meadows!\q
Gond Orchal has been corrupted by a gaunt-lord who is raising Wights from the various tombs. This evil must be defeated.

<u>The Lady's Champion</u> \qBrigands out of the Stonedeans plot to murder Lady Lúfa, the young wife of Thane Ordlac of Oserley. The Thane has devised a plan of his own that appears to heartlessly use his wife as bait for the trap....\q
<u>Blood of the Black Serpent</u> \qAs the Battle of the Pelennor Fields intensifies, the forces of Rohan and Gondor unite to defeat the Men of Harad and their vile King: The Black Serpent.\q
<u>A Dangerous Road</u> \qHaving loaded their waggon and bid their friends good-bye, Runald's family departs from Elthengels. A most dangerous road lies before them....\q

<u>Deep in the Darkening Wood</u> \qDeep within Mirkwood, an ancient enemy has returned. A Beorning trader is lost within a maze of trees and thorns, predators closing in around him. Find a way through, and save him before it is too late.\q
<u>Hilltop Assault</u> \qThe Golden Host is preparing to bring the first act of their invasion on Mirkwood to a close with an all-out assault upon the hill overlooking the landing.\q
The Lonely Mountain of Erebor, a stronghold of the North, must be defended at all costs….
Something is lurking among the ruins along the banks of the Greyflood, and you have been asked to investigate.
The waters of the Greyflood are haunted by tormented spirits. Rhona believes they must be bound there by some power, which she has sent you to discover.
An accursed flame burns in the ruins at the edge of the Greyflood. It must be doused if the spirits there are to be banished.
<u>Hunter's Hunted</u> \qWithin the halls of Dahâl Huliz, the gladiators make their home. Rothog has asked that you question Shaidal.\q
<u>Together Now</u> \qAshâmi and Raphûz are tasked with attacking the cultists as a distraction.\q
The old Arnorian watch-tower of Sutwarden has attracted many foes of the Freepeoples who wish to spy upon the Bree-fields.

<u>Ancient Spirits</u> \qA great power of old lies hidden within the Mournshaws of Enedwaith, and spirits that once wandered the ancient world now roam these woods. Only by confronting these spirits will favour be garnered in the court of the Huntsman.\q
