<u>The Deadly Dinner</u> \qA grand dinner is being hosted by the Elders of Lake-town, however the shadow of the late Master's murder still hangs over the Manor. Is something wicked about to unfold?\q

<u>The Father of the Sutcrofts</u> \qFastred, Reeve of the Sutcrofts, stands in silence at his father's grave -- a respite from his brutal assaults against the Orcs. His grief still fresh, he wishes to speak of Dagred's life and legacy before he takes his leave to Snowbourn.\q
Deep within Wyrmsgráf, there lies a great larder which once belonged to Scatha the Worm. In recent years, it has come to be a feeding ground for the young dragon-kind of Ered Mithrin.

Deep within Wyrmsgráf, there lies a great larder which once belonged to Scatha the Worm. Long lost to the Dwarves of the North, the time has come to reclaim the remains of their ancestors from Scatha.
Deep within Wyrmsgráf, there lies a great larder which once belonged to Scatha the Worm. Rumours have spread of a gluttonous rock-worm dwelling among the bones of Scatha's long-devoured prey.

<u>A Dark Pact</u> \qAfter investigating strange occurrences throughout the vale, you have tracked an invader from Tarlang's Crown to the Hill of Erech. While their identity remains unknown, they intend to form a pact with the Ruthless Dead - a union that could spell doom for Gondor.\q

<u>Vile Tongues</u> \qWith the aid of Mithrandir and Gúldil, you have tracked the scroll-thief to the Old Archives. If he cannot be reached before unleashing the fell magicks bound to the scroll through the Enemy's sorcery, Minas Tirith may be undone from within.\q

<u>Laying to Rest the Evil Dead</u> \qHeralded by the demise of the gaunt-man Gúrdring, Glorfindel fears the return of Ferndúr the Virulent to the Trollshaws. Hoping to strike before Ferndúr's strength grows too great, Glorfindel has enlisted your aid in quelling the threat posed by this ancient Gaunt-lord of Morgoth.\q

<u>Guiding the Misguided</u> \qGwin Curhonon, a hobbit of the Gloomglens, was captured by the bugan, wild goblins owing allegiance to no one. Now he seeks the help of a brave hero to bring him to safety.\q

<u>A Place for Hobbits</u> \qIt is known as Bâr Thorenion, or the hidden house, for it is nearly that. Hidden and much abandoned. Nothing some rolled up sleeves and a little honest labour cannot set right!\q
<u>Deeper In</u> \qWell we've got to go back in now, that's how I figure it. Pipeweed and suspicious fellows! Now I want answers even more than I thought I wanted treasure.\q
<u>A Meal in Cormallen</u> \qIt is so good to be here with you, old friends. And doing something so Hobbit-like as sharing a proper meal.\q

<u>World Behind and Home Ahead</u> \qWould you look at this. All of us here again, gathered round! At least as many of us as there could be. What I mean to say is, it wouldn't be so, if not for our friend here.\q
Maddened stone-giants take to their dwellings in the rocky slopes of Câr Bronach, and where they walk, only trouble will follow….

<u>Retaking Pelargir</u> \qThe Corsair fleet has tarried on Gondor's coast, pillaging on their way. Now Aragorn's host has caught up with them at the port city of Pelargir. Join Elladan and Elrohir in an advance party to clear the path for Aragorn's assault on the unsuspecting Corsair force.\q

<u>Wary Riders</u> \qI know not why I am disturbed by Reeve Athelward's hospitality, but I sense that not all will be well for us if we remain. This night, we must leave Cliving like thieves, else danger takes us unaware....\q
<u>Trading Fates</u> \qHaving seen his people ride to safety at Edoras, Thane Mágla awaits death in his Mead Hall as the White Hand prepares to raze Middlemead.\q
<u>Signs and Portents</u> \qThe dreaming mind sees much, and much is seen of it...\q

<u>The Fallen Kings</u> \qIt is said that the nine Nazgûl would assemble, in those days of battle, to best their greatest adversaries and to strike relentless fear into those who dared face them in combat.\q
<u>Forest for the Trees</u> \qRepulsed by the destruction the White Hand and Núrzum have caused in the forest, the Ents of Balewood march to war.\q
<u>Celebration of Victory</u> \qDespite Reeve Fríthild's misgivings with the victory at Bardh-dorám, Thane Ordlac has prompted her to hold a celebration feast....\q
Trolls and their ilk have occupied and sullied a once proud hall within Gundabad.
<u>Undermining Ushkútoz</u> \qDesperate to break a bloody stalemate in the War of Three Peaks, Agnar has devised a plan to infiltrate Ushkútoz and impair the defences of the forces of Gundabad.\q
<u>The Retaking of Cair Andros</u> \qThe Faint-hearted, that I have dismissed, now wish to quell their shame by retaking the island fortress of Cair Andros, for Gondor.\q
<u>The Trial of Wrath</u> \qIn haste to destroy an artifact such as this, a trial must be overcome.\q
<u>The Trial of Madness</u> \qIn haste to destroy an artifact such as this, a trial of madness must be overcome. A failure, and one shall indeed face a certain death.\q
<u>Many Worries</u> \qMeanwhile, Halbarad of the Dúnedain struggles to decide the best course of action for the Rangers under his command.\q

<u>Adkhât-zahhar, the Houses of Rest</u> \qDeep in the Pit of Stonejaws, a grand tomb holds the remains of the many ancient dwarf-lords of Gundabad. The necromancer Loknashra, now empowerd with the spirit of Drugoth, has returned to raise an army and claim her vengeance upon all those who wronged her.\q

<u>The Deeping Wall</u> \qThe dike has been overrun. Now, the full weight of Saruman's army prepares to crash down upon the valiant defenders upon the ramparts of the Deeping Wall. The wall must stand or the fortress will surely fall.\q
<u>The Narrow Way</u> \qA brave Elf-scout finds herself trapped behind enemy lines in the darkness of Taur Morvith. There is naught but a single narrow bridge to offer hope of escape.\q

<u>Springing the Trap</u> \qThe Rangers of the North have learned that Mordrambor, a Black Númenórean deep in the counsels of Amarthiel, is travelling to Haudh Elendil with a small retinue. Hoping to seize Mordrambor, the Rangers stage an ambush....\q
<u>A Caper On Honeymead Lane</u> \qWe have to get that present back before Angelica opens it! Don't let anyone see you!\q
<u>A Very Boffin House-warming</u> \qIt took some time getting here, but all's well that ends well, I suppose. At last Angelica will have her party!\q

<u>A Minstrel's Hope</u> \qSeveral citizens of the besieged town of Trestlebridge have taken refuge in nearby caves, hoping to wait out the siege, but the Orcs have become aware of the townsfolk's hiding place. It is up to the minstrel Leigh Putnam and her friends to warn them....\q

<u>The Stars' Favour</u> \qBelieving the stars' favour might herald an auspicious end to the Iron Garrison's efforts to reclaim Khazad-dûm, Byrski Hardprow has enlisted your aid for an expedition onto the Mirrormere to seek out Durin's Crown...\q
<u>Shanties in the Storm</u> \qAs a storm batters Bree-town, Barliman Butterbur looks to you and your gifts for storytelling and song to raise the spirits of his customers in the Prancing Pony....\q

<u>The Fate of the Ectheldur</u> \qLong ago a great ship of Annúminas, the Ectheldur, sank beneath the waters of Lake Evendim, and both its storied history and the precious artifact it housed were lost to the Dúnedain. Now, a band of tomb-robbers out of the South seek for where the Ectheldur came to rest, hoping to pillage it for their own gain....\q
<u>Only Half-Remembered</u> \qI will bring you to my friend, but do not disturb his rest. My song keeps him at peace.\q
A group of Brigands have locked themselves in the mines of Writhenset, in a last ditch effort to control their foothold in the Wildwood.
A group of Tarkrîp Orcs seek to collapse the mines of Writhenset!
Within the depths of the mines of Writhenset, a brood of spiders grows restless.

<u>Halls of Crafting</u> \qThere were no greater craftsmen than the Dwarves of Khazad-dûm. Those days are now gone, and Mazog's Orcs, with the aid of Black Uruks from Dol Guldur, have taken the ancient crafting halls of Moria to forge their vile weapons of war.\q

<u>A Road Through the Dark</u> \qWhile out for a night-time stroll in the Shire, there is a certain unpleasant feeling lingering about... something on the air is strange tonight. Perhaps it is only the unseasonable chill, or the great darkness of this particular evening. But surely it is nothing noteworthy, for this is the Shire, and it is rare indeed for any evil to touch this land.\q
<u>The Shield-maiden's Training</u> \qThe desire to train against more unpredictable foes has drawn Ides' attention to the bears roaming just beyond the training grounds.\q

<u>The Changing Wind</u> \qAmalíbi, the rebel leader in Khûd Zagin, asked you to corner Bosóta Dôlo, a captain of the Ordâkhai occupiers to persuade him to assist the rebellion in exchange for his life and a return to his homeland.\q

<u>The Blade That Was Broken</u> \qThe time of Isildur's Heir is at hand. With the recovery of the last Silithar, Elrond has commanded that the light of Narsil, which cut the One Ring from the hand of Sauron, be renewed and rekindled as Anduril, the Flame of the West....\q

<u>Sons of Leaf and Stone</u> \qThough the memory be now dim, of old Elves and dwarves were close in friendship. Legolas of Mirkwood and Gimli the dwarf, through shared hardship, have rekindled the old bonds. Even now they look for Orcs to slay beneath the eaves of Lothlórien.\q

<u>The Lost Workshop</u> \qThe workshop of Melkólf Stonecarver may hold the key to freeing the dwarf Bori from the clutches of Mazog. There is rumour of a secret escape passage from the throne room of Durin, and knowledge of it may be found amid Melkólf's possessions.\q

<u>The Secret Road</u> \qThe secret way out of the throne room of Durin was known to a few only, all of whom perished during the fall of the great dwarf-kingdom. But the errant mark of a forgotten scribe preserved a record of its existence, and now it may be used to rescue the dwarf Bori from the clutches of the Orcs.\q

<u>The Worries of Lord Celeborn</u> \qThe defeat of Mazog has sent ripples of hope throughout the dwarves of the Iron Garrison; though it be short-lived, my husband Celeborn must be satisfied with that victory and turn his eyes towards other dangers on the horizon.\q

<u>Escape from Rushdurinul</u> \qIssuriel listened to the tale of your adventure along the Secret Road into Rushdurinul, where the Orc-king Mazog was seized by the dwarves... but there was more to the story, and now she waits for you to tell it.\q

<u>Return to Azanarukâr</u> \qIn the depths of Azanarukâr, the sorceries of Gorothúl have set into motion an evil that cannot be ignored. You have come with Magor into the dark reaches, and must end this threat before it is too late.\q

<u>The White-hand in Darkness</u> \qSaruman's attempts to bring the Orcs of Moria under his sway will only be ended when his minions perish. The valour of the dwarves must be relied upon in these dark times. At Stazgnâkh, the White Hand must be cut off....\q

<u>The Drowned Treasury</u> \qIn the flooded depths of Moria was the great axe Zigilburk lost. Few have ever tried to find it, and fewer ever returned from their quests. Who now remains to challenge the shadows that linger in the dark halls of the deep places...?\q

<u>The First Assault</u> \qSensing weakness in the humble crofting settlement of Walstow, the Orcs of Mordor have poured forth from the East Wall in hopes of claiming part of the Sutcrofts for their dark master.\q

<u>Mazog</u> \qPride oft heralds woe, it is said. With the power of the mithril axe Zigilburk at hand, will pride overthrow the dwarves who seek to reclaim Moria, or will it fuel the fire that burns within them to drive forth Mazog from Zabadgathol at last?\q

<u>New Devilry</u> \qWith the absence of the Balrog, other powers less great, yet terrible still, have arisen in the dark places. Mazog has sent his Orcs into the Shadowy Abyss to entreat or control these powers...though it may prove his undoing....\q

<u>The Mirror of Galadriel</u> \qJealously do I guard my secrets, not the least of which is my mirror. Still there are times which require a greater knowledge, and this is one such time. Shadows gather in the east, and the fates of lost friends burns in the heart....\q

<u>Before the Doors of Durin</u> \qLong have Durin's Folk desired to look upon the halls of Moria once again, to reclaim their birthright from the goblins and Orcs who now dwell there. Has that time now come? Not even I can foresee their fate....\q
<u>Finding Meneldor</u> \qThe search for the great eagle Meneldor has brought you to a large spider cave in the Wailing Hills, a dwelling most perilous for a denizen of the skies.\q

<u>The Empty Passage</u> \qThe Heart of Fire, the great forging room where Durin's Axe was birthed was lost in ages past, but the discovery of the Way of Smiths would bring fresh hope to those who seek to reclaim the glory of Khazad-dûm....\q

<u>Assault on Dhúrstrok</u> \qHigh among the catwalks of Deepscrave lies Dhúrstrok, the stronghold of Gorgar the Ruthless. Somewhere within these ageing halls filled with dwarf-relics, Gorgar's loyal generals have imprisoned Lord Náin. It is up to you to free him.\q
<u>The Raiding Party</u> \qHuneric, Lord of the Thíuda, has noticed the Enemy forces gathering at Mokh Darga and wishes to halt their raid upon Adambel before it begins.\q
<u>The Siege of Gondamon</u> \qThe Dourhands have forged an alliance with the Blue Crag goblins and have laid siege to Gondamon for nearly two weeks. The final assault will be launched soon....\q

<u>The Fellowship Departs</u> \qThe household of Elrond Halfelven gather to bid farewell to nine brave adventurers, entrusted with a secret task which could mean the salvation or doom of Middle-earth... I, Gandalf the Grey, must lead them along dark roads....\q
<u>Assault on Rath Teraig</u> \qThe combined forces of Lord Dwalin of Thorin's Hall and Dorongúr Whitethorn of Duillond prepare to march upon the goblin-army at Rath Teraig....\q

<u>Dungeons of Dol Guldur</u> \qThe Dungeons of Dol Guldur are famed for their terror. Thrain, father of Thorin Oakenshield, perished here… though not before passing his legacy to Gandalf the Grey….\q
<u>A Commanding Knock</u> \qLoud noises from outside the Crossing-hall require Borhador to seek your aid and quell his fear of an Orkish invasion.\q

Wargs make the hills their home and collect an impressive number of bones. It is unclear if the bones belong to the free folk or other victims. Regardless, the threat from these beasts is too great to let them remain.
A good number of folk have gone missing and it is unclear if the wargs alone are responsible. Scouts have seen that some were taken to the warg pits and you are asked to see about rescuing them.
Brigands intent on training wolves near Mossward must be stopped before they can use the wolves against the people in the town. Stop this practice before it begins.

You are tasked with entering the ruins outside of Mossward to eliminate the remaining pack-leader from the pair that lead the wolves there. Since the death of her mate, the wolf-matron in the ruins has been aggressive and so has her pack.
<u>The Auction</u> \qAll is ready for the auction. It is an event not unlike a warrior's arena, for my clan is accustomed to waging war with words and coin....\q
<u>The Runes of Malice</u> \qVarthmath, the brave Beorning, trusts his keen senses in that something indeed stirs the creatures of Máttugard from within caverns, deep under the Mighty Court.\q
The post is late from the Shire and the news is that something has the post-carrier spooked and unwilling to make the crossing. You have been sent to investigate.

<u>We Cannot Get Out</u> \qAlas that Balin son of Fundin believed he could reclaim Moria with but a small force. As the Company of the Ring learned, the numbers of the Orcs and the might of Durin's Bane could not easily be turned aside....\q
Amon Firn is occupied by half-orcs. Their leader must be somewhere amongst the ruins. Defeat him!
The Orcs and Wargs have returned to Shathur-munzu, attempting to set up a new base south of the warfront….
The Orcs and Wargs have returned to Shathur-munzu, attempting to set up a new base south of the warfront….
Travellers speak of shifting lights enticing them from the roads toward the ruins of Gorthad. You have intrepidly entered the ruin to investigate and root out the source of this evil.

<u>Foreword: Many Unhappy Returns</u> \qVery long ago, there lived by the banks of the Great River a clever-handed and quiet-footed little people. There was among them a family of high repute, ruled by a Grandmother, and the most inquisitive and curious-minded of that family was named Sméagol.\q
<u>Eskil's Escape</u> \qWe will find and rescue Eskil Bloodthumb... and my lost axe as well!\q
<u>A Theft of Freedom</u> \qI do not know if we can trust him. If we cannot, there are none better than you to endure the possibility of betrayal, and triumph.\q
<u>The Next Move</u> \qBelondor wishes to discuss with us what the future may hold for Gondor and for Umbar.\q
<u>Shadows In Jirush</u> \qThe fortress sleeps, but it sleeps with an eye open. We must take care not to wake it too soon.\q
<u>Something Has Awoken</u> \qWe must be careful. Maurûsh crawls with Orcs.\q
<u>Outrun the Wind, Outrun the Waves</u> \qRide for Umbar! Ride with haste!\q
<u>The River Gate</u> \qIt is not too late, my friend. Our warning will reach the Kindred with hours to spare.\q
<u>The Cage and the Captives</u> \qI hope they are all right.\q
<u>The Uprising Begins</u> \qGo, then, and good fortune go with you! Good fortune go with us all!\q
<u>Atop the Island</u> \qNow we will end the threat of Balakhâd and Nakási once and for all!\q
<u>The Wizard, the Queen, and the Kindred</u> \qWhat seems to be the problem here?\q
<u>Calling On Cúridwan</u> \qWhat is it, Glorfindel? What have you seen?\q
<u>A Greater Power</u> \qThe hidden temple of the Thardúth stands before us.\q
<u>Return to Ashâgir</u> \qWe must reach the hidden chamber before it is too late!\q
<u>The Madness In His Eyes</u> \qI wish we need not make use of the Hungry Fire... but we have no choice!\q
<u>Sigileth In The Darkness</u> \qGreat evil resides within this place. We should find my sister and get out of here!\q
<u>Unnatural Winter</u> \qI was born in Dunfast, many years ago. What has happened to the village I remember?\q
<u>Théoden, Son of Thengel</u> \qWe have returned to Meduseld, against the King's orders, but we do not seem to be the only ones come to the Golden Hall to speak words of warning....\q

<u>Commands of the King</u> \qThéoden King has stepped beyond his hall to look upon the kingdom. What will he see, I wonder? And will it move him to strike down the evils arrayed against his people?\q
<u>The Missing</u> \qWe have tracked the Orcs to the cave of Burg-shápol, but will we find the captive craftsmen in time?\q
<u>Eyes of Edoras</u> \qWe have returned to Edoras and should see how Éowyn fares with her duties.\q
<u>The Soothsayer</u> \qRubbish and nonsense. Herubrand may believe the words of this soothsayer, but I will not fall for her trickery.\q
<u>Allies Unexpected</u> \qAfter a short rest, the company sets out for Isengard and finds the road greatly changed...\q
<u>Lothrandir</u> \qThere are many hidden rooms within the ring of Isengard. Does my kinsman live still within one of these chambers?\q
<u>A Need for Words</u> \qThe men atop the wall need words of inspiration if they are to stand against Saruman's armies.\q
<u>Secret Ways</u> \qDo not be blinded by the beauty of the Glittering Caves, my friend! We must see to the safety of the folk that shelter here!\q
<u>The Mystery of Zul-mazal</u> \qTogether we will learn what secrets lie hidden within the walls of this chamber!\q
<u>The Dreaming Dwarf</u> \qI say again: show yourself to us, villain! Only cowards hide behind such a veil of deception!\q
<u>The Greymaul Rebellion</u> \qOnce seen, it was by the Mirrormere that Durin's heart dwelt evermore. When he went there to live, it was I, Mótsog, he left to rule Gundabad in his name.\q
<u>The Sunder-battle</u> \qThis was the plan of Durin, foolhardy as it must have seemed to those who cared for him: it began with his surrender.\q
<u>The Legacy of Durin</u> \qThe battle was ended, but there were tears still to shed.\q
<u>The Voice of the Dragon</u> \qAll of you know why we are here. This is a sacred place, a dwarf place. This is Gundabad!\q
<u>The Last Greymaul</u> \qThe two of you must reach the peak!\q
<u>A Request</u> \qI just want to talk.\q
<u>The Sons of Isildur</u> \qThis siege has lasted much longer than anyone expected, or hoped.\q

<u>Tales of the Bright Company</u> \qGlorfindel and the Bright Company have accomplished many heroic feats in service of High King Gil-galad. But be not over-awed! I have found them friendly and approachable both.\q
<u>All Is Quiet</u> \qAll is quiet, and our victory will soon be at hand. And to think you doubted this would be easy!\q
<u>The Council of Kings</u> \qI have shown our trophies to the guard, and he at least will allow us inside.\q
<u>A Bad Birthday</u> \qThis may be the last meal we take all together: before the end of the war, or our lives!\q
<u>The Glory of the Bright Company</u> \qWe came without incident to the tunnel of Halroth, and ventured within. Our greatest danger lay ahead.\q
<u>Gothmog's Rage</u> \qIf you do not follow my commands it will be your death, prisoner! Now move!\q
<u>A Vengeful Heart</u> \qSomeone else has entered the tower! Be on guard!\q
<u>The Picture Painted</u> \qListen now to my words, and the words of Vóin.\q
<u>The Sword and the Stonemaiden</u> \qThese are the Halls of Memory, where the words of Vóin give shape to deeds from long ago. Hold your questions, Faramir!\q
<u>The Warrior Remade</u> \qThis story begins during the reign of King Eärnil II, who was troubled by the loss of Minas Ithil to the forces of the Witch-king.\q
<u>The Battle of Lórien</u> \qThe Orcs of Moria have come down from the mountains, and as they launch their attack on Lothlórien, Elf and Elf-friend alike must stand against them, or perish...\q
<u>Passage Into Dunland</u> \qYou have been invited to join a band of Dunlendings as you pass into Trum Dreng.\q

<u>The Forges of Isengard</u> \qIt would appear that Saruman has been attempting to craft an abundance of Legendary Weapons to fortify the armouries of the White Hand. This forge should be a wealth of useful Legendary components; these will serve the Free Peoples far better than the smiths of Saruman.\q

<u>The Last Refuge</u> \qSkorgrím's Dourhands have taken refuge from the wrath of Durin's Folk within an ancient dwarf-hold high in the passes of the Misty Mountains. There, they plot their return, unless an end can be put to their scheming once and for all....\q

<u>Boss from the Vaults: Storvâgûn</u> \qHigh in the cliffs above Helegrod, the traitorous Storvâgûn has pledged the giants of the Misty Mountains to the service of Angmar in exchange for vast riches.\q
<u>The Forgotten Lords</u> \qWithin the Dead City of Minas Morgul, a forgotten chamber of the Witch-king has opened. What lies within the Fiend-house of Roz Dagalur, none can say.\q

<u>Flame and Shadow</u> \qRemarkable darkness and a long-forgotten cavern live out the years in silent stillness, and will soon be disturbed at last by the inimitable torch you now bear. Your instructions now bid you to seek an extraordinary flame to set this great beacon alight.\q
<u>Ashâmi's Challenge</u> \qAshâmi must face a fearsome serval terrorizing the people of Urmâkh to earn favour with Numûru.\q
<u>Desire above Strength</u> \qIdes has quickly grown to trust you as a mentor. She wishes to discuss with you her aspirations and her fears.\q
<u>The Mysterious Thief</u> \qNight has fallen on the trading village of Loeglond. Now is the time to enact Sírithon's plan, patrolling the village in hopes of catching mysterious bandit.\q
The Taurogrim have taken over Óinsbridge as their corruption spreads out past the Thornholt….
The Taurogrim have taken over Óinsbridge as their corruption threatens all in the Grey Mountains….
<u>All that Remains</u> \qYou have escorted Inhild to the home of Randgar, offering her the chance to have closure regarding the death of the man she once loved.\q
In the armoury of Ashmâr-zarakh, the Orcs of Gundabad make ready their weapons of war. Little do the Trolls of Gundabad fear, for their own might is enough….
In the armoury of Ashmâr-zarakh, the Orcs of Gundabad make ready their weapons of war. Many ballistae peer from its battlements, keeping watch on the gates of Gundabad below….
In the armoury of Ashmâr-zarakh, the Orcs of Gundabad make ready their weapons of war. Rumours speak of an Orc of Angmar drawn into Gorgar's service….

<u>Thief-taker's Bane</u> \qA simple quest to recover ancient Dúnedain relics from the hands of the grave-robbers who stole them has gone terribly awry. The thieves will not allow the Rangers and their allies to take their treasures from them so easily....\q
<u>Across the Ikorbân</u> \qRaphûz invited you to speak with him ahead of his move to Khûd Zagin.\q

<u>Ost Dunhoth</u> \qFrom behind the walls of Ost Dunhoth, a terrible foe sends his malice out into Middle-earth. Gortheron, greatest of the Gaunt-lords, must be defeated before his plans can come to fruition….\q

<u>A Thief in the Night</u> \qThe hobbit-burglar Atherol Took has learned that some of the Big Folk who have been causing trouble in the Southfarthing of the Shire are planning to sneak onto Farmer Maggot's land and steal his mushrooms. Atherol has no intention of allowing hobbit-mushrooms to be stolen by Men....\q
<u>Instance: Faltharan's Confrontation</u> \qYou have tracked down where the traitor Lorvegil is located, and are ready to bring him to justice.\q
At Nímbarth, half-men from the south make ready for war. It is time to foil their plans.

<u>Into the Silver Deep</u> \qWhile about to begin your long day of work at the Silverdeep Mine, an old Man beckons for you to come near. He is a close advisor of Thorin Oakenshield, the master of these halls. What could he have to say to a simple miner such as yourself?\q
Those of Trader's Wharf have all been called away, and you are the only one left to defend the docks from attackers.
Meats are needed to feed those in the war efforts….
A beast in Misthallow has been terrorizing those on the southern path from the Grey Mountains….
<u>Last March of the Ents</u> \qWe marched... marched... marched to war... to Isengard...\q
<u>The Roving Threats of Central Gondor</u> \qYou gather to defeat the Hardened enemies of Central Gondor who have banded together to stand off against those who oppose them.\q
<u>Awakening</u> \qAt Abkân'aban, the Stone of Wakening, the Angmarim of the Iron Crown seek to master the white forge of Durin the Deathless, forever defiling the hallowed caverns of Gloomingtarn.\q
<u>Fangorn's Edge</u> \qYou have found my lumber-camp. Very impressive. Few know of its existence. Do you think you can stop the tide of progress? The war will continue. The time of Man is over.\q

<u>Instance: Parphád</u> \qLong have the ruins of Parphád remained closed to the inquisitive and invaders alike. Not content with this, invaders have breached the gates of the ruins and threaten the relics contained within. Ascbert has tasked you with preserving the relics and texts within, even if that effort means confronting the invaders.\q

<u>Instance: Storm on the Withered Heath</u> \qThe barren, burnt expanse of the Withered Heath is deceptive in appearing empty. After centuries untouched by dwarves, it is rich in resources, history, and peril.\q

<u>Odd Benefactors</u> \qThe Dunlendings in Cuvnerth have been receiving supplies from a mysterious source somewhere within a nearby cave. Whatever the foe that aids our enemies, it must be stopped!\q

<u>Fornost</u> \qFornost, the last capitol of the fallen North Kingdom. It is here that the Witch-king of Angmar crushed the realm of Arnor, and it is here to which Angmar has returned to conquer Eriador.\q

<u>Fornost</u> \qFornost, the last capitol of the fallen North Kingdom. It is here that the Witch-king of Angmar crushed the realm of Arnor, and it is here to which Angmar has returned to conquer Eriador.\q

<u>Ghashan-kútot, the Halls of Black Lore</u> \qLong ago, this was a great hall of Númenórean wisdom and learning. A shining beacon high in the Moon-lit City. Until it was set to the torch by the Witch-king, and from the ashes, an endless repository of sorceries and secrets; the blackest knowledge. Here, I continue my life's work.\q
<u>Dargnákh Unleashed</u> \qA brave band of adventurers.... Think you that this drain is long-abandoned? You cannot imagine what lies ahead.\q

<u>The Unmarked Trail</u> \qAn ancient evil, a corruption of the very nature of Middle-earth, threatens to spread its vile poison throughout the Trollshaws. This evil must be thwarted before it can be brought to bear against the hidden vale of Rivendell.\q
<u>Wrath of the Reeve</u> \qI have taken to the battlefield, hoping to inspire and reassure my people. We fight together, and I wish to witness firsthand your ability in combat.\q
<u>Doom of Caras Gelebren</u> \qDetermined to possess the Great Rings of Power, Sauron made war upon the Elves and led his vast armies to Eregion to lay waste to Caras Gelebren....\q
<u>The Defence of Minas Tirith</u> \qThe War for Gondor begins as Sauron's armies march for Minas Tirith. Can the Men of Gondor master their fear before the Enemy claims the White City?\q
<u>The Grey King</u> \qThe terrible beast known in legend as the Grey King has long haunted the passes of the Gloomglens, waiting in secret to throw boulders down upon the heads of the unwary.\q
<u>A Flurry of Fireworks</u> \qWhat a perfect evening for a fireworks celebration! Gandalf the Grey wishes to launch a grand fireworks display for the folks of Bree Town!\q
<u>The Perilous Pact</u> \qA vision of Fram the Foremost, fighting a fierce mountain-drake, comes into view.\q
<u>The Death of Scatha</u> \qA vision of Fram the Foremost and Karazgar, confronting the dreaded long-worm, Scatha, comes into view.\q

<u>Fram's Folly</u> \qFram was taken aback by his own demeanour. He loathed his unwillingness to mend the rift between the dwarves and the Ai-thúda. When he understood the curse upon him, he made a plan and acted upon it.\q
<u>Humble Beginnings</u> \qWhat do you mean? Have you really decided to do this, then?\q

<u>Remembrance</u> \qToo many of the Dúnedain have fallen to the ravages of one who is their distant kinsman. There is a time for mourning, but is this that time, when the Champion of Angmar might secure her ring, Narchuil...?\q
<u>A Lock with No Key</u> \qKhôltekh has asked you to accompany him back to his Umbari manor, so he can think clearly about the riddle of the key to Dâr Sêkhta.\q
<u>Heirloom of Cardolan</u> \qYour efforts to cleanse the evils from the corrupted sceptre have led you to a remote barrow....\q

<u>A Venomous Strike</u> \qThe deadly Ungoledain now occupy these dwarf ruins on the outskirts of Thornholt and have been a menace to its inhabitants. They need to be driven away from the area before they can sow more of their venomous chaos.\q
<u>The Secret of Stormwall</u> \qDeep within the ruined crafting halls of Stormwall lies a burning secret, slumbering in the shadows....\q

<u>Necessary Sacrifices</u> \qDesperate to be rid of the innumerable spiders and other foul creatures now feeding on the Orcs of Lhingris, Captain Róglarg of Cirith Ungol has gathered a company of Orcs to be sacrificed as tribute to Her Ladyship, Shelob.\q
TBD…
Goblins have overrun Limael's Vineyard. A party of the wretched creatures broke into an old wine-cellar and stole a number of flasks of a rare and ancient vintage.
<u>Pit-fighter</u> \qThe arena of Thorzhaf is home to a pit-fighting tournament, where the greatest warriors battle for fame and power.\q
Deep within a cavern, there are bunches of crystals that have been twisted by dark magic. Angmarim have driven a pack of wargs into this cavern hoping to corrupt the beasts.

<u>Unbridled Wrath</u> \qRuin! Wrack and ruin! These Orcs and uruks have brought ruin to my home, and I will bring ruin to them! If it were not for that tree... or was it a giant? A giant tree? No matter... if it had not saved me, I would not be alive to take my revenge....\q
<u>The Hands of a Healer</u> \qA great effort has been expended to find kingsfoil for the wounded, but now their survival depends upon Aragorn's healing skill.\q
<u>Let's Take the Hornburg!</u> \qYou have survived the long night standing before the walls of the Hornburg, and it is time to take your prize at last. The horse-men must fall!\q
<u>Núrzum's Wrath</u> \qNúrzum has sown discord throughout Wildermore, but nowhere was the power of the stone felt greater than where his path of destruction began deep in Balewood.\q

<u>Remmorchant, the Net of Darkness</u> \qFar beneath the Ephel Dúath, in the deepest caverns of Torech Ungol, lies the Remmorchant, the Net of Darkness. There, wreathed in webs of shadow only the Light of Eärendil might hope to penetrate, lies the lair of Ungwetári, last child of Ungoliant.\q

<u>The Feast of the Running Stag</u> \qElder Riagán has welcomed you to Lhan Tarren and invited you to join in the Feast of the Running Stag, the Stag Clan's annual ritual. You should join your friends at the feast and respectfully observe the rites.\q

<u>Bult-kâr</u> \qOnce one of the great lumber store-houses of Moria, Bult-kâr has long since fallen into the domain of Orc and beast. The Iron Garrison, in need of supplies to fuel their reclamation efforts, see Bult-kâr as a crucial location that must be brought back into the control of the dwarves.\q
In the far eastern edges of Angmar lies The Rift. The passage through the mountains there is one of few that the Iron Crown has taken to the slopes of Gundabad….
In the far eastern edges of Angmar lies The Rift. The passage through the mountains there is one of few that the Iron Crown has taken to the slopes of Gundabad….
<u>Rothog's Fury</u> \qNow with proof of her treachery, Rothog calls forth Zarzíra Dawn-star for questioning.\q
Ice-giants have plundered treasures from deep within Gundabad….
Frost-horde Emissaries have begun to lend aid to ice-giants in a mountain pass leading towards an entrance in Gundabad….
<u>Borangos The Horror</u> \qNargroth, realm of Borangos, entrenched with otherworldly fires, houses more mysteries than the answers in which Isnír seeks.\q

<u>In Defence of Eaworth</u> \qAgainst my wishes, my son Ingmar has taken to the field against the Orcs of Maustazg. He thinks of the glory victory would bring him, but not the grief it would bring to those who love him should he perish....\q
The key to more powerful explosives may lie in the slimy secretions of gredbyg....

<u>Tusks of the Boar</u> \qWhile sailing up-river to deliver crucial information to others who might stand against Isengard, the Boar-clan comes across a great muster of Dunlendings. Rather than stand idly by, they attempt to hinder the army in Wulf's Cleft by destroying their siege-engines.\q

<u>Protectors of Thangúlhad</u> \qWhat was once an important fortification of the Enemy is now held by a small band of Elves. Unfortunately, the Enemy is marching there in force. Fortunately, some of the ballistae and catapults still function....\q
<u>The Drowned Relics</u> Many ancient relics are believed to have drowned in the Dunbog, but lucky anglers can often snare these treasures.\q
Although it once served as a camp of the Ungoledain, Kêr Bréin has fallen to the Frost-horde. There, the cold-drakes of Ered Mithrin lay their eggs within its ruined walls.

Although it once served as a camp of the Ungoledain, Kêr Bréin has fallen to the Frost-horde. From within its ruined walls, a powerful hobgoblin leads the raids on Skarháld and keeps watch on the newly-laid eggs of the Frost-horde.

<u>Retaking Pelargir</u> \qThe Corsair fleet has tarried on Gondor's coast, pillaging on their way. Now Aragorn's host has caught up with them at the port city of Pelargir. Join Elladan and Elrohir in an advance party to clear the path for Aragorn's assault on the unsuspecting Corsair force.\q
Brigands have taken the ruins of Ruddymore as a base of operations. You have been tasked with taking it back.

<u>Helm's Dike</u> \qHelm's Dike forms the first barrier of defence for Rohan's final stand. The rearguard left here must buy time for the defenders to prepare the fortress and wall for the oncoming siege. Saruman's army marches, angry and ready for war.\q
<u>Grimslade Will Burn</u> \qThe half-orc prisoner, terrified of burning along with Grimslade, has disclosed a planned attack by the servants of Saruman.\q
Captain Lachír's single fixation has taken him and his men deep into Anglach. But what is this miraculous metal he claims to have found there? Can good truly come out of the forges of darkness?

<u>The Dog-catcher, Part 3</u> \qI know not why Namâkh embarked to Shakhdag. I wish he had merely told me he needed time alone, and had not put his life so foolishly in danger. We must search for signs of Namâkh or clues of his presence among the savage boar.\q

<u>The Dog-catcher, Part 4</u> \qYou have traced Namâkh and Barûl to this abandoned house in Urmâkh. Inside, the smell is musty, infused with the scent of blood. As you enter, you see Namâkh bound in the corner, with Barûl standing over him.\q

<u>A Lore-master's Will</u> \qThe Elf-loremaster Isferon received a gift from his friend Berenin before he passed over the Sea, but the gift is wrapped in a riddle. Before the gift can be revealed Berenin's puzzle must be solved....\q

<u>A Burglar's Errand</u> \qMedhrod, a legendary sword once wielded by a great hero who helped keep the Great East Road clear of threats, has been stolen by the half-orcs of Naerost, leading Palma Brownlock, a hobbit-burglar of no small reputation, to gather allies to recover it....\q
<u>The Want-kin</u> \qBearing no banners of allegiance, a curious company of dwarves has made camp in Elderslade. Whether they prove to be friends or foes remains to be seen....\q

<u>The Fading of the Forests</u> \qThe trees of this grove are beautiful and perfect. It is absurd for them to sit idle when they could be put to such good use by the woodworkers of Iridír. Let us talk some sense into this Shanthar of Arwáth.\q
<u>The Deeping Wall</u> \qThe armies of Isengard have brought great ladders with which to scale the wall. Push them down, push them down!\q
Brigands have overrun Gaervarad. You are tasked with defeating every last enemy amongst the ruins.
<u>Helm's Dike</u> \qThe rampart across Helm's Dike will be the first line of defence. But for how long will it hold?\q
<u>Defence at the Carrock</u> \qIn the morning mist, shadows came to the Carrock. As they singed the horizon, my only thought was to protect the sacred rock with my life.\q
<u>Strike Against Dannenglor</u> \qHere at Dannenglor, the Enemy holds and interrogates those they have captured in battle. The prisoners must be rescued swiftly!\q
<u>Negotiations</u> \qYou have earned the respect of the formidable Captain Jajax, and he will now negotiate with you regarding the fate of Lothgobel.\q

<u>Stand at Amon Sûl</u> \qNot long ago a great battle was fought upon the peak of Weathertop between Gandalf the Grey and the Nine. Evil has been drawn to Amon Sûl, where the Ranger Candaith seeks to hold the hill for the Rangers of the North....\q
Far from Angmar, upon the Gates of Gundabad, the Iron Crown keep watch over Elderslade as they seek to hold on to power in Gundabad….
Far from Angmar, upon the Gates of Gundabad, the Iron Crown keep watch over Elderslade as they seek to hold on to power in Gundabad….
Take the fight to the Orcs in their camp at Sar-kidul.
<u>Thorog's Legacy</u> \qSigrun, a Dwarf in the Misty Mountains, has seen The Weeping Warrior and seeks to examine the corpse of dead Dragon, Thorog.\q
<u>The Snows Come Again</u> \qYou cannot ignore the shiver that travels down your spine as the cold air creeps in over Byre Tor.\q
The wood-trolls known as the Taurogrim still haunt much of Eryn Lasgalen. If Gorgar rouses them to battle, they will pose a great threat….
The wood-trolls known as the Taurogrim still haunt much of Eryn Lasgalen. Deep in Grazadh-gropor, they spread their corruption among the trees….

<u>The Silent Street</u> \qIn his haste to save Faramir, Beregond has thrown open the Fen Hollen and makes for the House of the Stewards. In his wake, the enemies of Gondor descend on Rath Dínen, the Silent Street, all hoping to bring the rule of the Stewards to an end.\q

<u>Root and Rot</u> \qThe denizens of the Old Forest stir restlessly, unnerved by lately-appearing strange creatures. Aware of the danger this poses to Buckland, Marigold Boffin has brought you to the forest to further investigate.\q
A group of goblin raiders camp within the old ruins of Stramvárth for the night….
Within the old ruins of Stramvárth lie abandoned supplies from various Orcs and Goblins who have camped there….

<u>The Reeve of Entwash Vale</u> \qWe have arrived at Eaworth, capital of the Entwash Vale, bringing word of a vast Easterling horde invading from the north, but I fear that word has come too late, for Orcs are encamped upon Eaworth's threshold. I only hope that we can convince Reeve Ingbert of the greater threat facing the whole of Rohan....\q

<u>Unlocking History</u> \qActing on Amâsu's suggestion, you found another possible location for the Dubarâkh, the hidden library we have been seeking. Inside, you discovered a curious wall that you suspect may be a secret door. Amâsu insisted on seeing it for herself, but she need not go alone.\q

<u>The Defence of Galtrev</u> \qThe White Hand was driven out of Galtrev by the Free Peoples, but they return in great numbers with a hunger for revenge. The people of Galtrev must be defended against this evil, for their warriors have been taken from them.\q
The Barkhûshim took with them historical artifacts and scrolls when they fled Kûr Anzar. You are tasked with recovering these artifacts and defeating any Barkhûshim who move to stop you.
<u>Rescue in Nûrz Ghâshu</u> \qTaken by some madness, Golodir has ventured into the Rift. The air is thick with menace, and the stench of Thaurlach lingers....\q
<u>The Reclamation of Talath Anor</u> \qLearning of a group of Haradrim, unwilling to surrender, Elfhelm summons you to join him on a mission to rid Talath Anor of these fleeing foes.\q
At a ruin outside of the nearby village there is a terror growing among the turtles. The matron who watches over the clutch has grown increasingly aggressive and, sadly, must be put down.
<u>Head of the Fallen Beast</u> \qIn an attempt to cleanse the Pelennor Fields, I have asked for you and Éomer to destroy the corpse of the Witch-king's fell-beast.\q

<u>The Path of Aearil</u> \qYrjänä revealed the location of a cave where Aearil, the captain of the Elf-ship Thoroval, had long ago taken refuge. The Lossoth seer, Saija, guides the heroes from the South in search of Narchuil....\q

<u>The Grand Stair</u> \qIn elder days, this place once served as a grand portal to many levels and halls within Moria, but since the ruin of Moria, it has become a den of many Orc-tribes. Mazog, he who rules the Orcs of Moria, exacts his tribute here through his minion Igash....\q
<u>A Prisoner to Stangard</u> \qYou have taken the Uruk-hai vandal to Stangard, where Gadda has brought him before Stanric and Sithric to await his judgement.\q
<u>Sabotaging Kûr Anzar</u> \qAssist Razâl and Numûru on a mission into Kûr Anzar to weaken the Barkhûshim.\q

<u>The Dungeons of Naerband</u> \qThe tightening grip of Gondor has compelled Urudanî, the Maiden of Flame, to seek a stronger alliance with Thraknûl, chief torturer of Naerband. Together, they have reforged the prison of Direhold into a place of flame, iron, and anguish.\q
Within the courtyard of Caranost, an Orc warlord drives his forces into a frenzy. It is time to put his menace to an end.

<u>Ride Against the Goblins</u> \qBaldmund, leader of the refugees from Torsbury, convinced Reeve Fríthild that the first threat they should deal with are the Warg-riders in the east, which prevent the hunters of Stoke from provisioning the townsfolk for the coming siege....\q

<u>Instance: Awake At Long Last</u> \qYou have finally had some measure of success, for Oldheart seems quite awake for the first time in an age...but you are filled with trepidation, for some great power has woken with him. You feel it in your very bones.\q

<u>Neighbours Meet</u> \qIt has been many long years since the Men of Rohan established the keep of Stangard on the borders of Lórien, but the neighbouring Elves, suspicious of all, have never yet let themselves be seen by the Rohirrim.\q
The Ordâkhai have gained ground, capturing the floating bridge at Wrackwade. The Dumûri have asked for your help to overcome their defenders and regain possession of the river-crossing.
<u>The Darkest Hour</u> \qFew in Middle-earth can defy the Witch-king of Angmar, but in this darkest hour, I will stand against him.\q
<u>A Matter of Lineage</u> \qYour encounter with Gothmog fills me with a dread I cannot explain. I hope to learn why here in the Old Archives.\q
The workers at the quarry in Scary have broken into a hidden chamber containing a nest of spiders, and the creatures have now overrun the quarry, endangering the peaceful hobbit village.
Within the glittering caverns of Mesem-gairu lies a treasure trove of crystals, seemingly untouched….
Within the glittering caverns of Mesem-gairu lies a treasure trove of crystals, wanted by many….
A band of Ordâkhai have invaded Gha Nêkha and are harassing the locals. You are to go there and handle the situation.
A group of Corsairs based on the Cape of Umbar has been striking out into the Bay of Belfalas, harrying merchant ships. Take the fight to them!
<u>The Finder's Gathering</u> \qThe children's Gathering takes place in a back room of the Old Guest-house. Gifts, brought by all, are piled high on the table for all to enjoy.\q
<u>The Shadow In Morthond</u> \qA great beast flew out of the mountains, and now I fear a creature of much evil stalks the Blackroot Vale....\q
Within the Wildwood sits the village of Cotfast, a home to rogues and villains.
<u>Limlók Under Attack</u> \qI do not like that this raiding-party has not shown itself... no, I do not like it at all!\q

<u>Echoes of the Dead</u> \qWe have come to walk the Forsaken Road, where a group of Oathbreakers sought to escape their curse. Is it possible that Aragorn might compel them to fulfill their oath? We seek to learn if it is so.\q
<u>The Lord of Gundabad</u> \qI hear fighting just ahead! Let us press on!\q
<u>The War of the Three Peaks</u> \qForward! Forward! Gundabad will be ours!\q
<u>Into The Citadel</u> \qThat is enough rest for now. Pick up the water-bowl again and cross the bridge.\q

<u>An Echo of Days Past</u> \qWhile Frithgeir prepares the brew that will restore the sense of our host, an ancient dwarf who has lived long and seen much, our company decides what should next be done...\q

<u>The Deeping-coomb</u> \qSaruman's foul sorcery has destroyed the Deeping Wall and driven the Rohirrim into the Deeping-coomb. The retreat to the Glittering Caves and the Hornburg must be secured if there is to be any hope.\q
<u>Spectre of the Grey Fear</u> \qWe may already be too late. Let us hope we are not.\q
<u>In A Northern Dale</u> \qGood luck to you. The road will be a long one, and dangerous.\q
<u>Voyage of the Wave-hunter</u> \qAnd so the voyage of the Wave-hunter begins! Umbar awaits...\q
<u>Shield-brothers</u> \qElfmar is a good man and true, just like his father. We should help him prepare his men for battle as best we can.\q
<u>Homecoming</u> \qI have been too long away from home. But what welcome awaits me now?\q
<u>Raiders In Tûm Rost</u> \qThe people of Iáphel suffer at the hands of the Corsairs. The smell of burning grapes hangs on the air...\q
<u>Lair of the Beast</u> \qTwo ships are docked in this hidden harbour. Are their captains, my targets, to be found within?\q
<u>The Rescue</u> \qWe will rescue your friends, and we will have vengeance upon the Falcon Clan. You have my word.\q
<u>In the Presence of Saruman</u> \qThe Old Man wants you. You had better do what he says, if you know what's best for you. Ha! With the power of his voice you won't have a choice!\q
<u>The Wizard's Vale</u> \qI was the steward of Saruman's household, and ran his affairs from day to day. I was accorded high honour, and would still were it not for Gríma, the Wormtongue.\q
<u>Escape from Isengard</u> \qWe do this now or not at all, friend. There is no looking back. We will escape from Isengard or we will die. But we will not stay here.\q
<u>The Captive</u> \qThe emissary of Isengard captured by the Falcon Clan is near to death. Lheu Brenin hopes to get information from the captive before he passes.\q
<u>Pilgrimage to Sundergrót</u> \qLong ago, during the First Age, the Greymaul Rebellion came to an end among the rocky cliffs of High Sundergrót.\q
<u>Gondor and Umbar</u> \qI was told my life would be forfeit should I return here... but I feel this is something I must do.\q
<u>Last Wishes of the Lord of Langstrand</u> \qToday we are gathered to hear the last wishes of Golasgil, Lord of Anfalas, who fell in service of the kingdom.\q
<u>Painting the Picture</u> \qAllow my words to paint a picture for you, my friend: a picture from long ago.\q

<u>The Waiting Night</u> \qWe have prevailed upon the innkeeper to allow the residents of Herne to shelter within Crossway House for the night, for I fear that whatever evil came to this town will be back.\q
<u>Mists of Anduin</u> \qHas no one seen our new friend... or the Dunlending girl? I thought they would have returned to Stangard by now. Did some trouble befall them on the road?\q
<u>Who is our Ally?</u> \qSigénik lead you to a secluded area of Jirush and whishes to question your knowledge of who the elder aligned with the rebellion may be.\q
The gates of Gundabad are heavily fortified. Only by approaching with stealth will you remain unseen….
Deep in the Misty Mountains, the Orcs and goblins use a secret tunnel to move supplies between Goblin-town and Gundabad….
Dâr Brulku, a fort near Gundabad, holds the Orcs' main stockpile of weapons and armour….
Deep in the Grey Mountains, the hobgoblins launch a plot to free their mistress….
To end this war, Gorgar the Ruthless must be defeated. But first, he must be found….
Gorgar the Ruthless has been tracked to Goblin-town. Will you find and defeat him in time?
<u>Pit of the Falcon</u> \qMeanwhile, in the dungeons below Isengard, Lothrandir of the Dúnedain resists the torments of his captors.\q

<u>The Council of Stoke</u> \qAt the prompting of her advisors, Reeve Fríthild of the Broadacres has summoned together a war-council to determine how best to deal with the threat posed by the forces of the White Hand....\q
<u>A Promise Kept</u> \qRaphûz invited you to speak with him after you assisted him at Telperiën's Wall.\q

<u>The Bounty Hunter</u> \qBasil Gummidge hired adventurers from throughout Eriador to bring the ruffians and tomb-robbers of Evendim to justice, but now a notorious tomb-robber, Cuthbert Sprunt, has placed a bounty upon the arbiter's own hunters....\q

<u>The Leader of the Foul Wood</u> \qZagâfum, leader of the Wood-trolls of Glâd Ereg, has been discovered. The corruption that the Wood-trolls are inflicting upon the forest is unfathomable, and worse, unnatural. I cannot help but believe Saruman has his hand in the matter.\q
<u>The Pit-fighter -- Day One</u> \qThe arena of Thorzhaf is home to a pit-fighting tournament, where the greatest warriors battle for fame and power.\q
<u>The Pit-fighter -- Day Two</u> \qPit-fighters of Mordor have been known to rise to power through their efforts in the area of Thorzhaf.\q
<u>The Pit-fighter -- Day Three</u> \qThe arena of Thorzhaf, home of a pit-fighting bloodsport, runs under the direct orders from Thraknûl, the Black Uruk.\q

<u>Oakheart's Might</u> \qA mysterious note from the strange Sara Oakheart bade the heroes who saved her meet her at the gates of Barad Gúlaran, the ancient retreat of the Witch-king of Angmar. Seeking an answer to the mystery of the old woman, Golodir assents....\q

<u>The Northcotton Farm</u> \qSeveral hobbits have disappeared recently in the vicinity of the Northcotton Farm. It was abandoned years ago, but something stirs within its grounds and a faint, sweet aroma wafts over the walls....\q

<u>The Deeping Wall</u> \qThe dike has been overrun. Now, the full weight of Saruman's army prepares to crash down upon the valiant defenders upon the ramparts of the Deeping Wall. The wall must stand or the fortress will surely fall.\q

<u>The Broadacres Betrayed</u> \qThane Ordlac, revealed to be the traitor who orchestrated Reeve Fríthild's death, has claimed regency of the Broadacres and the Reeve's children. Young Thane Torferth of Torsbury prepares to ride against Stoke and take back the seat of the Reeve....\q
<u>The Pale Herald</u> \qListen well! You must hear of Rûkhor the Pale Herald, and how he led my people astray!\q
<u>Into the Circle of Sorrow</u> \qTo further the conquest of Minas Morgul, we must capture the Tower of Treegarth within the Circle of Sorrow.\q

<u>Sons of the Usurper</u> \qAfter learning of Azgarzôr's whereabouts in Lebennin, Erchar and Herion rally at your side to avenge Garvir as Jajax prepares to deal a devastating blow to the Heirs of Castamir before they can lead Umbar to ruin.\q

<u>The Hunter's Path</u> \qA terrible and vicious wolf called Yellowfang stalks through the Old Forest, often ambushing travellers upon the Great East Road. The accomplished huntress Gytha Lainey is resolved to ridding the Forest of this savage threat....\q

<u>Taking a Stand</u> \qThéodred's scouts are a brave lot, but I am uncertain that facing the combined might of the Ox-clan and the Dragon-clan is the wisest course of action. Perhaps with a hero's aid, they may indeed stave off the storm blowing south to Rohan....\q
<u>Warg-pens of Dol Guldur</u> \qThe Warg-pens of Dol Guldur are where the hounds of the Dark Lord are bred, trained, and kept. Here, goblin-keepers care for the matron of the pack….\q
<u>The Defence of Faldham</u> \qThane Elfmar has rallied the Elfward for the coming assault against Faldham, hoping to repel the assembled White Hand force.\q
<u>Urugarth</u> \qLying on the outskirts of Carn Dûm is the fortress of Urugarth, home to countless Orcs, goblins, and other curs of Angmar.... The breeding grounds of Angmar's horde.\q

<u>The Fires of Smaug</u> \qThe Dwarves of Erebor wish to send forth ravens with news of the Battle of Dale and to request aid, but the Easterlings have constructed a device of great evil to smoke the dwarves out of the Lonely Mountain....\q
The watch post of Bizar-atrâd, in the Grey Mountains, has been taken over by Frost-bound Hobgoblins….
The watch post of Bizar-atrâd, in the Grey Mountains, has been ambushed by a horde of dragon-kind….

<u>Shakalush, the Stair Battle</u> \qIt is on the stairs of Bagûd-mekhem, the Gate of Winds, that a decisive battle of the War of Three Peaks is to be fought. There, caught between those loyal to Gorgar the Ruthless and Hrímil Frost-heart, the Gabil'akkâ hope to deal a devastating blow to both of these forces in a single stroke.\q

<u>Nothing for Nothing</u> \qLhaereth the Stained has invaded the Circle of Madness seeking information. It has brought her to my doorstep, the Halls of Black Lore. She may perhaps gain what she seeks, but I have one rule that all who enter must observe: Nothing for nothing.\q

<u>A Timely Rescue</u> \qNow and again even the finest tracker may find that the tables have turned upon him and the hunter becomes the hunted. So it is with my kinsman Amarion, who finds himself in a precarious position, as shadow wolves stalk him in the gathering darkness.\q

<u>She Who Walks in the Darkness</u> \qHere agelong she has dwelt, an evil thing in spider-form. She who was here before Sauron, and before the first stone of Barad-dûr. Shelob the Great, last child of Ungoliant. Ungwetári. The time has come to face her once again.\q

<u>Garth Agarwen - Barrows</u> \qAt the height of their kingdom, the Men of Rhudaur enshrined their dead within great tombs of stone and built into the ground. At the crest of the tallest barrow, Ivar the Blood-hand, awaits any who would attempt to cleanse the corruption from the land and free the Red-maid from her service to the Darkness.\q
<u>Heirloom of the Ordinary</u> \qYour efforts to cleanse the evils from the corrupted necklace have returned you to a forsaken ship....\q
<u>Heirloom of the Riddermark</u> \qYour efforts to cleanse the evils from the corrupted heirloom have run afoul of an Orc raiding party....\q

<u>Revolt in the Deeps</u> \qThe Dunlendings and Rohirrim have agreed to put aside their differences and work together in an attempt to escape from their brutal Orc-overseers in the deadly mines hidden beneath the Heathfells.\q

<u>Behind Bars</u> \qNot long ago, my kinsman Dagoras was captured by deserters from the Dunlending force in Eregion. I've sent aid for his rescue, but their freedom shall be short-lived if they cannot escape before the alarm is raised.\q

<u>Schemes and Misadventures</u> \qWorking with Nimasi, you have traced the banner attacks to a large camp in southern Imhûlar. Investigate the camp without being seen to discover the source of these attacks.\q
A local farmer outside Urmâkh has asked for help rounding up his escaped chickens.

<u>Thaurisgar, the Vile Apothecary</u> \qIn the depths of Thaurisgar, countless foul and twisted experiments roam the shadows--the terrible legacy of Aniochán the Harrower. Before the fall of Carn Dûm, Aniochán worked tirelessly to outdo his rivals and win the favour of the Steward of Angmar. Chief among his tools in shaping his fell creations was a curious ichor known only as the Bile of Ifrinn. Thought to be lost after a disastrous experiment claimed Aniochán's life, now this foetid and vile substance is in danger of being let loose into the world. What did Aniochán hope to accomplish in Thaurisgar? Did he believe his end to be a failure or a true testament to his achievements?\q
<u>Sworn Oaths</u> \qGarmund has rejected my commands to remain guarding the city. He has taken his éored to reclaim land from the Orcs, keeping his oath to protect the whole of the Norcrofts.\q

<u>Barad Tironn</u> \qA clue found upon the body of one of the Angmarim reveals that the Elf Laerdan may still be held at Barad Tironn in Annúminas, where he was captured by Amarthiel's minions. It can only be hoped that he yet lives.\q

<u>Sant Lhoer, the Poison Gardens</u> \qKnown as the poison gardens of Carn Dûm, Sant Lhoer is a dank place teeming with deadly plants, trees, and flowers, the likes of which have scarcely or never before been seen in Middle-earth. Above the foetid, beryl-green waters which flow through Sant Lhoer rise immense, pellucid structures, greatest among them Bâr Heledh, the Glass House. It is here that the sorceress Oganuin plies her craft, experimenting upon creatures, plants, and all those who stray too near the ever-grasping tendrils of her creations. To what end, and for what purpose? One can only assume the darkest of designs....\q

<u>Glinghant</u> \qGlinghant, the gardens of Annúminas -- once a place of great beauty, now overgrown and fallen into ruin. The stagnant waters of the gardens have become corrupted by the fell spirits of Angmar, and evil Men do their bidding....\q
To the north-west of Maurûsh the spiders grow more foetid and strong. There is a call from the coalition at Ub Nishir to cull the matron at the head of the nest.

<u>Dark Delvings</u> \qIn the deepest delvings of Moria dwell nameless things which shun the light and feed on the darkness. The Elves of Lórien strive to constrain the vile creatures, but led by the evil Gurvand, they may be too strong to hold back forever....\q

<u>The Flickering Flame</u> \qSpurred by the call of the Dark Lord, the goblins of the Misty Mountains have sent an emissary to Minas Maur to treat with the Iron Crown. If these two forces unite, there may be no stopping Angmar from sweeping through Eriador...\q

<u>Isle of Storms</u>: A great winged terror known to the people of Umbar as a Roc has been seen attacking ships sailing off the Cape of Umbar, swamping them with terrible winds and plucking the hapless crew out of the water.
The lords of Umbar have requested that you find the nesting place of this monstrous bird and drive it from the Shield Isles.
The Roc is believed to be roosting upon a deserted isle in the far reaches of the archipelago, once a haunt for pirates and brigands. Rumours say that they were driven out by strange and monstrous creatures, far greater in size than any beast should be....

<u>On These Stones</u> \qAmid the disappearance of Fastred's son and the siege of Walstow, a terrible sorceror of Mordor, Crúmgam, leads a vast force of Orcs in a ploy to bring Snowbourn and the entirety of the Eastemnet to ruin.\q
<u>Heirloom of Rhudaur</u> \qYour efforts to cleanse the evils from the corrupted cup have led you to a temple most foul....\q
<u>Threat of a Good Punch</u> \qProve it was no mistake for Derwent Bindweed to seek the aid of a good Brawler, or I will teach you nothing....\q
<u>The Melee in the Square</u> \qDerwent Bindweed has moved from one dangerous town to one that might be even more dangerous! He needs a Brawler to help him, though he might not know it....\q

<u>The Legend of Folca</u> \qMeregyth, daughter of the Thane of Fenmarch, retells the story of King Folca the Hunter and the Boar of Everholt. This tale of bravery and vengeance may illuminate details of history that were lost.\q
<u>Hard Negotiations</u> \qIn the grim aftermath of the Wade-slaught, Thane Edric journeys to Edoras to confront Éowyn on matters of honour and duty.\q
Siege engines have been discovered in an Ekhamâti camp. Destroy them.
In the ruins of Sedgemead a new menace arises. Drive the Earth-kin from the ruins.

<u>Into Darkness Falls a Star</u> \qIn the Year 3434 of the Second Age, a great Alliance of Elves and Men assembled in defiance of the Dark Lord's will to conquer all the lands of Middle-earth. The High Elves, the blessed of Valinor who suffered the greatest wraths of Sauron and Morgoth the Enemy, now seek to ensure that his evil is forever banished from the world.\q
An injured band of enemies proves an easy target. Get them before they can regroup and regain their strength.
<u>The Story of a Strange Stone</u> \qThere is a story behind the stone fragment you uncovered in Dunfast...\q
<u>The Perfect Picnic</u> \qWhat a grand day for a picnic! Mayor Will Whitfoot has decided to join you for a delicious feast upon his favourite hill in all the Shire!\q
The Orcs and Wargs have returned to Shathur-munzu, attempting to set up a new base south of the warfront….
The Orcs and Wargs have returned to Shathur-munzu, attempting to set up a new base south of the warfront….

<u>Amarthiel's Hope</u> \qSuspecting that Amarthiel, the champion of Angmar, has come to Annúminas -- a suspicion supported by the warning of the Elf Laerdan -- the Rangers of the North prepare to infiltrate the ruined city and put an end to her evil plans....\q

<u>Instance: Iserngraf</u> \qThe Iserngraf is a source of much needed ore in Rohan. Mines this rich are sought by many and control of it is critical to the Rohirrim. Unfortunately, it has fallen under attack, and the miners have been driven out. Frithnoth has asked you to do what you can do discourage the invaders within.\q

<u>Corruption's Cost</u> \qThe Angmarim sorceress Brágha Fellwinder has discovered a way to enhance the power, ferocity, and madness of the deadly Warg. She must be stopped before she is able to pass on this knowledge or expand her capabilities.\q
Girhâzi has decided it is time to go on the offensive and has ordered an assault on the Ordâkhai camp of Khetsok.

<u>Helm's Dike</u> \qHelm's Dike forms the first barrier of defence for Rohan's final stand. The rearguard left here must buy time for the defenders to prepare the fortress and wall for the oncoming siege. Saruman's army marches, angry and ready for war.\q
Kergrim to the far north-west in Tûkurdul near Ashâgir ransacked a shipment from the west. They took the driver and the contents of his haul with them.

<u>Lost Temple</u> \qA band of mercenaries led by the Gaunt-lord Ferndúr have begun looting a hidden Rhudauran temple, left in ruin since the fall of the Northern Kingdoms. What purpose does this servant of darkness have within?\q
<u>The Moot</u> \qPip and I had escaped into Fangorn Forest, but we did not know if we would find safety under the eaves...\q

<u>A Hunter's Charge</u> \qAfter receiving word of a pack of Wargs making their way into the Shire, land of the hobbits, the huntress Gytha Lainey has recruited the best hunters to track and slay the evil Wargs before they can harm any of the Shire-folk....\q
<u>The Last Great Stronghold</u> \qThéoden's company parted from Gandalf upon the road and retreated to Helm's Deep. What news could have reached them that turned them from their path?'\q

<u>Seat of the Great Goblin</u> \qThe denizens of Goblin-town have remained long in disarray after the death of the Great Goblin and their defeat at the Lonely Mountain. Whispers have travelled throughout the Misty Mountains of a new Great Goblin, a leader whose return could spell doom for the Free Peoples of Middle-earth.\q

<u>Dun Shûma, The King's Fortress</u> \qThe hostile forces of Ekhamât have claimed Dun Shûma, the hidden fortress of Menûn Shûma III. The ancient ruin is said to hold many historical treasures of the kingdoms of Shagâna. Though Bârshud has retreated, his Umûni still stand opposed to Mizâdi's quest to claim the Crown of Hamât.\q

<u>The Flickering Flame</u> \qWith the downfall of Skorgrím, the Dourhands have become leaderless. In desperation, they have sent an emissary to Minas Angos to renew the alliance that their late lord forged with Angmar, an alliance which cannot be allowed to survive...\q

<u>The Tomb of Elendil</u> \qRespect, the one thing Gwindeth desired most, has earned passage into the tomb of Elendil, the resting place of the last Silithar. But with the lowering of the floods, robbers and thieves have taken the opportunity to plunder the tomb....\q
<u>A Night for Ghost Stories</u> \qYou simply must celebrate the spirit of the scary season with us!\q
<u>The Haunting of Wistmead</u> \qThese letters have gone undelivered for so long. Can it be they may hold the answers you seek?\q
<u>None But One</u> \qOh, I do not like this spooky forest, not one bit! Let's see about this spectre and get out of here as quick as we can!\q

<u>The Cooling Chamber</u> \qAbove the great forges of Khazad-dûm lies a chamber that was used to cool the rising steam and return it as water to the pools of Moria. What purpose could goblins have within the walls of that ancient chamber?\q
<u>Boss from the Vaults: Thrâng</u> \qDeep within the Rift of Nûrz Ghâshu, Thrâng, the chieftain of the Ghâshfra, is ready to take on all comers who challenge his might.\q
<u>Into the Circle of Wrath</u> \qTo gain a foothold in Minas Morgul, we must capture the tower of the Gate-wardens' Keep in the Circle of Wrath.\q
Svalfang the Hill Giant ventures into the Wildwood, seeking payment for those he has killed.
Orcs are getting orders from something beyond them. You are to hunt through their camp, eliminate the enemy and recover orders.
Upon the dwarf-ruins of Zarkul-sulûn, a deadly two-headed troll waits for those foolish enough to challenge their claim….
Upon the dwarf-ruins of Zarkul-sulûn, a band of trolls has claimed the Torrent-spires….
Upon the dwarf-ruins of Zarkul-sulûn, bats have descended onto the Torrent-spires in the darkness of the night….

<u>The Temple of Utug-bûr - Dhórgruth</u> \qUtug-bûr is home to long-hidden vaults delved deep into the stone, hidden by sorcery since the end of the First Age. The Thardúth, one of Morgoth's powerful agents, bred the great Elder Orcs known as the Utûgi. Its denizens have remained in a sorcerous slumber for millennia, but have now awakened, and their lair opened anew with the passing of the threat of Sauron.\q

<u>Of Axe & Fire</u> \qThe Uruks of Isengard have come to claim the last remaining trees of Nan Curunir - the grove of Quickbeam the Ent.\ \ Should these dark minions discover the presence of the Ents so close to Isengard, Saruman will bring his fires to bear upon Fangorn before his forces issue forth to face the Rohirrim.\q
Jackals in the furrows scavenge from the dead. It is their nature, but the defiling of fallen allies the coalition cannot abide.

<u>Bane of the Elvenking</u> \qAt last, Iphantemel has been revealed by the receding darkness of Eryn Lasgalen, and now the remnants of her brood grow thinner with each passing day. For her gluttony and weakness, they have abandoned her to her fate, but now I fear they heed the call of one even greater: Ungwetári!\q

<u>The Ancient Lair</u> \qFonn, one of the Hillmen of the Trév Gallorg, sent a scout to an ancient cave in Malenhad, the brimstone swamp, where many Gertheryg were observed gathering. The scout, Bethan, never returned, and Fonn fears he may have been taken by the trolls.\q

<u>Assembly Call</u> \qThe Avanc-lûth have been swayed by your influence in Dunbog and have called an Assembly. There, they will decide if they are to fight the threat of Isengard or remain secluded from the world.\q
<u>A Secret Meeting</u> \qSomething thought secret has been brought to light. Something thought dormant has awoken. The Longbeards may have need of a hero once more.\q
<u>Short of Stature, Great In Deed</u> \qI have been in this cage for what seems like days! Are my friends coming to rescue me or not? Should they even bother? They have probably left already.\q

<u>The Forgotten Treasury</u> \qMany ancient halls lie hidden beneath ages of ruin within the walls of Moria. The dwarves seek to recover and protect their treasures of old, while the Orcs seek to exploit them. Soon, the Forgotten Treasury may become a battleground of terrible proportions....\q
A band of foes approaches the town of Trestlebridge! The town must not fall to the invaders!
<u>Unravelling the Thread</u> \qStrider and the Rangers pursue their fallen brother Amdir to the Blackwolds' camp, but not all is as it seems....\q
<u>Imminent Collapse</u> \qOndor the Dwarf seeks to collapse the tunnels from which the Orcs waylay the innocent, avenging the death of his father and sealing the doom of his foes.\q
<u>The Foundry</u> \qI am almost impressed. You have stumbled upon the source of some most unusual weapons. I wonder if you will be able to uncover the real secret that lies within my foundry.\q

<u>Confronting Dravron</u> \qArmed with the knowledge that Dravron is cheating on his taxes, the Lord Dervorin moves to confront the lumber camp's leader. He does not expect things to turn to violence, but in case they do, he has bid you to join him.\q
<u>Hamât Renewed</u> \qMizâdi, Girhâzi, Rahâzi, Amalíbi, and Numûru have gathered outside Dun Shûma to discuss their victory and what fate awaits for Shagâna.\q
<u>Farewell to Pelargir</u> \qAfter freeing many citizens of Pelargir from the grasp of Corsair holdouts, it is now time for them to locate a safer refuge.\q
<u>War Comes to Rohan</u> \qLanghold is under attack by brigands, and worse yet -- their new Khundolar allies from the East.\q

<u>The Tourney Field: Mounted Combat Tutorial</u>
You have been granted a war-steed of prized Rohirrim stock. Now you must master your steed on the Tourney fields of Harwick, under the tutelage of the aged Rohirrim instructor, Seoca.\q

<u>A Crack in the Iron Crown</u> \qAs the Gabil'akkâ presses onward to Gundabad, word has spread that a mysterious enemy has arrived at Caivád Sâr, threatening to turn the tide of the War of Three Peaks.\q
Flags of the enemy fly over Caras Gelebren. The White Hand defiles the land once held sacred by the Elves. Tear down their banners.
Stone-claws and deep-claws have taken over the caverns of Ronglagam, as the great deep-claw Amshaz the Vast, slumbers within….
Precious resources lie deep within a cavern. Several piles of debris prevent miners from gathering this most needed resource….
<u>The Glittering Caves</u> \qThe folk sheltering in the caves will be defenceless if the battle goes against us. Protect them, my friend.\q
<u>The Deeping-coomb</u> \qThe fire of Orthanc has broken the wall! To arms, to arms! Defend the coomb!\q
<u>Instance: Lost in Fangorn</u> \qThe Ent Baillas wishes to impart a memory upon you, for something has piqued the interest of this sleepy, tree-ish creature.\q

<u>The Mirror-halls of Lumul-nar</u> \qTo bring life back to the gardens of Moria, the Iron Garrison has crafted great mirrors and placed them upon the pinnacle of Zirakzigil. The light has failed, however, and the dwarves seek to learn why their mirrors do not reflect it as they once did.\q
<u>Meet Harding</u> \qHarding is the Thane of Harwick, Reeve of the Wold, and Aldor of the Northmarch, and the time has come to meet him....\q

<u>Ost Dunhoth</u> \qFrom behind the walls of Ost Dunhoth, a terrible foe sends his malice out into Middle-earth. Gortheron, greatest of the Gaunt-lords, must be defeated before his plans can come to fruition….\q
<u>The Fords Have Fallen</u> \qFollowing the death of Théodred, the servants of the White Hand launch a second attack upon Elfhelm and Grimbold at the Fords of Isen....\q

<u>A Defence in the Darkness</u> \qIn the woods near Lin Giliath, a broken refuge of the Elves, Stone-trolls have gotten the better of a small host who marched to the defence of their haven. Their fate stands upon a precarious edge, but your arrival has brought them hope when their doom was nigh.\q

<u>A Spear at the Southern March</u> \qBrigands and half-orcs from the south have been pressing upon the Greenway as of late, threatening the good folk of Bree-town. You have been enlisted to join the line of Wardens who march against these foes, for brigands possess a chaotic nature, and will not stand against such organized defence.\q

<u>Will of the Stormhammer</u> \qDetermined to aid his son, Durin, and the Dwarves of the Gabil'akkâ to reclaim Mount Gundabad, King Thorin Stonehelm hopes to enlist an unexpected ally at the Lonely Mountain.\q

<u>Garth Agarwen - Arboretum</u> \qOnce a lush garden the Arboretum's caretaker, Grimbark, was driven mad when the Red-maid fell to corruption. Now, Grimbark forces all vestige of uncorrupted life from the Arboretum making it a welcome home for The Dead.\q

<u>The Fall of Khazad-dûm</u> \qIn the year 1981 of the Third Age, the Longbeards made their final stand against the Balrog known as 'Durin's Bane'. The brave dwarves that defied the terror on that day would be the saviors of their people, but the fate of their kingdom was certain.\q
A lovely day for pitching in on the farm without the fear of anything untoward happening at all.

<u>The Lord of Iron</u> \qPower is a heavy burden. I, Náin the Slakeless, son of Dáin Ironfoot, Lord of the Iron Hills, feel the crushing weight of the decisions I must make, and the lives that hang in the balance. There is much to consider. Now, who is this that comes before me?\q
Deep in the bounds of the Old Forest, a nest of venomous spiders lurks in wait for a morsel of Man, Elf, hobbit, dwarf, and more.
<u>The Battle for Hytbold</u> \qThe Enemy is marching upon Hytbold, intent upon defeating the Lords of the Eastemnet and claiming eastern Rohan as their own.\q

<u>Legacy of Strife</u> \qAs the Heirs of Castamir expand their influence in Lebennin, the people of Ost Anglebed find their loyalties called in question as the old wounds of the Kin-strife are rent anew.\q

<u>The Grand Stair</u> \qIn elder days, this place once served as a grand portal to many levels and halls within Moria, but since the ruin of Moria, it has become a den of many Orc-tribes. Mazog, he who rules the Orcs of Moria, exacts his tribute here through his minion Igash....\q
Prince Ingór has declared a Zhélruka Clan feast to commemorate their new Mountain-home….

<u>The Battle for Erebor</u> \qThe Easterlings in the North are dismayed by the news of defeats in the South, and the time has come to break the siege of Erebor. However, Sauron's champions await you at the gateway to the Lonely Mountain....\q
A massive encampment of brigands threatens the region, and there is a growing fear that the organized forces are soon to attack. You are directed to find any plans that might be in the encampment.
There is a thought that if the leaders of the Southron Men are eliminated then the rest will fall into disarray. Make your way to the encampment.

Watch-towers in the brigand encampment provide them a greater visibility over the approaching land. A large force cannot approach, but a small number can, and you have been drafted to remove their threat.

<u>A Final Reckoning</u> \qAnd so the Battle of Azanulbizar was ended. Although Azog and some ten thousand of his kin lay dead, the battle had exacted a heavy toll on the Dwarves of the Haban'akkâ. Yet, in the mind of King Thráin, the Sixth War of the Dwarves and Orcs was not yet finished.\q

<u>Filikul</u> \qHasta went forth to discover the meaning of the strange happenings which occurred but weeks before. He has not returned, and his companions are becoming worried that something may have happened to him….\q
Within Gundabad lie the ancient tombs of Atkât-darag. There, many wonders are kept, and many bones of great dwarves rest….
Evidence of previous dwarves lie in a buried tomb, waiting to be uncovered….
A group of day travellers has disappeared near Zahûmakh and haven't been seen in several days. Explore Zahûmakh and look for signs of the travellers.
<u>The Daring Strike, Mid-day</u> \qThéodred came to the gates of Isengard by mid-day, and the uruks arrayed before him readied for his assault. We lined up, ready to charge!\q
<u>An Audience with the Hall-father</u> \qKhôltekh has taken you into his trust, for now. He's asked you to accompany him to his house to speak more about his plans for Umbar.\q

<u>An Unexpected Summons</u> \qAs days pass with no sign of the cold-drake, Vethúg Wintermind, King Thorin III Stonehelm has grown impatient and seeks to learn the truth of these matters. Unknown to the King under the Mountain, an unexpected return may prove a boon to Durin's Folk.\q

A particularly brutal Orc captain has made the old tower of Tharbad his base of operations. You have been asked to clear the courtyard approaching the tower of defenders to open the way for an attack on the tower itself.

<u>The Funeral in Forlaw</u> \qThe people of Forlaw gather to mourn those lost in the battle of Scylfig. Most notably, their champion, Thrymm Red-beard... and with him they bury any hope of surviving this war.\q

<u>The Ruined City</u> \qThrough ruined Osgiliath, you pursue a mysterious figure arrayed in Faramir's tattered cloak. When at last you catch up, will you find Faramir beneath the hood? Will you know the face for friend or foe? You must hope, at least, that you will learn something of Faramir's final fate.\q
