<u>The Battle Under the Tress</u> \qMy own kingdom was not the first attacked. First came Lothlorien. Three times the Golden Wood was tested by Dol-Guldur, I have learned, the first falling some days before the battle at high-walled Minas Tirith in Gondor.\q
<u>A Faltering Reflection</u> \qYou are here. I am so glad. Come stand by my Mirror once more. We shall see what we shall see in it, you and I.\q

<u>The Return</u> \qWe have followed Glorfindel's trail to, of all places the Rift of Nûrz Ghâshu. We must hope he has found the prophecy of Gil-galad there that he sought, and that all else lies as still and undisturbed as we left it.\q
<u>The Bow is Drawn</u> \qWith nothing else to stall it, the deliberations of the Elves' Council of War may begin. Take the place you have truly earned among them.\q

<u>The Watcher in the Water</u> \qDire is the creature called the Watcher in the Water by the dwarves, an ancient evil called forth by the Dark Lord. Perhaps through the power of legend, a way can be seen past the terror...?\q

<u>Fire and Ice</u> \qElrond Halfelven fears that the remaining Nazgûl has enlisted the aid of the Gaunt-lord Drugoth to instill a fell spirit into the frozen corpse of the ancient Dragon Thorog and raise the beast once more as a wight. Little time remains to stop their evil plans.\q

<u>An Eye in the Storm</u> \qThe view from Weathertop is wide, and many have climbed that great hill to see all that could be seen. You have been brought hither to learn of the subtle influences connecting runes with nature, for words and speech-craft hold much sway over many powers in Middle-earth.\q

<u>The Word of a Healer</u> \qThe Dourhands have long scouted the lands near the dwarf-keep Othrikar, and they now move to attack the outpost of our friends. The good sentries of Othrikar are stout warriors, but they will be outnumbered, and their victory over the Dourhand menace is far from being assured by the odds as they stand.\q

<u>Facing Fears</u> \qIngmar, my husband, seeks to persuade his father to allow him to lead a force of men against the Orcs who now threaten us, despite Théoden King's ban. I hope his grandmother, Lady Góda, may bring wisdom to the debate....\q

Uruk embattlements set into the side of the hills threaten the land below. But it is the leaders in these forces that wield the true power. You are tasked with finding and eliminating the leaders of the Uruks at this encampment.
Upon the ruins of Shakal-atrâd, in Elderslade, an Angmarim ritual has taken place, defiling the old watch-tower….
Within the ruins of Shakal-atrâd, in Elderslade, an Angmarim ritual has taken place, defiling the depths of the old watch-tower….
Treasures have been stolen from the dwarves! It is suspected that the treasures were brought to Shakal-atrâd, in Elderslade, and hidden in the depths of the old watch-tower….
Crebain have been stealing helms and hats from the good citizens of Urmâkh. A local scout has tracked them to Ghât Okho. You are to recover the headwear from these brazen winged thieves.
<u>Mark of the White Hand</u> \qLead on, Flam. Where does your friend hold captive this Uruk?\q
Behold! The vault of Agbash-khalt, sealed and hidden to all those who have occupied Gundabad, has now finally revealed itself to the Zhélruka Dwarves….
Behold! The vault of Agbash-khalt, sealed and hidden to all those who have occupied Gundabad, has now finally revealed itself to the Zhélruka Dwarves….
Behold! The vault of Agbash-khalt, sealed and hidden to all those who have occupied Gundabad, has now finally revealed itself to the Zhélruka Dwarves….
Ekhamâti soldiers are holding prisoners here. Free them and defeat the executioner before they can harm any more people!

<u>The Exchange</u> \qTensions run high among the remaining Elves of the Hidden Guard: one of their number slain, the other dying from a deadly poison. And now the dwarf Bróin has disappeared on the eve of the journey's end…\q
<u>Dungeons of Dol Guldur</u> \qA small force of Elves has infiltrated the dungeons of Dol Guldur under cover of darkness, aiming to find and release the dwarf Bori from the bonds of his captivity.\q

<u>Memories of Mithrandir</u> \qDimly-remembered stories from his childhood, oft-repeated in the darkness of his cell, have struck the spark of memory in Bori the dwarf. He is certain the passage you discovered is the same used by Mithrandir long ago to enter Dol Guldur in secret.\q
The Dumûri have learned the Ordâkhai in Eshadûr have restocked their supply of black powder. Your mission is to destroy it before it can be put to use.

<u>Dâr Narbugud</u> \qThe Elves of Lórien have uncovered Dâr Narbugud, the lair of the Mistress of Pestilence, the vile creature responsible for the plague spreading among the creatures of Moria. What heroes will overthrow the queen of the nameless? Who will put an end to her plague?\q
<u>Death From Below</u> \qBeneath the captured tower of Thangúlhad, the earth stirs as a band of goblins strives to undermine the Malledhrim outpost.\q

<u>Jailbreak</u> \qA chance encounter with brigands upon the road leads to captivity. You awaken with the Ranger, Strider, before you. As he urges you to act quickly, you realize that you have become involved in matters much greater than yourself....\q
<u>The Prince of Rohan, Night</u> \qNight fell on the twenty-fifth of February, as my prince prepared for one last journey, a journey to lands we know not.\q
<u>Heirloom of the High King</u> \qYour efforts to cleanse the evils from the corrupted badge have led you to the Bridge of Ariant, high above Lake Evendim, in the City of Kings....\q

<u>The Brenin's Council</u> \qThe Brenin's Council of Lhanuch gathers even now, to decide whether to join their bretheren to the south in allegiance to Isengard. But they are a proud isolated people who will not bend easily, even when threatened with the power of the traitor Saruman.\q
After reclaiming Gabilazan from the Dourhands and their foul allies, the Dwarves of Durin's Folk must now contend with the other inhabitants of the Misty Mountains.
<u>Bregmor's Legacy</u> \qFotri, a Dwarf in Forochel, has seen The Weeping Warrior and seeks to examine the corpse of dead Dragon, Bregmor.\q
<u>The Hideout</u> \qThe hunt for Amdir leads to the hideout of the brigand Skunkwood, but to what end is unknown....\q

<u>Askâd-mazal, the Chamber of Shadows</u> \qLong ago, Durin the Deathless sealed away an evil being known as the Shadowed King. Driven by intense jealousy, he wears the face of the Father of the Longbeards and builds a kingdom deep beneath the earth; a twisted reflection of the dwarf hall above, a mockery of the grandness of Khazad-dûm. He must be defeated, or his demented visions may become reality.\q
<u>Stanric's Stand</u> \qStanric, the leader of Stangard, grows inspired by the changes you have brought about for this crippled settlement.\q
The safety of the small outpost of Hrimbarg in the Misty Mountains is under threat from the winged beasts of the Frost-horde….

<u>The Hand of Angmar</u> \qYrjänä, the chieftain of Sûri-kylä, desires to aid the Free Peoples of the South in their hunt for Narchuil, the ring of Amarthiel, but he fears the threats of Mordrambor....\q

<u>The Harrowing of Morgul</u> \qIn an attempt to repel the forces of Ugrukhôr and the Rangers of Ithilien, Gothmog's forces have fortified the outermost ring of Minas Morgul. Believing the ire between Ugrukhôr and Gothmog might be turned to your advantage, Damrod has tasked you with igniting a war between the Orcs in Minas Morgul.\q
Thieving Corsairs are stealing artifacts from the Ambarûli side of Telperiën's Wall. You have been asked to put a stop to this by any means necessary.
Haudh Nírui has been overrun by grave-robbing goblins. If we defeat their leader we may be able to scare them off for now.

<u>The Ties That Bind</u> \qKaj, the chieftain's son, is in love with Pinja, a young woman with a heritage drawing from many tribes. Unable to show her his true feelings, he invokes an ancient ritual, long forgotten, in an attempt to win a bride from a rival tribe....\q

<u>Skorgrím's Tomb</u> \qIt would seem that Gormr and the Dourhands have allied themselves with evil fell spirits of Old, just as Skorgrím himself did long ago. Now Ivar the Bloodhand, a Gaunt-lord, threatens to sway the Dourhands to evil with the terrifying ritual about to take place in Skorgrím's Tomb....\q
<u>Speak the Words</u> \qThe Emissary awaits. It is time to speak the words.\q

<u>Dúnedain Past and Present</u> \qLothrandir, a Ranger of the North, has joined thee in thy quest to find a lost Arnorian treasure in Forochel. Thy only hope of finding it may lie with the shade of Arvedui, last King of Arthedain.\q
<u>The Power of Oaths</u> \qWith the key of Agoroth in hand, the time has come to find the door to the hidden fortress, deep within the caves of ice.\q

<u>Ending the Nightmare</u> \qThe Mokúrz-hai have become a plague to the people of the Dunbog. Blaire of the Boar-clan has asked you to accompany him into Lhan Colvarn to end this threat once and for all.\q
<u>The Blooms of Anarlossë</u> \qListen to me now, and I will tell you of days long ago, when my brother and I walked among the flowers of yesteryear in the lands of Men....\q
Within the old halls of Kallamdâm, in Gundabad, cold-drakes of the Frost-horde erect a fortress of ice….
Rumors of permafrost within a frigid dwarven catacomb begin to circulate….

<u>Instance: The Pain of Regret</u> \qLéofmar carries a deep guilt with him since his arrival in Fangorn, one that has led him to believe that he is cursed. He is ready to reveal to you the story behind his regret.\q
<u>The Point of Decision</u> \qWe always knew that the Company of the Ring would face the difficult decision of what road to take. We simply did not know how soon....\q
<u>Keeper of the Dead</u> \qDolenthol, a Ranger of Ithilien, leads a small group of brave warriors to track down the mysterious Thargaun, who rules over the dead within the Circle of Sorrow.\q
There are reports of a great treasure buried on an island deep within the Shield Isles. You've been tasked with retrieving the treasure to help the restoration of Umbar.

<u>Thikil-gundu</u> \qAfter the great cold-drake, Vethúg Wintermind, was defeated at Erebor, it was believed that Thikil-gundu would at last be reclaimed. Unbeknownst to the Longbeards and Zhélruka, Karazgar, the Weeping Warrior, has claimed the Steel Keep and subjugated the wills of the Orcs and dragon-kind dwelling within its frozen halls. What has become of Nori's expedition in that ancient dwarf keep?\q
Lalia, a frightened hobbit girl, has gotten lost in the Barrow-downs while searching for 'The Last Prince' of legend.

<u>Amdân Dammul, the Bloody Threshold</u> \qThe final battle of the War of Three Peaks has begun. Prince Durin Stonehelmson of the Longbeards leads the Gabil'akkâ, a great host of united dwarves, to the very gates of Mount Gundabad. But Gorgar the Ruthless, son of Bolg, has one last surprise in store for those who would seek to usurp him....\q

<u>The Great Goblin in Exile</u> \qA horde of goblins has departed Goblin-town, and wrought chaos in its path. We have followed, and come to their new hiding place. Now we have them cornered. It is time we found out what is going on here!\q

<u>Revenge of the Great Goblin</u> \qThe Great Goblin's forces are approaching and the Warlord's host lies in wait. Battle will soon erupt. All we can do now is watch and hope they fall upon each other's spears.\q
<u>A Life Hangs on a Thread</u> \qThe Corsairs camped in Lamedon have wounded Fuirion badly, and his life hangs on a thread while they look on in mirth.\q

<u>Ashunûg, the Fane of the Accursed</u> \qWe have discovered a dangerous cult of Usan-kûni worshippers hiding in our own back-yard. They call themselves Anâkhi, and have made their home inside Ashunûg, a salt mine in northern Ambarûl that has long been abandoned. We are only recently freed of Sauron, the All-Seeing, and must not allow this new cult to take hold. The Anâkhi scorpion worshippers must be driven from our lands.\q
<u>Battle for Hamât, Part 2</u> \qMizâdi has tracked Bârshud to the fortress of Dun Shûma in Khûd Zagin. The time has come to meet Bârshud in pitched battle and defeat him for good.\q
<u>Battle for Hamât, Part 3</u> \qPush into Dun Shûma and end the threat of Bârshud!\q
Deep in the Wyrmsgráf, a terrible fire drake protects the nests of the worms….
Deep in the Wyrmsgráf, what remains of Scatha's brood makes their den....
Deep in the Wyrmsgráf, what remains of Scatha's brood makes their den....
<u>Hildith's Council</u> \qHildith, the headstrong wife of Grimbold, now leads Grimslade in her husband's absence.\q

<u>Ost Dunhoth</u> \qFrom behind the walls of Ost Dunhoth, a terrible foe sends his malice out into Middle-earth. Gortheron, greatest of the Gaunt-lords, must be defeated before his plans can come to fruition….\q
You've been asked to trim back the branches of a group of huorns pillaging along the roads of the Cape of Umbar.
Nestled in the foothills of the Misty Mountains, the dwarf-keep of Kidzul-kâlah lies half-sunken in the Gladdenmere. However, the Redhorn Pass lies open to friends and foes alike….
Nestled in the foothills of the Misty Mountains, the dwarf-keep of Kidzul-kâlah lies half-sunken in the Gladdenmere. Meanwhile, a pack of worms has encroached on the old dwarf-keep….

Nestled in the foothills of the Misty Mountains, the dwarf-keep of Kidzul-kâlah lies half-sunken in the Gladdenmere. With the eyes of the dwarves elsewhere, the Dourhands have come to steal priceless relics long ago left behind....

Nestled in the foothills of the Misty Mountains, the dwarf-keep of Kidzul-kâlah lies half-sunken in the Gladdenmere. Deep in its newly-drained depths, the Dourhands seek to mine the veins of the Goldencleft....

<u>Messages from Lórien</u> \qMessages have come from Lothlórien, messages that cannot be ignored. My sons have returned from the Wild, and together they and a hero of Eriador must respond to these tidings with decisive action...\q
<u>The Doorward</u> \qWe have victory this day, but it was not assured. Were it not for the deeds of Háma, doorward of Théoden, all might have been lost....\q

<u>Eaworth Under Siege</u> \qOur message comes to the Entwash Vale at an inopportune time, for Orcs have already besieged the city of Eaworth. The Riders Four must now join with Reeve Ingbert and his allies to break the siege....\q

<u>Ruins of the Ancestors</u> \qMaster Architect Gori Stonesetter waits for you under the ancient arches on the bank of the River Kibil-nâla. He is determined to examine the ruins, built by an ancestor of his, no matter the danger of crumbling bridges or lurking enemies.\q
<u>The Council of Herubrand</u> \qHerubrand meets with his advisors to discuss the actions that they should take in response to the assault upon the Mead Hall of Woodhurst.\q
<u>Liberating Woodhurst</u> \qSensing that Woodhurst suffers from a lack of leadership, powerful men seek to guide the city in a direction that favours them.\q
<u>Invitation for a Drink</u> \qArnwi invited Calin for a drink at the nearby inn. Herubrand is suspicious and requested you accompany Calin....\q

<u>Woodhurst Has Fallen</u> \qA dark power waited in the shadows of Woodhurst for the moment to strike and watched while the city's champions squabbled among themselves. Now residing on the seat as Woodhurst's conqueror, the champions may be too weak to purge its growing influence....\q
<u>Voice on the Wind</u> \qRaphûz intends on finding Ashâmi, fearing she headed to her death because of his actions.\q
<u>Khâshap's Assembly</u> \qDNT.\q
<u>The Orcs Attack</u> \qWynmar and his men brace for an Orc attack that threatens to be more dire than the earlier encounter on the hill, a mere taste of what is to come....\q
Acquire healthy boar slabs for a chef to make into his famous bacon recipe for the hungry people of Urmâkh.
<u>A Glimpse of Daylight</u> \qA small moment of peace has given Mizâdi time to speak with Amalíbi, to see the consequences of her decisions.\q

<u>Sworn to Secrecy</u> \qSent by Aragorn himself, Lord Angbor the Fearless has come to Tumladen bearing news of the victory at Pelargir for Lady Terenis as well as tidings that might assuage her fears of her brother's fate.\q

<u>The Glittering Caves</u> \qThe Glittering Caves of Aglarond are where the women, children, and supplies have been hidden. With the loss of the Wall and the Deeping-comb, Gimli, Gamling, and Eómer now rally any they can find to hold the line and protect all huddled within.\q

<u>Draigoch's Lair</u> \qWelcome, thieves. I can smell the dread in your sweat. I hear the whistle of fear in your breath and feel the fluttering of your little hearts as they race in your chests. But come now, why do you fear? There is plenty of treasure here... enough for all, and more to spare.\q

<u>The Rift of Nûrz Ghâshu</u> \qWithin the Rift of Nûrz Ghâshu, Angmar mines for the ore they need to arm their legions. In their search for iron, they have uncovered the home of the Eldgang, as well as a hidden evil, ancient beyond knowledge....\q
<u>Righting the Wrongs of Trum Dreng</u> \qInfuriated by the attacks orchestrated by the Dragon Clan and seemingly the armies of Isengard as well, Guto plans to take matters into his own hands....\q
<u>The Witan</u> \qSkeptical of the King's state of mind, the Lords of the Eastemnet have gathered to decide how to defend their lands.\q

<u>Mordirith's Fall</u> \qHeartened by the gift of Dúnachar from Elrond of Rivendell, Golodir prepares to assail Carn Dûm and drive the sword into the unseen heart of Mordirith, the murderous Steward of Angmar. Courage may bring hope, but a thirst for vengeance could spell doom....\q
Take what gold ypu can find to supply Mizâdi's forces and defeat the powerful foes in the Ekhamâti camp.

<u>The Vile Maw</u> \qWhither did the Watcher in the Water flee when it was driven from its lake? The Vile Maw would be my guess. Beneath the waters of the dark flood are ways which lead into the black depths of Moria....\q

<u>Mordrambor</u> \qThe time has come. Angered by Mordrambor's treacherous betrayal of Laerdan, the Ranger Calenglad is determined to confront the Black Númenórean and learn where Narchuil, the ring of Amarthiel, resides. . . .\q

<u>The Forges of Khazad-dûm</u> \qAt the height of Durin's reign, the Forges of Khazad-dûm were once famed for producing great crafts of beauty and majesty. Now they have fallen into misuse by the Orcs which now infest the ancient halls of Moria, spewing forth their terrible tools of war....\q
<u>Rise and Fall</u> \qWith the source of the unrest uncovered, Lhucu prepares to enter Lhan Gogledh and confront her father, Trehéarn. A task she dare not attempt alone.\q

<u>Garth Agarwen - Arboretum</u> \qOnce a lush garden the Arboretum's caretaker, Grimbark, was driven mad when the Red-maid fell to corruption. Now, Grimbark forces all vestige of uncorrupted life from the Arboretum making it a welcome home for The Dead.\q

<u>Battle of Dol Baran</u> \qThe Dunlending armies unleashed an attack on the Rohirrim holding Dol Baran hoping to dislodge them from the high ground. But the horselords are prepared to defend their position with their lives.\q

<u>Sharkey's Night</u> \qToo late I realized the treachery of Saruman. Far afield of Rhosgobel and the path of my errand, the reach of the White Hand spread to the Gladden Fields. There his servants sought the Ring he would not claim, and there they remain, forgotten in purpose... searching for naught.\q

<u>Instance: Imping</u> \qImping, one of the last Rohirrim sawmills along the Entwash, has fallen to invaders. Ethelbryt has tasked you with defeating the leader of these invaders in the hopes that such a demoralizing blow would weaken the enemy and allow the Rohirrim to retake the mill.\q

<u>Hammer of the Underworld</u> \qThe defenders of Gondor struggle to hold the line as Grond, the great ram of the Enemy, crawls towards the gates of Minas Tirith. Grond must be destroyed before it can serve its vile purpose!\q
There are reports of ships disappearing in several of the northern Shield Isles of Jeb Khâtel. Investigate the islands and figure out what is happening to these ships and their crews.
<u>Isolation Amongst the Survivors</u> \qBefore you move on from the Steaping Cave, you would like to see the other women be more kind to Ránmald, who is in a fragile state.\q

<u>Wealth of the Dead</u> \qRaphûz is set on acquiring enough wealth to prove his value to Ashâmi's father, Igbâl. You agreed to accompany him through the outer ruins of Nirgambâr to search for a worthy treasure from the dead.\q
<u>A Candle Flickers in the Dark</u> \qKhôltekh has asked you to help him find and catch Sêkhta. He believes Sêkhta is an Archivist, a historical scholar working and living in the Tor-gardens.\q

<u>Remembering Thrymm</u> \qThrymm Red-beard, the champion of Forlaw, proudly carries the hope of the people of Wildermore. He was one of the few to heed the call to defend an incoming attack on an early morning in Forlaw...\q

<u>Halls of Crafting</u> \qThere were no greater craftsmen than the Dwarves of Khazad-dûm. Those days are now gone, and Mazog's Orcs, with the aid of Black Uruks from Dol Guldur, have taken the ancient crafting halls of Moria to forge their vile weapons of war.\q
Far from Angmar, the last stronghold of the Iron Crown keeps watch over Elderslade for the forces of Gundabad….
Far from Angmar, the last stronghold of the Iron Crown keeps watch over Elderslade for the forces of Gundabad….
Far from Angmar, the last stronghold of the Iron Crown keeps watch over Elderslade for the forces of Gundabad….

<u>Emissary of the White-hand</u> \qIn the South, Saruman builds his strength at Isengard. Despite past conflicts with Angmar, he has sent an emissary to Minas Caul to forge an alliance between the White Hand and the Iron Crown...\q
Rising into the Grey Mountains above the Greylin, Grálinvarth overlooks Elderslade and might prove a valuable foothold in the War of Three Peaks.

Rising into the Grey Mountains above the Greylin, Grálinvarth overlooks Elderslade. However, a recent ambush by dragon-kind of the Frost-horde threatens the dwarves keeping watch from this valuable foothold.

Rising into the Grey Mountains above the Greylin, Grálinvarth overlooks Elderslade. After a bloody battle, Gorgar's forces have overrun the foothold and gained a significant foothold deep within the territory of the dwarves.

<u>Goblin-town Throne Room</u> \qIn the darkest depths of Goblin-town, at the heart of the goblin kingdom, teeming with the vile breed, lay the throne room of the Great Goblin. Long have the inhabitants of Goblin-town been leaderless, but as the Shadow in the East grows, calling its minions to arms, a new leader has taken the mantle of the Great Goblin....\q

<u>The Water Wheels: Nalâ-dûm</u> \qDeep in the abysses of Moria, the dwarves had once crafted a great waterway to bring water in from the mountains. Something now blocks the great wheels from turning, causing the Iron Garrison concern.\q

You have been tasked with protecting the Khâlbina from threats on her route to Halrax in the Shield Isles. You were below deck for a moment when you hear shouting from above. You've been boarded by Corsairs!
Protect the Khâlbina and her crew from dangers while sailing to Jax Phanâl on the Cape of Umbar.
<u>Greet the Sun</u> \qYou have reached the East Gate of Moria at last, after a long and strenuous journey through the dark.\q
<u>Fire Beneath the Shadow</u> \qTo protect the Host of the West, I have taken it upon myself to lead Aragorn and his trusted friend into the Morgul Vale.\q
<u>Heirloom of the Wild Men</u> \qYour efforts to cleanse the evils from the corrupted figurine have led you to a remote cave....\q

<u>Garth Agarwen</u> \qGarth Agarwen… the ruins of an ancient fortress of Rhudaur, now overrun by corrupted nature and a vile necromantic power out of Angmar. The most terrible power still remains to be confronted.\q

<u>The Sickle, the Lotus, and the Lion</u> \qYou have brought the leaders of Ambarûl, Khûd Zagin, and Imhûlar together in Iridír. Mizâdi has much to do before Girhâzi and Amalíbi trust her or her leadership.\q

<u>Throne of the Dread Terror</u> \qThe Enemy's grip tightens on the defenders of Gondor as Gothmog seizes control of the armies of Mordor. Marching from the gates of Osgiliath, foes pour into the Pelennor Fields with a renewed vigour. In the wake of the Witch-king's defeat, vile sorcery looms over the field as the most powerful allies of the Dread Terror are summoned forth. If Gothmog spoke true of the fate he shares with Golodir, can victory yet be found?\q
Within Shalakâm, the ancient waterways of Gundabad, the ukhrâsh have roamed unchecked. Their years of clawing and digging threaten to collapse the ancient tunnels….
Within Shalakâm, the ancient waterways of Gundabad, many old gates direct the flow of water….

<u>Rescue by Moonlight</u> \qAvorthal had been moved from the Dourhand encampment to a ship preparing to depart for an unknown port in the North. His rescue is paramount to maintaining peace in Ered Luin....\q
Amongst the barrows in the depths Gundabad, the spirits of our forefathers are being disturbed….
<u>Thrymm's Farm</u> \qThrymm's Farm is on the verge of recovery, but their efforts may be for nothing should the Warg-riders return.\q
TBD…

A ship carrying weapons and supplies has broken up and the cargo is washing ashore in the Shield Isles. You have been asked to collect the salvageable supplies to keep them out of the hands of the Heirs of Castamir.
The entrances to the mines of Writhenset have been seized by half-orc intruders!

<u>Agoroth, the Narrowdelve</u> \qDeep in the frozen wilds of Forochel, the Arnorian fortress Agoroth lies hidden. Although no living souls have set foot there for thousands of years, thou now findst thyself in a race to reach its vault before the forces of Angmar.\q

<u>The Daughter of Strife</u> \qAges ago, in the fastness of Eregion, the Dark Lord came in fair guise. Some among the Elves called him Antheron Gift-lord, for he taught them to craft the Rings of Power. In those days, he beguiled Narmeleth daughter of Laerdan and broke her mind....\q

<u>A Final Council</u> \qGlorfindel, mightiest of Elf-lords, tests the heart of Narmeleth, seeking to learn if the spirit of Amarthiel has truly passed from her. If Narmeleth has indeed returned, her knowledge of Angmar may aid the Free Peoples in overthrowing the False King....\q

<u>The Hiddenhoard of Abnankâra</u> \qBeyond the falls of Amgaruslun in the Clovengap lies Abnankâra, the Hiddenhoard. Once an ancient treasury wrought in secret by Mótsog and the Greymauls during their rebellion against the Longbeards in the Elder Days, it has become the lair of Hrímil Frost-heart, a dreaded cold-dragon of Morgoth. Within this frozen retreat, Hrímil tends her wounds and slumbers, dreaming of vengeance upon Prince Durin and the dwarves of the Gabil'akkâ.\q

<u>The Prisoner of Sammath Baul</u> \qIn Sammath Baul, the Elf-lord Laerdan was tormented, both in body and mind. Even Elves can only endure for so long, though Laerdan resisted to the last. When pain alone proved ineffective, Amarthiel turned to deception....\q

<u>The Fate of Laerdan</u> \qLaerdan's delusion is complete. Once Narchuil is restored, he will give it to Amarthiel, hoping to bring back his daughter. In folly, he will doom Eriador to fall beneath the Shadows of Angmar....\q
<u>A Daring Rescue</u> \qSithric, emissary of Théoden, rules in Stanric's place amongst rumours of foul play, and Stangard lies in disarray.\q

<u>Tûl Zakana, the Well of Forgetting</u> \qDeep in the war-torn lands of Imhûlar, locals warn you of an Ordâkhai encampment, a trading post of sorts. It is known as Tûl Zakana, the Well of Forgetting, whose waters will make you forget your troubles, and, if you drink enough, even who you are. But unless you are trading for this water, it's best to stay quite clear of the Well, for many have vanished near it, never to be seen again. You are now tasked by the families of the vanished with investigating the Well and its secrets.\q
<u>Sword-hall of Dol Guldur</u> \qThe Sword-hall of Dol Guldur in the central training hall of the Enemy's minions, overseen by three terrible champions of the Dark Lord....\q
<u>The Untamed Wilds</u> \qThe Beorning Vaskorn insists that a stand must be taken here and now against the approaching raiding party of wargs entering the Floodfells.\q
<u>Defence of Scylfig</u> \qThe people of Scylfig have been dreading this moment for quite a while. Now is the time for everyone to take up arms and defend Scylfig with their lives!\q

<u>The Dragon and the Storm</u> \qDahâl Huliz has long been home to many spectacular contests, pitting capable gladiators against all forms of opponents. Rothog has summoned you to witness the unveiling of his latest spectacle for the Arena.\q
<u>A Logical Appeal</u> \qAfter seeing the many hardships faced by the Men of Stangard, you and Gadda have decided to make an appeal to the leaders of the settlement.\q

<u>Dungeons of Dol Guldur</u> \qThe Dungeons of Dol Guldur are famed for their terror. Thrain, father of Thorin Oakenshield, perished here... though not before passing his legacy to Gandalf the Grey....\q
The bridge of Caranost is overrun. Battle the enemy forces back to relieve the threat against Sírlond.
Upon the High Pass, a terrible frost drake guards the mountain path….
Upon the High Pass, the Frost-horde has blocked the mountain path….
<u>Cease to Resist</u> \qYou have arrived at the location of the ancient forge, high atop Hurmulkezer. The ancient forge has not been used for some time and is capable of creating powerful weapons.\q

<u>The Shadow of Mordor</u> \qAs the Dark Lord's servants carry out the release of a mysterious prisoner, the Stout-axes rise in revolt, desperate to escape from the Dark Tower and flee to lands untouched by the shadow of Mordor.\q

<u>Fornost</u> \qFornost, the last capitol of the fallen North Kingdom. It is here that the Witch-king of Angmar crushed the realm of Arnor, and it is here to which Angmar has returned to conquer Eriador.\q

<u>Barad Guldur</u> \qBarad Guldur is the chief tower of Dol Guldur. From here, the Necromancer once viewed Greenwood the Great. Now the Lieutenant of Dol Guldur forays from this perch in search of the Company of the Ring....\q

<u>A Cornered Foe</u> \qGollum has been cornered by a cunning Orc-commander from Dol Guldur. Should he be captured, his knowledge of the Ring and the Company entrusted with it will be laid bare to the Enemy.\q

<u>A Secret Club</u> \qSomething evil is afoot in the Shire. Brigands in the employ of someone calling himself the Chief have overrun the town of Dwaling. Ponto Oats intends to give the Chief's enforcer in Dwaling second thoughts about trifling with the Shire-folk.\q
The dreaded two-headed troll Stûg-and-Zar lurks within this cavern….
In the icy winds of the distant snowfields, a dwarf expedition has been lost to the frozen drifts, waiting to be rediscovered….

<u>The Battle of the Way of Smiths</u> \qWith the revelation of Zigilburk, Mazog knows that the Heart of Fire has been discovered and seeks to claim the forge for his own. In the Way of Smiths, the dwarves must stem the flood of darkness and prevent the Heart of Fire from falling to the Orcs.\q

<u>The Skin-changer's Heritage</u> \qIn the vales of the Anduin, the children and grandchildren of Beorn live a rustic and peaceful life. Soon, they too will need to face the shadow that threatens all of Middle-earth....\q
Within the walls of Tûr Ágal, in Elderslade, an Angmarim sorceress has overtaken the tower, for unknown and nefarious purposes….
Scorpions near Dûlagig have been expanding their reach and are growing more aggressive in their attacks. Cull their number before they become an even greater threat to Urmâkh.

<u>Lady Éowyn's Charge</u> \qThe Lady Éowyn of the House of Eorl has been charged with protecting the people of Edoras. Soon, she will lead them to Dunharrow in the south as the forces of Isengard begin to close in.\q

<u>Gwathrenost, the Witch-king's Citadel</u> \qOnce the seat of the Witch-king of Angmar, the dread citadel of Gwathrenost casts a long shadow upon the city of Carn Dûm. All but abandoned after the Steward of Angmar was deposed, the remnants of the Iron Crown have crept forth from the shadows, seeking to master a lost artifact of the Witch-king and reclaim dominion over the realm.\q
A great leader amongst the Uruk from the White Hand was severely injured in an attack at Caras Geleden. You have been sent to finish the creature.

<u>Eithel Gwaur, the Filth-well</u> \qAt the source of the Morgulduin lies the Eithel Gwaur. It is the prison of Rauniel, the River Maiden, who seeks her freedom as she beckons you ever further into this watery chamber.\q
<u>The Battle at Frostbluff</u> \qA fierce cold has come down from the mountains threatening the games the children of Winterhome are playing in the fields!\q

<u>The Secrets of Seregost</u> \qSeregost, the big scary castle in Agarnaith. Nobody knows what's inside! Secrets and probably shiny things. Viznak, the best and smartest Goblin ever, with the help of his big strong bodyguards, will try to get in there! Oh, also, we will try to find out stuff about this new plague. Yes.\q
The fearsome hobgoblins have sworn themselves to the Frost-horde and gained terrible power in return….
Several scouts keeping watch on the hobgoblin's den failed to report back. They must be rescued before it is too late!
The fearsome hobgoblins have sworn themselves to the Frost-horde and gained terrible power in return….

<u>The Lord of Moria</u> \qFor a fearful moment, it seemed as if the Battle of Azanulbizar had turned against King Thráin and the Haban'akkâ, but as the horn-call of Grór sounded, Náin and the Dwarves of the Iron Hills charged forth at last.\q
At the outskirts of a dwarf camp in the Rushock Bog, you hope to put an end to the dwarf Olwir's plan to capture a Stone-troll and give it as a gift to the resurrected Skorgrím in the north.

<u>Nirgambâr, the Restless Tomb</u> \qIn a sheltered valley in the north of Khûd Zagin stand ancient, crumbling ziggurat-tombs of pale stone collectively known as Nirgambâr. Scouts have reported that one of the Zidemel's men, Andur, is said to have entered Nirgambâr drawn there by dark whispers. Locate and stop Andur before he can unleash what lurks in this cursed place.\q
<u>Starlight & Shadow</u> \qTurning Elvish relics to dark purposes, an evil sorcerer prepares to summon deadly shadows from the Void atop an ancient tower over Emyn Lûm.\q
<u>Whispers of the Forge</u> \qAyaluk's plan is set in motion...\q
<u>The Legacy of Durin's Folk</u> \qIt is a day of unity for Durin's Folk as we gather to celebrate our triumph over Sauron, welcome new allies from Mordor, and honour the return of old friends.\q

<u>A Sunset Storm</u> \qAt the behest of Céola, commander of the Rohirrim border-guard in the Brown Lands, you prepare to make a night-time assault upon Lashkarg, war-camp of the Khundolar... an effort that may be doomed if aid is not found....\q

<u>The Mustering</u> \qGrimbold has fallen into a deep gloom since the death Prince Théodred, and deeper still when Elfhelm and the Rohirrim abandoned him. He now awaits death as the last defender of the Fords.\q
Uruks besiege ruins across the land, and an organized attack is too dangerous given the forces available in the region. A task to help reduce the threat falls to you.
<u>Flight from Khazad-dûm</u> \qWhat has happened in Khazad-dûm? Whatever has befallen, the Iron Garrison is in danger!\q
<u>The King Under the Mountain</u> \qAt last, Dómor has returned from Mordor with a valuable treasure! Finally some good tidings!\q
<u>A True Friend of Durin's Folk</u> \qWho among us can deny the great deeds you have performed on behalf of Durin's Folk?\q

<u>The Vile Maw</u> \qWhither did the Watcher in the Water flee when it was driven from its lake? The Vile Maw would be my guess. Beneath the waters of the dark flood are ways which lead into the black depths of Moria....\q
<u>A Hard-earned Meal</u> \qGladion and his wife Limril have invited you to join them for a family meal, but Gladion's brother Fuirion has not yet arrived.\q
Goblin-town has long been a thorn in the side of the free peoples in Rhovanion. Once again, the goblin horde inside stirs….
Goblin-town has long been a thorn in the side of the free peoples in Rhovanion. Once again, the goblin horde inside stirs….
<u>The Day the Giant Came</u> \qNow that the escapees from Dunfast have recovered their strength and their hope, you must endeavour to pry their tale from them.\q
<u>Escape From Naerband</u> \qThraknûl, the chief torturer of Naerband, has locked his prison fortress down and looks to capture anyone disobeying his twisted laws.\q
Despite the failure of the Iron Garrison, the dwarves will not allow the Orcs of Khazad-dûm to spill forth into Azanulbizar, the Dimrill Dale.
Despite the failure of the Iron Garrison, the dwarves will not allow the Orcs of Khazad-dûm to spill forth into Azanulbizar, the Dimrill Dale.
Despite the failure of the Iron Garrison, the dwarves will not allow the Orcs of Khazad-dûm to spill forth into Azanulbizar, the Dimrill Dale.
Despite the failure of the Iron Garrison, the dwarves will not allow the Orcs of Khazad-dûm to spill forth into Azanulbizar, the Dimrill Dale.
Despite the failure of the Iron Garrison, the dwarves will not allow the Orcs of Khazad-dûm to spill forth into Azanulbizar, the Dimrill Dale.
<u>Into the Circle of Despair</u> \qTo further the conquest of Minas Morgul, we must brave of the horrors of the Lofty Watch-fort in the Circle of Despair.\q
<u>The Feast</u> \qYou have healed Khûtra! Now it's time to enjoy the feast you helped prepare and listen to a toast from Elder Roshat!\q
<u>Muckle: Moria</u> \q Within the depths of Moria there is an ancient battle taking place.\q
<u>Rapid Retaliation</u> \qOrcs have followed you back to Enârshan's home. Put an end to them before they can cause any harm.\q

<u>Bonds of Oak and Iron</u> \qAs the Battle of Azanulbizar continued on the slopes of Zirakzigil and Bundushâthur, King Thráin and his vanguard prepared to assault the gates of Khazad-dûm. Yet, unbeknownst to the Dwarves of the Haban'akkâ, there was unrest at Amdân.\q
<u>Ambush at Echad Taerdim</u> \qWe return now to Echad Taerdim, but something is amiss. There is a foul smell on the air… the smell of death.\q

<u>Five Against the Wold</u> \qAldor Harding is convinced that he will die to an Easterling blade... it has become our task to prove that men make their own fates. My companions and I will face the blades of the Easterlings, and we will prove victorious!\q

<u>Assault on Archet</u> \qJon Brackenbrook and his hunters have reached the outskirts of Archet to find it already ablaze! A desperate struggle to save their village is about to begin. Hopefully you have arrived in time....\q
<u>Mourning the Dead</u> \qAfter much bloodshed and loss, I have asked everyone gathered at my Pavilion to rest and mourn the deaths of our brethren.\q
<u>A Helping Hand</u> \qAs you make your way behind the secret door, more of Sêkhta's forces rise to stop you!\q

<u>The Riders Four</u> \qWe were dispatched by Lord Éomer to harry the Orcs roving the plains of the Mark, but what we discovered in the Brown Lands was truly terrifying. Now we ride through the Eastemnet on our way to Edoras, warning the Reeves of the Easterling horde marching upon them....\q
<u>Welcome to Harwick</u> \qAldor Harding requests your presence, and you can only hope that he has heard of your diligent labours on behalf of Harwick.\q

<u>The Forgotten Treasury</u> \qMany ancient halls lie hidden beneath ages of ruin within the walls of Moria. The dwarves seek to recover and protect their treasures of old, while the Orcs seek to exploit them. Soon, the Forgotten Treasury may become a battleground of terrible proportions....\q
<u>Nár's Tale</u> \qAlthough he has at last found comfort amongst Durin's Folk at the Lonely Mountain, the dwarf, Nár, has been witness to much hardship and tragedy throughout his long life.\q

<u>Fil Gashan</u> \qFil Ghashan is the stronghold of Talug, right hand of Mazog, Lord of Moria. Here, the Orc-general musters an army to make a futile assault upon Lothlórien. Here, he also breeds Orc-warriors of a most deadly skill....\q
<u>The Defence of Minas Tirith</u> \qThe War for Gondor begins as Sauron's armies march for Minas Tirith. Can the Men of Gondor master their fear before the Enemy claims the White City?\q

<u>Gath Daeroval, the Shadow-roost</u> \qHigh above the Morgul Vale in a cleft in the side of Achathras, Gath Daeroval is home to the Shadow-roost of the fell beasts. It is said to be home to Khatlob, the massive, voracious brood-mother of the roost, who laid the eggs whence sprang the mounts of the Witch-king and the other Ringwraiths.\q
<u>Respite in Shonith</u> \qAfter the struggles the pair faced, Raphûz and Ashâmi share time in Shonith.\q
<u>And Is Extinguished</u> \qKhôltekh believes that Sêkhta is stealing the Candle of Umbar, a ship docked in the Sail-haven. Help him apprehend Sêkhta!\q
<u>Instance: Gemyndsted</u> \qYou have followed Quickbeam's directions to the Library at Gemyndsted. Clear the forces of Saruman from inside and reclaim any relics and texts within.\q

<u>Hammer of the Underworld</u> \qThe defenders of Gondor struggle to hold the line as Grond, the great ram of the Enemy, crawls towards the gates of Minas Tirith. Grond must be destroyed before it can serve its vile purpose!\q
<u>Heirloom of Osgiliath</u> \qYour efforts to cleanse the evils from the corrupted rigging-hook have returned you to the city split by the mighty River Anduin....\q
TBD…

<u>The Secret Shadow</u> \qFor how long had this pass been concealed by the sorcery of the Nazgûl? Of this place, I have heard no tale from the Lord and Lady of Lorien nor from the Men of Gondor, but I dread what evils might lie hidden there, undisturbed by the fall of the Enemy.\q

For the forgeworkers who wish only to escape hard labour and the lash, there is but one hope. In this secret meeting with the Easterlings, they must somehow bargain safe passage far from cruel Mordor and vengeful Gondor and all they have ever known.

<u>Fil Gashan</u> \qFil Ghashan is the stronghold of Talug, right hand of Mazog, Lord of Moria. Here, the Orc-general musters an army to make a futile assault upon Lothlórien. Here, he also breeds Orc-warriors of a most deadly skill....\q
<u>A Reasonable Request</u> \qWynmar, struck by the beauty of Noriel, wishes to look upon the Elf one last time before accepting his people's banishment from Thinglad by its Elf-sentinels.\q
Goblin-town has long been a thorn in the side of the free peoples in Rhovanion. Once again, the goblin horde inside stirs….
Goblin-town has long been a thorn in the side of the free peoples in Rhovanion. Once again, the goblin horde inside stirs….

<u>Garth Agarwen</u> \qGarth Agarwen . . . The ruins of an ancient fortress of Rhudaur, now overrun by corrupted nature and a vile necromantic power out of Angmar. The most terrible power still remains to be confronted.\q
<u>Sparring in Minas Tirith</u> \qWith a battle looming, the soldiers of Minas Tirith stand restless in the Training Ground. Perhaps you can help them ease their nerves.\q

<u>Memories of the Last Alliance</u> \qHoping to raise the spirits of the Host of the West, Elladan and Elrohir have offered to tell the tale of a great victory over the Enemy at the end of the Second Age.\q

<u>Garth Agarwen - Barrows</u> \qAt the height of their kingdom, the Men of Rhudaur enshrined their dead within great tombs of stone and built into the ground. At the crest of the tallest barrow, Ivar the Blood-hand, awaits any who would attempt to cleanse the corruption from the land and free the Red-maid from her service to the Darkness.\q
<u>Lights in the Land</u> \qEnraged by your assault upon Lashkarg, the Khundolar retaliate against the Rohirrim border-guard, bringing their strength down upon the way-post of Etheburg....\q

<u>The Forges of Khazad-dûm</u> \qAt the height of Durin's reign, the Forges of Khazad-dûm were once famed for producing great crafts of beauty and majesty. Now they have fallen into misuse by the Orcs which now infest the ancient halls of Moria, spewing forth their terrible tools of war....\q

<u>Instance: Direnfirel</u> \qDirenfirel is a small lumber-mill that is now under the control of Saruman's forces. Remove the forces of Isengard from the area and gather what resources you can carry back with you.\q
A group of brigands led by Ulâmul the Talon has been preying on citizens along the road. Discover their hiding places and put an end to them.
Uruks within the ruins are an affront to every Elf. You are asked to enter the ruins and drive out the foe, purging the filth they bring to the Elven homes.
<u>The Fushaum Resolution</u> \qThe divided leaders of Fushaum Bal have called a meeting to put aside the bloodshed and find compromise over disputed land, resources, and riches.\q

<u>The Eldest House</u> \qWithin the deepest reaches of Gloomingtarn, the Angmarim of the Iron Crown have unwittingly discovered a long-forgotten passage rumoured to lead to the first house of Durin the Deathless.\q

<u>The Sixteenth Hall</u> \qThe dread malady that spreads among the servants of the Enemy in Moria is strong in the Sixteenth Hall. Whatever nameless thing dwells there has entrapped many an Orc to its service, poisoning their minds and controlling their actions.\q

<u>Marked by the Sea Shadow</u> \qBeset by a sudden murder, I set out to capture the person responsible... and insodoing, revealed a much larger plot... one whose shadow is cast far and wide over land and sea. We shall bring this person to justice, one way or another.\q
Helm's Deep Prototype - Render Test
<u>A Dark Gift</u> \qYou must move quickly into Angar Aragín to save Numûru!\q

<u>The Battle of the Deep-way</u> \qBori's failed raid upon Zabadgathol has brought the wrath of the Orcs down upon the dwarves. The encampment at the Deep-way faces a terrible onslaught from Mazog's horde. Are the Longbeards strong enough to face the challenge?\q

<u>Flowers for Eshtali</u> \qEshtali lies in the tombs of Esh-kimâkhi. In the fight to liberate Kûr Anzar, there was scarcely enough time to think, let alone mourn the dead. Now that the immediate threat is over, we mourn our fallen and remind ourselves why they still take such firm residence in our hearts.\q
<u>The Riches of Rhûn</u> \qBetrayed by the Khundolar, Jarl Gurthilm and his company now seek to punish their treacherous benefactor and seize the gold that was promised them.\q

<u>An Omen from the East</u> \qWhile confronting the treacherous brigands and Oathbreakers of Ost Celebrant, you have discovered a concealed passage that reeks of dread. What horrors could be lurking beneath the crumbling ruins?\q
<u>Beneath the Greenfields</u> \qThe goblins of Mount Gram have never forgotten their defeat at the hands of the Shire-folk, and revenge has brought them hither once more....\q

<u>Constables and Robbers</u> \qBrigands out of the Brown Lands have established a camp in the Rushgore from which to raid Parth Celebrant for ancient relics. After a diplomatic attempt to remove the brigands from the Rushgore, Aculf prepares to take more drastic measures....\q

<u>Herald of the Rohirrim</u> \qA brave herald of the Rohirrim has come to stave off battle with the Dunlendings, but one faction is bent upon killing him before he can parley with the brenin of the other clans.\q

<u>Barad Guldur</u> \qBarad Guldur is the chief tower of Dol Guldur. From here, the Necromancer once viewed Greenwood the Great. Now the Lieutenant of Dol Guldur forays from this perch in search of the Company of the Ring….\q

<u>Council of the Seven</u> \qBeyond the foothills of Zirakzigil, the Dwarves of the Haban'akkâ at last glimpsed Azanulbizar. It lay barren and silent, but so too had it seemed to Thrór when he met his end at the hands of Azog. On the eve of battle, King Thráin called the Kings of the Seven Houses to council at Amdân.\q
<u>Heirloom of the Eglain</u> \qYour efforts to cleanse the evils from the corrupted carving have led you to the Spring of the Red-maid....\q
The people of Iridír wish to prepare a meal and are in need of chicken eggs.
<u>A Secret Return</u> \qIoreth says the hands of the king were the hands of a healer? I must find Aragorn and see if this be so!\q
<u>Into the Circle of Madness</u> \qTo further the conquest of Minas Morgul, we must capture the Star-gazers' Spire in the Circle of Madness.\q
<u>A Quiet Meal</u> \qA familiar scene unfolds. A weary traveller, having just finished helping with a hard day's work, joins a humble family for a meal.\q
<u>The Choices of Master Samwise</u> \qWhere am I? Where have you gone, Sam? They've taken everything! Everything! The quest has failed!\q
<u>Instance: Strange Passers-by</u> \qThe Ent Ashlimb wishes to relay a memory to you, for something troubles his slow, sleepy mind.\q

<u>Fulz-zahar</u> \qNow established in the Twenty-first Hall, the Iron Garrison has dispatched scouts to the Redhorn Lodes in search of new sources of ore. In a small cleft along the region's southern borders, they have discovered Fulz-zahar -- a small mine upon which many big hopes lie.\q
<u>Stilling the Wade</u> \qSeeking to avenge the wrongs done to her people, Éowyn rides east to drive the White Hand from the Wade once and for all.\q
Traverse the steps of Caranost, and make your way deeper into the Orc-held ruins as you drive the foe from the field of battle.
<u>Sink or Swim</u> \qBingo has decided to master one final skill for his journey: he will learn to swim!\q
<u>Mistaken Identity</u> \qA frightful storm has descended upon the plains of Rohan, and it threatens to dampen Bingo's spirits!\q
<u>Treasure Lost, Treasure Found</u> \qDid Theodore Gorse come this way? And if he did, can you and Bingo bring him to safety?\q
<u>Through the Blockade</u> \qThe end of Bingo's journey approaches with every step, but rumours tell of a blockade that might slow his progress along the road.\q
<u>Enter the Easterlings</u> \qThe Rohirrim outpost of Stangard is endangered by a small party of Easterling raiders. Can the outpost be defended?\q
<u>Bingo's Burden</u> \qThanks to his fear of horses, Bingo has decided that his journey in Rohan will take place on foot.\q
<u>Dour Faces</u> \qYou and Spalvi have climbed high into the Redhorn Pass, looking for cave entrances that might bring you closer to finding Bingo....\q
<u>A Chapter About Elves</u> \qBingo is excited to take a pleasant stroll in the sunlight, leaving the dark passages of Moria behind him....\q
<u>A Restful Night</u> \qThe journey has been a tiring one already, and Bingo is ready to camp for the night in the wild of the Trollshaws....\q
<u>A Dangerous Detour</u> \qBingo's quest to have an adventure full of excitement and daring has now brought him up the Bitter Stair, to the dangerous stronghold of Helegrod...\q
<u>The Perfect Recipe</u> \qThe day of the party has finally arrived, and Bingo has sent you outside to greet the arriving guests!\q

<u>A Mysterious Council</u> \qThe flame from the scorched breath of a pygmy drake gave life to your torch, and a map was revealed to guide your feet to this chamber. Moria has many forgotten places, hidden by secrets that died with their keepers. What will your bright light illuminate now that the darkness is pierced?\q
<u>A Parting</u> \qLet there be an end to this delay. Farewells are never easy, are they?\q
<u>Long Memories</u> \qRemain alert for anything that might threaten the safety of Tornhad and its people.\q
<u>The Lasting Friendship</u> \qWe agreed to help Ravaedron with his latest task, but he has been taking his time with it, has he not?\q
<u>An Incident in the Camps</u> \qYou'll see. Whatever unruly outbreak there was among the refugees, my sword-thegn Athálrik will have dealt with it before you got there.\q
<u>The Reach of Justice</u> \qYou have found Athálrik. But I wonder, will he submit to the justice of this land? He seems to care for it only as a guise.\q

<u>The Abyss of Mordath</u> \qDetermined to wield the lost Ring of Power Manthríf once more, King Váskmun Greytooth has led his Firehorn Dwarves into the Abyss of Mordath, where the sunken foundations of Barad-dûr now rest. Meanwhile, the Order of the Eye has made haste to pursue the Firehorns, eager to avenge their fallen and contest the dwarves' claim to the greatest artifacts of the Dark Lord. Unbeknownst to any of them, greater still are the terrors Sauron hid away in the shadows of the Mordath....\q

<u>Fornost</u> \qFornost, the last capitol of the fallen North Kingdom. It is here that the Witch-king of Angmar crushed the realm of Arnor, and it is here to which Angmar has returned to conquer Eriador.\q

<u>Zigilburk Returned</u> \qThe dwarves Bori and Bróin have arrived at a momentous decision: to return the mithril axe, Zigilburk, to the place where it was found, never to be wielded by friend or foe again.\q
<u>Othrongroth</u> \qAn unholy alliance is forged within the depths of Othrongroth, the Great Barrow, a sinister pact which could spell doom for Eriador....\q
<u>Half-truths</u> \qElrond Halfelven has called a council together to determine the fate of Narchuil, the ring of Amarthiel, and to question Laerdan concerning his former captor....\q
<u>Bustle in the Blue Theatre</u> \qAfter negotiating a performance in the legendary Blue Theatre, the Cloudyheads endeavour to finally take the stage.\q

<u>The Bells of Dale</u> \qAid will not come to the Men of Gondor from the North, for in these last days of the Third Age, war has come to the foot of Erebor. Easterlings answering the call of the Dark Lord prepare to besiege Dale and the Lonely Mountain. The only comfort is that Mordor's host will also be bereft of these forces.\q
<u>A Ruthless End</u> \qArvaethor, a man with great passion for his home, would risk his life for the Vale. You have requested to join him on this dangerous errand into the hall of Nimrond.\q

<u>The Dome of Stars</u> \qOn the eve of Sauron's assault against Minas Tirith, ships of Umbar sail up-river to the White City. Meanwhile, atop the Dome of Stars, the Black Blade of Lebennin casts a dark shadow over Osgiliath and the host of Minas Morgul below. If his spirit cannot be banished to Mordor before uncovering Aragorn's gambit, it could spell doom for all of Middle-earth.\q
<u>A Gift for the North</u> \qThe Stone-troll of Rushock Bog... a terrible legend stalks the fens, enraged by the dwarves who seek to capture it....\q
Although the Dwarves of Gabilshathûr are no longer trapped beyond the Rammas Deluon, its miners face new challenges as the creatures of Angmar reclaim the fallen realm.
Atop the ruins of Caranost, a vile foe awaits you. Can you best this menace, or will you succumb to the strength of the enemy?
<u>The First Blade</u> \qYou stand at the steps of Cair Andros where the fearsome Sûhalar, Korpûrta, must face the consequences of his actions for the slaughter of Gilgír and his sons.\q
Within Valdhellir, the most vicious Wargs of Elderslade dwell in darkness. There, even the most skilled of hunters must tread with care lest they become the hunted.
Within Valdhellir, the most vicious Wargs of Elderslade dwell in darkness surrounded by countless skulls and other grisly trophies.
Within Valdhellir, the most vicious Wargs of Elderslade dwell in darkness. Drauglok, the leader of this terrible pack, poses a great threat to the Dwarves of Durin's Folk.
<u>Instance: Missing Friend</u> \qAs Oldheart's memory unfolds, you feel long, long years of loneliness fluttering away as a tiny bird hops about the grass, peeping and cheeping away.\q

<u>Fornost</u> \qFornost, the last capitol of the fallen North Kingdom. It is here that the Witch-king of Angmar crushed the realm of Arnor, and it is here to which Angmar has returned to conquer Eriador.\q

<u>Tumun-ghâr</u> \qWith lessons newly learned, the Iron Garrison cautiously seeks a local supply of ore within Moria to supplement their caravans. Within the Redhorn Lodes, out of the sight of the Orcs, they have discovered Tumun-ghâr. With high hopes, they delve into this long abandoned mine, being always cautious not to delve too deep.\q
Within the ruins ahead there are said to be great relics of the Elven past. You are to retrieve as many as you can for the Elven patron funding the expedition.

<u>Sarch Vorn, the Black Grave</u> \qBefore the fall of Cardolan, in the aftermath of the war with Angmar and the Great Plague that followed, countless dead were laid to rest in mass burials among the stones of a ruined temple of the Edain. Its name of old long since forgotten, it came to be known as Sarch Vorn, the black grave, and through centuries of abandonment, none save the most foolish or greedy dared approach it. But now the Witch-king of Angmar has returned to rouse the barrow-wights from their slumber and summon forth an ancient evil thought banished long ago: the Grey Fear...\q
<u>A Secret Chamber</u> \qAn ancient chamber, kept secret for thousands of years, has been discovered by our intrepid explorers. Perhaps it was kept secret for a reason.\q

<u>Inn of the Forsaken</u> \qYou have been asked by the proprietor of the Forsaken Inn to investigate the source of a terrible wailing noise coming from the basement. Rumours abound that the inn is haunted and as a result, business has been suffering.\q
Girhâzi has given the order to clear the Ordâkhai out of Omboha, their camp to the north of Iridír.
<u>Den of Pughlak</u> \qFar under Mount Gundabad lies the Den of Pughlak, the realm of the deepest of the deep toads.\q
<u>Searching the Depths</u> \qAnd so we return to Mâkhda Khorbo, the Temple of Sauron. I had hoped to never see this foul place again. And yet, here we are.\q

<u>Boss from the Vaults: Naruhel the Red-maid</u> \qThe Red-maid is lost -- or so it seems -- to the corruption wrought upon her land at the hands of corrupt Men. Perhaps you can discover a method to undo the damage.\q
<u>Travellers in Ithilien</u> \qSuspicious of an unquenched fire in the distance, Faramir led Anborn and the Rangers to a camp-site where they discovered neither Man nor Orc.\q
<u>Halflings and Oliphaunts</u> \qAs he and the other Rangers prepared a trap for the Men of Harad at Cirith Negen, Mablung found his discussion with the Halflings loudly interrupted.\q
<u>The Forbidden Pool</u> \qDown beneath Henneth Annûn, in the Forbidden Pool, Anborn spied the gangrel-creature at last and called upon his captain and the Halflings to decide its fate.\q
<u>A Troubling Path</u> \qAfter returning to Henneth Annûn, Faramir called for Anborn to escort the gangrel-creature to answer for coming to the Forbidden Pool without permission.\q
A vicious storm has driven a variety of creatures from the mountain. Snow-beasts have been pushed into caverns and represent a threat to the forces arrayed in Gundabad.

<u>One Hope Remains</u> \qWielding the broken sword Dunachar, Narmeleth leads a party by secret ways into the stronghold of Gador Gúlaran to face Mordirith, the Steward of Angmar, and Mordrambor his servant. It is hoped that Mordirith will remember the pain Dunachar inflicted upon him....\q

<u>The Flickering Flame</u> \qMany are the Hillmen of Angmar who have chosen to serve the Iron Crown. Now they seek further favour from their dark masters by sending an emissary to Minas Agar. If the Hillmen cannot be dissuaded, Eriador will surely fall...\q
<u>Facing His Fear</u> \qRaphûz asked you to assist him in facing his greatest fear.\q
<u>Proving His Bravery</u> \qRaphûz asked you to assist him prove his bravery.\q

<u>Instance: Siege of Óinsbridge</u> \qWhen the Ungoledain were driven out of Kêr Bréin, many fled and hid in the woods near Óinsbridge. Now the lumber needed by the Zhélruka to rebuild is in grave danger of becoming entangled in the spider-clan's venomous webs.\q

<u>The Trail Ends</u> \qThe Draig-lûth has captured many clansmen and women of the Uch-lûth and imprisoned them in a great cavern hidden behind a waterfall. It is the fate of these poor prisoners to be used as fodder to appease the gwiber and giants of Thrór's Coomb....\q

<u>The Streets of Râhal Bakh</u> \qFrom the apothecaries of Carn Dûm to Langstrand all the way to Umbar, Indagir now known as Khâshap has been transporting a draught of the vilest make. We now grasp at his heels as he makes his final attempt to deliver this substance to his master. We will not fail. We cannot. Khâshap must be stopped, now!\q
Ekhamâti soldiers are camped nearby. Steal their weapon caches and deal with any enemies you encounter.

<u>Instance: Scattered Friends</u> \qGandalf has found you deep in the eaves of Fangorn after you followed the trail of two lost hobbits. He wishes now to allay your worries for the vulnerable halflings and to tell you all that is afoot in Fangorn.\q
<u>Breaching the Necromancer's Gate</u> \qDol Guldur is a labyrinth of tight hallways and open courtyards. The Necromancer's Gate marks the entry into the heart of the fortress....\q

<u>Assault on the Ringwraiths' Lair</u> \qThe baileys of Dol Guldur are highly fortified, nearly impenetrable, and the finest of the Enemy's soldiers defend within. But before the rest of the fortress can be assaulted, these must be taken....\q

<u>Rage of the Erui</u> \qMaddened by the encroaching Haradrim, the Lone Lady has lashed out, raising the long-emptied armours of Men who fought in the Kin-strife to drown those who taint the waters of the Erui. Fearful of her anger growing beyond control, the Sisters of Lebennin have united to calm their Sister and bring peace to Lebennin once more.\q
<u>Sammath Gûl</u> \qSammath Gûl are the chambers once occupied by the Dark Lord Sauron in the guise of the Necromancer of Mirkwood. Stained by his presence, few now dare enter here….\q

<u>The Cost of Loyalty</u> \qAfter contemplating a vile symbol recovered from brigands, Doron, leader of the Oathbreakers in Parth Celebrant, has chosen to confess how he and his men came to be cursed.\q
<u>Carn Dûm</u> \qCarn Dûm, the capital of Angmar and the former stronghold of the Witch-king. Angmar's shadow has returned to this city in the form of the False King, Mordirith, Steward of Angmar.\q
A young man seeks his place in life and discovers it in service to the sea.
A first tour on the sea ends in a harbour town under attack.
While on a standard patrol beyond the Bay of Belfalas, the Mariner and crew discover the Corsairs responsible for the attack on Pelargir and prepare to apprehend them.
The bond between the Captain and Mariner grows deeper.
Far beyond familiar shores, at the tip of Andrast, the Mariner's ship, The Nenglor, traps the Corsair captain on the shore.
After receiving commendation for rescuing the captives, the Captain and Mariner rebuild the Nenglor.
A discussion of duty and vengeance aboard the Nenglor.
A discovery could restore honour and dignity to the Captain and so the Mariner set out to help his friend.
After a terrible wreck that cost all parties their ship, the Captain and the Mariner engage the Corsair captain and his lieutenants in a battle to the death.
You found the tracks of a terrible beast that must have gored the Mariner and put him into such a state. You pursued the beast to its cavern and must now face it down.
The Corsair captain is the true prize. Pursued for years across all of Middle-earth, cornered now in Evendim among the ruins and among the tomb-raiders. Mete out the final vengeance.
<u>The Ox and the Dragon</u> \qMeanwhile, Radanir of the Dúnedain brings tidings of Lheu Brenin's betrayal to the Uch-lûth in Enedwaith.\q
<u>Days Long Past</u> \qSheltered from the evil that has taken hold of the forest, Barallas wishes to recall the days before Núrzum's coming, when the Ents once met at the Enting Hollow.\q
Within the halls of Thikil-gundu, hidden riches await excavation from the darkest corners….
Within the halls of Thikil-gundu, the corpses of dwarves of old roam the ancient keep….
Within the halls of Thikil-gundu, Orcs from Gundabad have taken hold of the old armoury….
The entrance to Thikil-gundu has been blockaded by a terrible frost drake and her spawn….

<u>Iorbar's Peak</u> \qA stone-giant dwelling upon Iorbar's Peak has taken an egg from the eyries of the Great Eagles. Gwaihir the Windlord has requested that you brave the storms of the mountain and safely secure the egg before it becomes the giant's next meal.\q

<u>A Captain's Standard</u> \qDwarves of the Dourhand house have taken refuge in the ruins of Ost Galumar, not far from the mines of Othrikar, stirring the Longbeards of Othrikar to action. Jarl Copperbrace recruits the bravest of the brave to deal with the threat of the Dourhands....\q

<u>The Anvil of Winterstith</u> \qThrice, in times gone by, the Anvil of Winterstith opened and I and my horde were unleashed upon the world. Now my great glacier is riven once again, so soon after I returned. Who could this be at my threshold? What little, foolhardy mortals would dare disturb my solitude? \q

<u>A Steed Like No Other</u> \qA vicious and most dangerous lynx stalks the townsfolk of the Yondershire. Adamanda North-took will not rest until she has defeated this most deadly foe and saved her village. She needs your help to bring down this beast!\q

<u>Bâr Nírnaeth, the Houses of Lamentation</u> \qNone come unbidden to the Houses of Lamentation. And yet, here are the Living and the Deathless, uninvited and uninitiated. I have not forgotten the rites of old, Master, for Morloth shall soon drink of their blood. There is flesh to be flensed and there are minds to be broken... and all shall be left naked before the Lidless Eye.\q

<u>The Ford of Bruinen</u> \qThe forces of evil have marched up to the bank of the Bruinen and waited for the sign to attack. Dark clouds roll in as a great storm approaches. If the Ford falls, Rivendell shall not be far behind it. The battle is nearly upon you....\q
Orcs drive south along a tributary to the south of Maurûsh along the river. They intend to poison it, and you must stop them.
On a remote Shield Isle, a distinguished Umbari scholar lost his priceless research when he was attacked by large beetles. Recover the research and take the fight to these vile creatures.

<u>Into the Silver Deep</u> \qWhile visiting the Refuge of Edhelion under the care of your master, you find yourself in the midst of a brutal attack by greedy dwarves of the Dourhand family. Their king, Skorgrím, thirsts for power with an unnatural lust, and you are in the eye of the storm.\q
<u>The Taming of the Mearh</u> \qHot-headed and brash, Eorl witnessed his father’s death and vowed to avenge him.\q
<u>An Audience with the Cuan-lûth</u> \qThough Cariad would like for you to help him approach the Rangers, discussing such matters with the leader of his people may be another problem.\q
<u>At A Cross-roads</u> \qThe Cuan-lûth do not bow easily to those with power, and the Rangers of Tornhad are no exception.\q

<u>The Battle for Aughaire</u> \qMordirith, the Steward of Angmar was believed defeated, but such hope was in vain. According to the armies of Angmar, Mordirith has returned and now stretched forth his hand to crush the Trév Gallorg in Aughaire....\q

<u>The Heraldry of Lindon</u> \qIn the confusion which ensued during the abandonment of Dolendath, many things were left behind by Golodir's company, not the least of which was the breastplate of the Elf-lord Laerdan. But other things lie there as well... best left buried....\q

<u>The Skin of Bregmor</u> \qThe Champions of Eriador have been thwarted in their attempts to hinder Angmar's plans. All that remains to them now is to keep Angmar from claiming the hide of the dragon Bregmor....\q

<u>The Doom of the North</u> \qAngmar has gathered all they need to kindle the forges of Eregion. The Champions of Eriador must now travel to Mirobel and do whatever they must to foil the plans of Amarthiel....\q

<u>A Trap for the Creature</u> \qGarbert, a fisherman in Tâl Bruinen, believes a trap can be set for the skulking creature which has terrorized the scattered inhabitants remaining in the region. Nevertheless, the creature has been a wary and cunning opponent....\q
The enemies of Urush Dâr use the poison glands of the usan-kûni on their blades. We must do our best to reduce this practice.

<u>The Towers of Teeth</u> \qWith the Rangers of Ithilien establishing a foothold in the Slag-hills, the Enemy have retaliated. The Rangers seek to disrupt the forces within the Towers of the Teeth watching over the plain of Dagorlad for the Host of the West.\q

<u>Skoironk Caverns</u> \qWith the Rangers of Ithilien establishing a foothold in the Slag-hills, the Enemy have retaliated. The Rangers seek to push subterranian forces from the caverns of Skoironk, back into the depths and far from the Host of the West.\q
<u>The Bones of Barad-dûr</u> \qThe crumbled tower of Barad-dûr is still home to vast numbers devoted to their slain Dark Lord.\q
<u>Road on The Burning Mountain</u> \qThe ruined road of Mount Doom sits high above the scorched plains of Gorgoroth and has been a safe path for many foul things.\q
<u>The Tower of Durthang</u> \qThe fortress of Durthang, headquarters of Ugrukhôr's army, is one of the greatest threats to those in Udûn, under the banner of Gondor.\q
<u>Trouble at Bhol Rûdh</u> \qHome to the Red Sky Clan, the village of Bhol Rûdh sits isolated, and with little defences, at the end of a long mountain path.\q
<u>The Hold of Kála-murg</u> \qOne of the last hold outs of Orcs in Lhingris, the well fortified encampment of Kála-murg continues to be battered by Ungol forces.\q
Cirith Ungol

<u>The Clovengap</u> \qPrecious timber awaits those who brave the hidden dangers of the ethereal crevasse of Clovengap.\q
Public Instance: Battle at the Forge
<u>Houses of Rest</u> \qAncient moon-letters are waiting to be uncovered by those who brave the long forgotten halls, deep within the Pit of Stonejaws.\q
<u>The Gloomingtarn</u> \qMineral riches await those who brave the craggy caverns of Gloomingtarn.\q
Public Instance: Battle at the Lofts
